original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: panytsa skandha bi ba ra na /
analyzed: panytsa skandha bi ba ra na /
translated: Pa√±caskandhavivara·πáa

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: phung po lnga'i rnam par 'grel pa /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i rnam par 'grel pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Five Aggregates

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Part One

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: phung po lnga zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: phung po lnga zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: This treatise on Abhidharma is called The Five Aggregates.

original: bstan bcos 'di la thog mar 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / rang gi ston pa la mchod par brjod pa dang gsum bsnyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di la thog mar 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / rang gi ston pa la mchod par brjod pa dang gsum bsnyad par bya'o //
translated: At the beginning of this treatise, three things should be explained: the connection, the purpose, and the homage to one's own teacher.

original: mchod par brjod pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos la sogs pa las smos pa de nyid 'dir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mchod par brjod pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos la sogs pa las smos pa de nyid 'dir blta bar bya ste /
translated: The homage should be understood here as stated in the treatise on the Treasury of Abhidharma and so forth.

original: bsam pa des na slob dpon gyis 'dir mchod par brjod pa ma byas so //
analyzed: bsam pa des na slob dpon gyis 'dir mchod par brjod pa ma byas so //
translated: For that reason, the master did not make a homage statement here.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de srog chags rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus pas de'i phyir ji ltar bstan bcos nyung dus srog chags rnams kyis chos mngon pa khong du chud par 'gyur snyamüîΩpa 'di ni 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de srog chags rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus pas de'i phyir ji ltar bstan bcos nyung dus srog chags rnams kyis chos mngon pa khong du chud par 'gyur snyam pa 'di ni 'brel ba'o //
translated: The connection is this: the Lord taught the Abhidharma in the Hundred Thousand, etc., but living beings are not able to understand it. Therefore, the connection is this thought: ‚ÄúHow can living beings understand the Abhidharma through a brief treatise?‚Äù

original: 'di'i dgos pa ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgos pa ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The purpose is to discriminate the dharmas,

original: chos ni 'dir zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga dag go //
analyzed: chos ni 'dir zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga dag go //
translated: because the dharmas here are the five aggregates with and without impurity.

original: de dag rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan @2a # //üîΩnyid du bye brag tu 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: de dag rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan @2a # // nyid du bye brag tu 'byed pa ni /
translated: They are discriminated as specific and general characteristics.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Discrimination is the thorough discrimination.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to the noble path.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩchos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par nyon mongs rnams //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / chos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par nyon mongs rnams //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause without discriminating the dharmas,

original: gang phyir nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la //
analyzed: gang phyir nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la //
translated: there is no means of pacifying the defilements.

original: zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos gcig mngon par ma shes shing yongs su ma shes na yang yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur bar nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos gcig mngon par ma shes shing yongs su ma shes na yang yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur bar nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: And the Bhagav√•n also said, ‚ÄúI do not say that suffering will be completely exhausted without understanding and fully understanding one thing.‚Äù

original: mngon par ma shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon par ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon par ma shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot understanding‚Äù means not understanding through the path of seeing.

original: yongs su ma shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis yongs su ma shes pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis yongs su ma shes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot fully understanding‚Äù means not fully understanding through the path of cultivation.

original: de ltar dgos par 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar dgos par 'thad do //
translated: Thus, the necessity is established.

original: de la chos mngon pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su blta ste /
analyzed: de la chos mngon pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su blta ste /
translated: In brief, Abhidharma should be understood in two ways:

original: tha snyad pa dang / don dam pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad pa dang / don dam pa'o //
translated: conventional and ultimate.

original: de la don dam pa ni zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: de la don dam pa ni zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: The ultimate is the five uncontaminated aggregates:

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong pa'i phung po'o //
translated: the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of meditative stabilization, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the wisdom of liberation.

original: tha snyad pa ni shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad pa ni shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Conventional knowledge is the conventional cognition that is associated with discernment praj√±ƒÅ.

original: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skye bas thob pa dang / bstan bcos te /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skye bas thob pa dang / bstan bcos te /
translated: It is of six types: that derived from hearing, reflection, meditation, birth, the treatises and that of the bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar 'di ni @2b rgyas par bya na rnam pa drug gi bdag nyid la chos mngon pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni @2b rgyas par bya na rnam pa drug gi bdag nyid la chos mngon pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If it is explained in detail, it is taught that Abhidharma is the nature of these six types.

original: nges pa'i tshig tu bya na mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i chos dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs pa'i chos la chos mngon pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig tu bya na mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i chos dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs pa'i chos la chos mngon pa zhes brjod do //
translated: If it is explained etymologically, it is called Abhidharma because it is the Dharma that directly faces nirvana and because it is the Dharma that directly faces the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: 'dir bstan bcos su 'dod pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos su 'dod pa gang zhe na ;
translated: What is asserted here as the treatise?

original: de'i don gyi yi ge'i rnam pa dang / sgra'i spyi ste mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i don gyi yi ge'i rnam pa dang / sgra'i spyi ste mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is the letters that express its meaning and the general term for sound that is associated with nonassociated compositional factors.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul du na nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'chos pa dang / ngan 'gro dang / srid pa'i 'jig pa las skyob pa'i phyir bstan bcos te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul du na nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'chos pa dang / ngan 'gro dang / srid pa'i 'jig pa las skyob pa'i phyir bstan bcos te /
translated: In terms of the etymology of the word, it is a treatise because it protects from the enemy of the afflictions, from the lower realms, and from the destruction of cyclic existence.

original: de lta yin bas mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa rab tu bstan par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //üîΩngan 'gro las skyob pas ni /
analyzed: de lta yin bas mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa rab tu bstan par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro // ngan 'gro las skyob pas ni /
translated: Thus, it is said that it teaches both high status and definite goodness.

original: mngon par mtho ba rab tu bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba rab tu bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By protecting from the lower realms, it teaches high status.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'chos pa dang / srid pa las skyob pas ni nges par legs pa rab tu bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'chos pa dang / srid pa las skyob pas ni nges par legs pa rab tu bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: By subduing the enemy of the afflictions and by protecting from cyclic existence, it teaches definite goodness.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva also says:üîΩIt is a treatise because it subdues the enemy of the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin te //
analyzed: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin te //
translated: protects from the existence of the lower realms,

original: 'chos skyob yon tan phyir yang bstan bcos te //
analyzed: 'chos skyob yon tan phyir yang bstan bcos te //
translated: and has the qualities of subduing and protecting.

original: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med //üîΩces brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med //üîΩces brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: These two do not exist in other systems.

original: de la phung po lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de la phung po lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The five aggregates are the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the disposition aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

original: ci'i phyir phung po'i go rims 'di ltar mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po'i go rims 'di ltar mdzad /
translated: Why are the aggregates arranged in this order?

original: smras pa / gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i gnas yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i gnas yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: It is said that form is the basis of the five collections of consciousness and the object of the sixth collection of consciousness.

original: gzugs ni thams cad pas ches rags pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni thams cad pas ches rags pa ste /
translated: Form is the most gross of all,

original: de'i phyir de thog mar smos kyi tshor ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de thog mar smos kyi tshor ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: therefore it is mentioned first, not feeling and so on.

original: tshor ba ni rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir gsum pas ches rags te /üîΩ'di ltar 'jig rten na nga glad pa na'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir gsum pas ches rags te / 'di ltar 'jig rten na nga glad pa na'o //
translated: Feeling is the grossest of the three because it is the most active.üîΩThus, people say, ‚ÄúI have a headache,‚Äù

original: nga glad pa phyed na'o zhes tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: nga glad pa phyed na'o zhes tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI have a pain in my side.‚Äù

original: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Perception is the apprehension of the mark.

original: rnam par shes par sla ba'i phyir gnyis pas ches rags pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes par sla ba'i phyir gnyis pas ches rags pa ste /
translated: because it is easier to cognize than the other aggregates.

original: 'jug pa shin tu rtogs par sla ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'du byed rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba gsal @3a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa shin tu rtogs par sla ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'du byed rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba gsal @3a * //
translated: It is easier to cognize the gross than the subtle.üîΩThe aggregate of formations is more gross than consciousness because it is the manifest activity of attachment, etc.

original: bar rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bas ches rags so //
analyzed: bar rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bas ches rags so //
translated: It is easier to cognize the manifest activity of attachment, etc. than consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ni shin tu phra ba'i phyir tha mar bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni shin tu phra ba'i phyir tha mar bstan to //
translated: Consciousness is the most subtle and is taught last.

original: yang na snod la sogs pas phung po'i go rims bstan te /
analyzed: yang na snod la sogs pas phung po'i go rims bstan te /
translated: Alternatively, the order of the aggregates is taught according to their role as a receptacle, etc.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni snod lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni snod lta bu'o //
translated: The form aggregate is like a receptacle.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ni zas lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ni zas lta bu ste /
translated: The feeling aggregate is like food.

original: tshor ba ni sems can gyi lus la phan pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i phyir zas dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni sems can gyi lus la phan pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i phyir zas dang 'dra ste /
translated: Feeling is like food because it benefits or harms the body of sentient beings.

original: de ni myang par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni myang par bya ba'o //
translated: It is what is tasted.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po ni tshod ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po ni tshod ma lta bu ste /
translated: The perception aggregate is like a condiment.

original: dgra dang mdza' bshes dang tha mal pa la bde ba la sogs par mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra dang mdza' bshes dang tha mal pa la bde ba la sogs par mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with regard to friends, enemies, and neutral persons.

original: 'du byed rnams ni byan po lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni byan po lta bu ste /
translated: Formations are like the cook,

original: de'i dbang gis 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they bring about the maturation of what is desirable and undesirable under the influence of karma.

original: rnam par shes pa ni za ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni za ba lta bu ste /
translated: Consciousness is like the eater,

original: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the appropriator of the aggregates.

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness of pleasure and pain

original: rnam par shes pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called consciousness because it is conscious of pleasure and pain.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du byas nas rim par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du byas nas rim par gzhag ste /
translated: Alternatively, the order is established in terms of the order of the afflictions.

original: 'di ltar thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na skyes pa dang / bud med rnams phan tshun mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na skyes pa dang / bud med rnams phan tshun mngon par dga' ste /
translated: Thus, in beginningless samsara, men and women are mutually attracted

original: kha dog dang dbyibs la mngon par dga' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs la mngon par dga' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because of their attraction to color and shape.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po las thog mar kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bas gzugs kyi phung po thog mar smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po las thog mar kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bas gzugs kyi phung po thog mar smos so //
translated: Therefore, since the defilements arise first from the form heap, the form heap is mentioned first.

original: de'i sgo nas tshor ba la chags te /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas tshor ba la chags te /
translated: Through that, one becomes attached to feeling.

original: de la chags pa ni tshor ba'i ro myang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la chags pa ni tshor ba'i ro myang ba'i phyir te /
translated: One becomes attached to that because of the experience of the taste of feeling.

original: mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde la chags pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba la mngon par chags pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de la chags pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba la mngon par chags pa ste /
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúbecause of manifest delight.‚ÄùüîΩOne becomes attached to that, i.e., one becomes attached to the pleasant feeling.

original: de la mngon par dga' pa yin pas de'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po smos so //
analyzed: de la mngon par dga' pa yin pas de'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po smos so //
translated: Since one delights in that, the feeling heap is mentioned next.

original: tshor ba'i sgo nas 'du shes phyin ci log byung ste ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba'i sgo nas 'du shes phyin ci log byung ste ji lta zhe na /
translated: Through feeling, there is the perversion of ideation. How so?

original: bde ba la sogs par mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs par mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúbecause of the apprehension of signs such as pleasure.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: Therefore, the ideation heap is mentioned next.

original: phyin ci log de nyid nyon mongs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: phyin ci log de nyid nyon mongs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: That very perversion is applied to the defilements.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po la gnas pa de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po la gnas pa de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po bstan to //
translated: The aggregate of formations is taught immediately after the aggregate of consciousness because the aggregate of consciousness is the basis of the aggregate of formations.

original: nyon mongs rnams kyi 'gro ba gzhan la sogs par rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir te phyis bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs rnams kyi 'gro ba gzhan la sogs par rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir te phyis bstan to //
translated: The aggregate of formations is taught immediately after the aggregate of consciousness because the aggregate of formations is the basis of the aggregate of consciousness.

original: go rims bshad zin to //üîΩci'i phyir phung po lnga kho na ste /
analyzed: go rims bshad zin to // ci'i phyir phung po lnga kho na ste /
translated: The order in which the aggregates are taught has already been explained.üîΩWhy are there just five aggregates?

original: mi mang mi nyung ba 'di brjod dgos so //üîΩ@3b smras pa ;
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung ba 'di brjod dgos so // @3b smras pa ;
translated: Why is the number of aggregates stated as five and not more or less?üîΩBecause the aggregates are described as the self and what pertains to the self.

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag nyid kyis bdag gi ba'i dngos po dang bdag gi dngos po brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag nyid kyis bdag gi ba'i dngos po dang bdag gi dngos po brjod de /
translated: The aggregates are described as the self and what pertains to the self.

original: de la bdag gi ba'i dngos po ni phung po bzhis brjod de /
analyzed: de la bdag gi ba'i dngos po ni phung po bzhis brjod de /
translated: The self is described as four aggregates,

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed ces bya ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed ces bya ba rnams kyis so //
translated: because the self is described as form, feeling, conception, and the formations.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: gzugs kyi phung pos ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa lus kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung pos ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa lus kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
translated: The aggregate of form describes the body, which is the basis of the self.

original: tshor ba'i phung pos ni longs spyod kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung pos ni longs spyod kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
translated: The aggregate of feeling describes the entity that is the nature of experience.

original: 'du shes kyi phung pos ni tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung pos ni tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
translated: The aggregate of perception describes the entity that is the nature of designation.

original: 'du byed kyi phung pos ni chos dang / chos ma yin pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung pos ni chos dang / chos ma yin pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
translated: The aggregate of formations describes the entity that is the nature of the volition of what is Dharma and what is not Dharma.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung pos ni de dag gi gnas kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung pos ni de dag gi gnas kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod do //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness describes the entity that is the nature of the basis of those [other aggregates].

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na phal cher rnam par shes pa la ni bdag tu 'dzin /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na phal cher rnam par shes pa la ni bdag tu 'dzin /
translated: Thus, in the world, consciousness is generally grasped as the self,

original: lhag ma rnams la ni bdag gir 'dzin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la ni bdag gir 'dzin te /
translated: and the remaining [aggregates] are grasped as belonging to the self.

original: de'i phyir phung po lnga nyid du 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lnga nyid du 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that there are only five aggregates.

original: de ltar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can gang yin pa'i bdag de khas len na grangs can dag rtag pa dang / yan lag med pa dang / byed pa po ma yin gyi zab po la sogs par smra ba dang / bye brag pa dag byed pa po dang za ba po la sogs par smra ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can gang yin pa'i bdag de khas len na grangs can dag rtag pa dang / yan lag med pa dang / byed pa po ma yin gyi zab po la sogs par smra ba dang / bye brag pa dag byed pa po dang za ba po la sogs par smra ba dang /
translated: If one accepts such a self with such a nature, how could it be tenable for the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas to say that it is permanent, partless, and not an agent, and how could the Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that it is an agent, an experiencer, and so on?

original: gcer bu pa dag bum pa'i mar me bzhin du zhum pa dang rgyas par smra ba ji ltar 'thad de /
analyzed: gcer bu pa dag bum pa'i mar me bzhin du zhum pa dang rgyas par smra ba ji ltar 'thad de /
translated: How could the Jains say that it contracts and expands like a pot‚Äôs flame?

original: de skad smra ba dag gi ltar na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad smra ba dag gi ltar na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accepts such a self, it would be untenable to say that virtuous and nonvirtuous karma exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bdag rtag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the self is permanent.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las de dag gis bdag la phan pa dang gnod pa zhig bya grang na phan pa dang gnod pa gnyi ga yang bdag la mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las de dag gis bdag la phan pa dang gnod pa zhig bya grang na phan pa dang gnod pa gnyi ga yang bdag la mi 'byung ste /
translated: If the self is benefited or harmed by virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, then neither benefit nor harm would occur to the self.

original: nam mkha' ltar rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is permanent like space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la rtag par 'gyur ba med pa la phan pa dang gnod pa med pa de bzhin du bdag la yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu don med par 'dir 'thad do //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la rtag par 'gyur ba med pa la phan pa dang gnod pa med pa de bzhin du bdag la yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu don med par 'dir 'thad do //
translated: Just as space is permanent and unchanging, and is neither benefited nor harmed, so too the self is not benefited or harmed by the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: mkha' la 'char nyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: mkha' la 'char nyis ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the use of the sun rising in the sky?

original: de gnyis 'bras bu pag sa la yod //
analyzed: de gnyis 'bras bu pag sa la yod //
translated: The results of those two exist on the ground.üîΩIf the results are impermanent like the sky,

original: gal te pags 'dra de mi rtag / gal te mkha' 'dra 'bras bu med //
analyzed: gal te pags 'dra de mi rtag / gal te mkha' 'dra 'bras bu med //
translated: then the results are nonexistent like the sky.

original: yang na bya rog gi so brtag pa lta bu 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: yang na bya rog gi so brtag pa lta bu 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: Or what is the use of this analysis like the examination of a crow‚Äôs teeth?

original: dkyus ma la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyus ma la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Let us proceed to the main point.üîΩThe five aggregates are the treatise of Abhidharma.üîΩThe form aggregate is explained first.

original: de la phung po lnga ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos so zhes smras pa de la thog mar gzugs kyi phung po bstan pas de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa 'ba' @4a * //üîΩzhig la brtsam mo //üîΩde la smras pa /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos so zhes smras pa de la thog mar gzugs kyi phung po bstan pas de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa 'ba' @4a * // zhig la brtsam mo // de la smras pa /
translated: The characteristics of form are explained.

original: gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is form?

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: Any form whatsoever is

original: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o //
translated: All of these are derived from the four great elements.

original: 'di ni gzugs kyi phung po mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs kyi phung po mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the brief teaching on the form heap.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi zhes bya ba'i don gang yin /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi zhes bya ba'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äúgreat element‚Äù?

original: ci zhig the tshom za zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig the tshom za zhe na /
translated: What is the doubt?

original: 'byung ba'i sgra ni don du mar 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgra ni don du mar 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúgreat element‚Äù is used in many senses.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'byung ba'i sgra ni skye ba la yang yod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgra ni skye ba la yang yod de /
translated: the term ‚Äúgreat element‚Äù refers to origination, as in the statement:

original: zas bzhin sems can 'byung po rnams gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te skye ba zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: zas bzhin sems can 'byung po rnams gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te skye ba zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the four types of nutriment sustain sentient beings who are born and those who seek birth,‚Äù which clearly means ‚Äúorigination.‚Äù

original: bden pa la yang yod de /üîΩyang dag par smra ba zhes bya ba'i /
analyzed: bden pa la yang yod de / yang dag par smra ba zhes bya ba'i /
translated: It refers to truth, as in the statement:üîΩ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata is one who speaks what is so and not what is not so.‚Äù

original: phyir ro ; / yod pa la yang yod de /
analyzed: phyir ro ; / yod pa la yang yod de /
translated: It refers to existence, as in the statement:

original: bdag ji ltar gyur pa bzhin du brjod pa'o //üîΩsems can la yang yod de /
analyzed: bdag ji ltar gyur pa bzhin du brjod pa'o // sems can la yang yod de /
translated: ‚ÄúI will speak in accordance with what I am.‚ÄùüîΩIt refers to sentient beings, as in the statement:

original: 'byung po rnams la dbyig pa spangs nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams la dbyig pa spangs nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving abandoned the rod with regard to sentient beings.‚Äù

original: 'das pa rnams la yang yod de /
analyzed: 'das pa rnams la yang yod de /
translated: It refers to the past, as in the statement:üîΩ‚ÄúThe great elements of the past were not and so on.‚Äù

original: sngon byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word bh≈´ta is used in the sense of ‚Äúthat which existed previously.

original: mi ma yin pa la yang yod de /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa la yang yod de /
translated: ‚Äù It is also used in the sense of ‚Äúnon-human.

original: 'dir ni 'byung po gang dag 'ongs gyur na //üîΩzhes bya ba dang de bzhin du 'byung pos zin to //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'byung po gang dag 'ongs gyur na // zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du 'byung pos zin to //
translated: ‚Äù Here, the word bh≈´ta is used in the sense of ‚Äúthat which has come into existence.üîΩ‚Äù It is also used in the sense of ‚Äúpossessed by a bh≈´ta.

original: 'byung po yi chad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung po yi chad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù It is also used in the sense of ‚Äúbh≈´ta-afflicted.

original: cung zad ma rdzogs pa la yang yod de /
analyzed: cung zad ma rdzogs pa la yang yod de /
translated: ‚Äù It is also used in the sense of ‚Äúincomplete.

original: pha dang 'dra zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha dang 'dra zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù It is also used in the sense of ‚Äúlike a father.

original: 'dir 'byung ba'i sgra gang la bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir 'byung ba'i sgra gang la bya zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù What is the meaning of the word bh≈´ta in this context?

original: sa la sogs pa la blta ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa la blta ste /
translated: It is used in the sense of earth, etc.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag go //
translated: The four great elements are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: skye dang bden dang de bzhin yod //
analyzed: skye dang bden dang de bzhin yod //
translated: The word bh≈´ta is used in the sense of ‚Äúbirth,‚Äù ‚Äútruth,‚Äù ‚Äúexistence,‚Äù

original: sems can 'das dang mi ma yin //
analyzed: sems can 'das dang mi ma yin //
translated: ‚Äúsentient being,‚Äù ‚Äúpast,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-human,‚Äù

original: cung zad lus dang sa la sogs //
analyzed: cung zad lus dang sa la sogs //
translated: ‚Äúincomplete,‚Äù ‚Äúbody,‚Äù ‚Äúearth,‚Äù etc.

original: 'byung ba'i sgrar ni mkhas pas rtogs /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgrar ni mkhas pas rtogs /
translated: The wise should understand the word bh≈´ta in this way.

original: de dag ni 'byung ba yang yin la chen po yang yin bas 'byung ba chen po dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni 'byung ba yang yin la chen po yang yin bas 'byung ba chen po dag go //
translated: They are called great elements because they are elements and great.

original: de dag gi che ba ni de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi che ba ni de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their greatness is due to the fact that they are the location of derivative form.

original: yang na sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi phung po de dag gi shas che ba la brten pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / g-yo ba'i skabs kyi las kyi sa chen por gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi phung po de dag gi shas che ba la brten pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / g-yo ba'i skabs kyi las kyi sa chen por gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, they are the great elements because they are the basis of the predominance of the earth, water, fire, and wind heaps, and because they are the basis of the functions of support, cohesion, ripening, and expansion.

original: yang na sa chen por gnas par snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang na sa chen por gnas par snang ba nyid do //
translated: Or else, they are the great elements because they appear as the great elements.

original: chu dang / me dang / rlung ni 'jig pa gsum gyi tshe chen por gnas pa nyid du gsal te /
analyzed: chu dang / me dang / rlung ni 'jig pa gsum gyi tshe chen por gnas pa nyid du gsal te /
translated: Water, fire, and wind are clearly the great elements at the time of the three destructions.

original: 'di ltar mes 'jig pa na bsam gtan dang bo'i bar du tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar mes 'jig pa na bsam gtan dang bo'i bar du tshig go //
translated: Thus, at the time of destruction by fire, the first concentration is destroyed.

original: chus 'jig pa na bsam gtan gnyis pa'i @4b bar du g-yengs so //
analyzed: chus 'jig pa na bsam gtan gnyis pa'i @4b bar du g-yengs so //
translated: At the time of destruction by water, the second concentration is destroyed.

original: rlung gis 'jig pa na bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du 'jig go //
analyzed: rlung gis 'jig pa na bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du 'jig go //
translated: At the time of destruction by wind, the third concentration is destroyed.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the term great element?

original: 'byung ba sna tshogs 'grub pa la de dang de dag gi rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba sna tshogs 'grub pa la de dang de dag gi rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba dag go //
translated: They are called elements because they establish the various transformations.

original: yang na 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba ste /üîΩ'byung ba yod par byed pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba ste / 'byung ba yod par byed pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag pa ste /
translated: Or, they are called elements because they are the sources of the transformations.üîΩThey are called elements because they cause the transformations to exist.

original: 'byung ba'i yod pa rgya cher byed //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i yod pa rgya cher byed //
translated: They are called elements because they cause the existence of the transformations.

original: ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: khams zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term dhƒÅtu?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams so //
translated: It is dhƒÅtu because it holds its own characteristics and the form derived from it.

original: de la sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the earth element?

original: sra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang lus la sra ba yod pa gang yin pa de sa'i khams so //
analyzed: sra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang lus la sra ba yod pa gang yin pa de sa'i khams so //
translated: It is the hardness of the body.

original: chu'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: chu'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the water element?

analyzed: gsher ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang lus la gsher bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the moisture of the body.

original: me'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: me'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fire element?

original: tsha ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang lus la dro ba nyid yod pa'o //
analyzed: tsha ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang lus la dro ba nyid yod pa'o //

analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams la yang mtshan nyid de ltar blta bar bya'o ;

analyzed: / rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
translated: Lightness and movement. Lightness alone is sufficient, what need is there to mention movement?üîΩLightness is the characteristic of the wind element.üîΩLightness is the characteristic of the wind element.

original: /'o na lnga pa nam mkha' ji ltar 'byung pa chen po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na lnga pa nam mkha' ji ltar 'byung pa chen po ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if the fifth element is not a great element, how can space be a great element?

original: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not tenable that space has the characteristics of a great element.

original: 'byung ba dag ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang / gnod pa byed pa yin na nam mkha' ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang / gnod pa byed pa yin na nam mkha' ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The great elements benefit or harm sentient beings, but space does not do so.

original: snod dang zhig pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snod dang zhig pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Space is not distinguished from the destruction of the world.

original: gzhan yang 'byung ba chen po dag ni sa bon la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las 'gyur ba ni myu gu'i gnas skabs kyi rkyen gyis dngos por 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byung ba chen po dag ni sa bon la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las 'gyur ba ni myu gu'i gnas skabs kyi rkyen gyis dngos por 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, the great elements are transformed from the seed stage to the sprout stage, and so on, and become the conditions for the existence of the sprout stage, and so on.

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But space is permanent and does not transform in that way.

original: dngos po gzhan skyed pa ma yin no /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan skyed pa ma yin no /
translated: It does not produce another entity.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, space is not a great element.

original: de lta bas na @5a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na @5a * //
translated: Thus,

original: lus ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po nyid du 'thad do //
analyzed: lus ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po nyid du 'thad do //
translated: the body is tenable as the four great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag bshad zin to //
translated: The great elements have been explained.

original: de dag ni phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba nyid du blta ste /
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba nyid du blta ste /
translated: They should be seen as mutually arising in dependence,

original: ji lta zhe na shing dang / rdo la sogs pa la sdud pa dang / me 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang / ltung ba yod pas chu dang me dang rlung dang ldan par mngon no //üîΩchu la yang gru 'dzin pa dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba dmigs pas sa dang me dang rlung dang ldan par mngon no //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na shing dang / rdo la sogs pa la sdud pa dang / me 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang / ltung ba yod pas chu dang me dang rlung dang ldan par mngon no // chu la yang gru 'dzin pa dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba dmigs pas sa dang me dang rlung dang ldan par mngon no //
translated: because, for example, in wood, stone, etc., there is contraction, expansion, falling, and so on, it is evident that they possess water, fire, and wind.üîΩAnd in water, there is the support of a boat, heat, and movement, so it is evident that it possesses earth, fire, and wind.

original: me lce la yang 'degs pa dang / sdud pa dang g-yo ba dmigs pas sa dang chu dang / rlung dang ldan par mngon no //
analyzed: me lce la yang 'degs pa dang / sdud pa dang g-yo ba dmigs pas sa dang chu dang / rlung dang ldan par mngon no //
translated: And in fire, there is the support of a flame, contraction, and movement, so it is evident that it possesses earth, water, and wind.

original: rlung la yang 'degs pa dang / grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa dmigs pas sa dang chu dang me dang ldan par mngon no //
analyzed: rlung la yang 'degs pa dang / grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa dmigs pas sa dang chu dang me dang ldan par mngon no //
translated: And in wind, there is the support of movement, and the sensation of cold and heat, so it is evident that it possesses earth, water, and fire.

original: 'dir dpe ni phye dang lan tshva dang / phye ma dang / skom sbyar ba lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni phye dang lan tshva dang / phye ma dang / skom sbyar ba lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the example is like the combination of flour, salt, and spices in a drink.

original: da ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the derived form will be discussed.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is derivative form?

original: de yang rnam pa bcu gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bcu gcig nyid do //
translated: It is also of eleven types.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The five sense faculties, the five sense objects, and imperceptible form.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni gzugs skye ba na rnam pa lngas rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni gzugs skye ba na rnam pa lngas rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Among these, the four great elements act as causes for the arising of form in five ways.

original: skyed pa dang / gnas pa dang / brten pa dang / rton pa dang ; 'phel bar byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyed pa dang / gnas pa dang / brten pa dang / rton pa dang ; 'phel bar byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are called the cause of generation, the cause of support, the cause of reliance, the cause of growth, and the cause of manifestation.

original: de la skyed pa'i rgyu ni skye ba'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: de la skyed pa'i rgyu ni skye ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: Among these, the cause of generation is the cause of birth.

original: de dag med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not occur if they are absent.

original: gnas kyi rgyu ni rten gyi rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: gnas kyi rgyu ni rten gyi rgyu nyid de /
translated: The cause of support is the cause of the basis.

original: 'byung ba dag bor na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs logs shig tu yul na gnas pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag bor na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs logs shig tu yul na gnas pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because derivative form has no power to remain in a place if it is separated from the elements.

original: rten gyi rgyu ni rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid de 'byung bdag gyur na de la brten pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyi rgyu ni rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid de 'byung bdag gyur na de la brten pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of support is the cause of continuation, because when the primary elements are transformed, the derivative form that is supported on them is also transformed.

original: rton pa'i rgyu ni gnas pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: rton pa'i rgyu ni gnas pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of reliance is the cause of duration,

original: 'dra bar 'byung ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyun mi chad pa'i tshul ni 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra bar 'byung ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyun mi chad pa'i tshul ni 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the primary elements occur in a similar way, they cause the stream of derivative form to be maintained without interruption.

original: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu ni 'phel ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs brtas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu ni 'phel ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs brtas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of increase is the cause of growth, because when the primary elements increase, they cause derivative form to grow.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag ni rnam pa lngas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnam pa bcu gcig gi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag ni rnam pa lngas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnam pa bcu gcig gi rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, the four primary elements are the cause of eleven types of derivative form in five ways.

original: de la mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /üîΩyul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: de la mig gi dbang po gang zhe na / yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: What is the eye faculty?üîΩIt is the clear form derived from the four primary elements that is the basis for the eye consciousness.

original: blta bas @5b na mig ste /
analyzed: blta bas @5b na mig ste /
translated: It is called eye because it sees form.

original: dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to //
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to //
translated: The meaning of faculty is the meaning of dominance.

original: de dag gang zhig gang la dbang byed ce na mig gi dbang po ni mig gi rnam par shes ba mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa 'byung ba na dbang byed do //üîΩrna ba'i dbang po ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa 'byung ba na dbang byed do //
analyzed: de dag gang zhig gang la dbang byed ce na mig gi dbang po ni mig gi rnam par shes ba mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa 'byung ba na dbang byed do // rna ba'i dbang po ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa 'byung ba na dbang byed do //
translated: What is the controlling faculty of the eye? It is the controlling faculty of the eye when it is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.üîΩThe same applies up to: What is the controlling faculty of the body? It is the controlling faculty of the body when it is the cause of the arising of the tactile consciousness and of the factors associated with it.üîΩWhat is the object of the controlling faculty of the eye? It is the visible form that is the object of the eye.üîΩWhat is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.

original: de bzhin du sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po rnams kyang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa 'byung ba na dbang byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po rnams kyang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa 'byung ba na dbang byed do //
translated: What is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.üîΩWhat is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.

original: yul kha dog gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba ni yul gzugs kyi yul can mig gi dbang po ston to //üîΩdbang po de ni dang ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: yul kha dog gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba ni yul gzugs kyi yul can mig gi dbang po ston to // dbang po de ni dang ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: What is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.üîΩWhat is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.üîΩWhat is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.üîΩWhat is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.üîΩWhat is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.üîΩWhat is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.üîΩWhat is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness and of the factors associated with it.

original: gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'bras bu phyogs gsal ba ste /üîΩzho ga chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'bras bu phyogs gsal ba ste /üîΩzho ga chu lta bu'o //
translated: What is the visible form that is the object of the eye? It is the visible form that is the cause of the

original: gang yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung gi med na mi 'byung ba de ni mig gi dbang po gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung gi med na mi 'byung ba de ni mig gi dbang po gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The eye faculty should be understood as the clear form that is the basis for the arising of eye consciousness.

original: rna ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /üîΩyul sgra gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po gang zhe na / yul sgra gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the ear faculty?üîΩThe clear form that is the basis for the arising of ear consciousness.

original: yul sgras yul can rna ba'i dbang po ston to //üîΩdbang po de ni dang ba'i bdag nyid de /üîΩgzugs dang ba zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i 'brug gi phyogs gsal ba de zhog chu dang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yul sgras yul can rna ba'i dbang po ston to // dbang po de ni dang ba'i bdag nyid de / gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i 'brug gi phyogs gsal ba de zhog chu dang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The clear form that is the basis for the arising of ear consciousness is the ear faculty.üîΩThe ear faculty is the clear form that is the basis for the arising of ear consciousness.

original: gang yod na rna ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung gi med na mi 'byung ba de ni rna ba'i dbang po'i gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du rig par bya'o //üîΩde bzhin du sna'i dbang po ni sna'i tshigs kyi nang rol na'o //
analyzed: gang yod na rna ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung gi med na mi 'byung ba de ni rna ba'i dbang po'i gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du rig par bya'o // de bzhin du sna'i dbang po ni sna'i tshigs kyi nang rol na'o //
translated: The clear form that is the basis for the arising of ear consciousness should be understood as the ear faculty.üîΩThe nose faculty is located in the interior of the fleshy part of the nose.

original: lce'i dbang po ni lce'i dbus na skra'i rtse mo tsam ma gtogs so //
analyzed: lce'i dbang po ni lce'i dbus na skra'i rtse mo tsam ma gtogs so //
translated: The tongue faculty is located on the center of the tongue.üîΩThe body faculty is located on the entire body.

original: gzhan dag na re zla ba kham pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zla ba kham pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: According to another opinion, the moon is like a half-moon.

original: lus kyi dbang po ni thams cad du khyab po ;
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po ni thams cad du khyab po ;
translated: The body sense-faculty is all-pervading.

original: / gal te de ltan gang la lce'i dbang po yod pa de la lus kyi dbang po yang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te de ltan gang la lce'i dbang po yod pa de la lus kyi dbang po yang yod do zhe na /
translated: If this is the case, then the body sense-faculty would be present wherever the tongue sense-faculty is present.

original: gang gi yul drag pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi yul drag pa'o //
translated: The object of the tongue sense-faculty is the most intense.

original: mnyam par gyur na /
analyzed: mnyam par gyur na /
translated: When the object is equal,

original: lce'i dbang po yul sngar 'dzin te /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po yul sngar 'dzin te /
translated: the tongue sense-faculty seizes the object first,

original: za 'dod pas phung po'i rgyun za 'dod par chums pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: za 'dod pas phung po'i rgyun za 'dod par chums pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the person is first attracted by the object of taste, by the desire to eat.

original: dbang po rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbang po rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The sense-faculties have been discussed.

original: yul lnga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yul lnga brjod par bya ste /
translated: The five objects should now be discussed.

original: smras pa / gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is visible form?

original: mig gi yul te /
analyzed: mig gi yul te /
translated: It is the object of the eye sense-faculty.üîΩIt is color and shape, and also the form that causes the manifestation of visible form.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do zhes bya ba ni 'dir yul can dbang pos yul ston te /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do zhes bya ba ni 'dir yul can dbang pos yul ston te /
translated: The sense-faculty is mentioned in order to indicate the object.

original: mig gi dbang po'i spyod yul gyi don gang yin pa de gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i spyod yul gyi don gang yin pa de gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The object of the eye sense-faculty is called visible form.

original: de la kha dog ni rnam pa @6a * //
analyzed: de la kha dog ni rnam pa @6a * //
translated: Color is of four types: blue,üîΩyellow, red, and white.

original: bzhi ste / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'o //
analyzed: bzhi ste / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'o //
translated: There are four: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: de'i dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Its subdivisions are as follows:

original: grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / nam mkha'o //
analyzed: grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / nam mkha'o //
translated: shadow, sun, light, darkness, cloud, smoke, dust, and mist, and space.

original: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Shape is of eight types:

original: lham pa dang ; zlum po dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang / ring po dang / thung du'o //
analyzed: lham pa dang ; zlum po dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang / ring po dang / thung du'o //
translated: long, short, square, round, high, low, even, and uneven.

original: lham pa ni gru bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: lham pa ni gru bzhi pa'o //
translated: Square means having four equal sides.

original: kun tu dkyil 'khor ni zlum pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu dkyil 'khor ni zlum pa'o //
translated: Round means completely circular.

original: ri la sogs pa ni mtho ba'o //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa ni mtho ba'o //
translated: High means like a mountain, etc.

original: khron pa la sogs pa ni dma' ba'o //
analyzed: khron pa la sogs pa ni dma' ba'o //
translated: Low means like a pit, etc.

original: dbyibs mnyam pa ni phya le ba'o //
analyzed: dbyibs mnyam pa ni phya le ba'o //
translated: Even means having a level shape.

original: dbyibs mi mnyam pa ni phya le ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs mi mnyam pa ni phya le ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Uneven means having an uneven shape.

original: ring po dang thung du ni ltos pa'o //
analyzed: ring po dang thung du ni ltos pa'o //
translated: Long and short are relative.

original: gal te ltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir yongs su mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir yongs su mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are not established because they are different in relation to each other,

original: ltos pas tha dad par mi rung ba med de /
analyzed: ltos pas tha dad par mi rung ba med de /
translated: The long and the short are not unsuitable to be different by reason of dependence.

original: pha dang bu bzhin no //
analyzed: pha dang bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, the father and the son.

original: dper na pha la ltos nas nam du yang bu phar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dper na pha la ltos nas nam du yang bu phar mi 'gyur /
translated: For example, in dependence on the father, the son is never the father;üîΩin dependence on the son, the father is never the son.

original: bu la ltos nas nam du yang pha bur mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gang la ltos nas gang ring ba de de la ltos nas nam du yang thung ngur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu la ltos nas nam du yang pha bur mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gang la ltos nas gang ring ba de de la ltos nas nam du yang thung ngur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, that which is long in dependence on this, is never short in dependence on this.

original: gang la ltos nas thung ba de de la ltos nas nam yang ring por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas thung ba de de la ltos nas nam yang ring por mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which is short in dependence on this, is never long in dependence on this.

original: ring po dang thung ngur 'thad do //
analyzed: ring po dang thung ngur 'thad do //
translated: The long and the short are tenable.

original: gzugs bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs bshad zin to //
translated: Form has been explained.

original: da ni sgra brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sgra brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now sound should be explained.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: sgra gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgra gang zhe na /
translated: What is sound?

original: rna ba'i yul ste zin pa dang / ma zin pa dang / gnyis ka'i ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i yul ste zin pa dang / ma zin pa dang / gnyis ka'i ste /
translated: It is the object of the ear, that which is grasped, that which is not grasped, and that which is both.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the cause of the great elements.

original: zin pa zhes bya ba don gang zhe na /
analyzed: zin pa zhes bya ba don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of that which is grasped?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rten gyi dngos por gzung ba ste phan pa dang gnod pa gnyis kyi phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'jig rten na gang sems yod pa de zin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rten gyi dngos por gzung ba ste phan pa dang gnod pa gnyis kyi phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'jig rten na gang sems yod pa de zin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The sound that is grasped as the basis of mind and mental factors is called ‚Äúembellished‚Äù because it is mutually related to both benefit and harm.

original: de ltar zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis bskyed pa'i sgra de zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis bskyed pa'i sgra de zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The sound that is produced by the great elements that are embellished is called ‚Äúproduced from the cause of embellished great elements.‚Äù

original: lag pa dang ngag gi sgra'o //
analyzed: lag pa dang ngag gi sgra'o //
translated: The sound of hands and speech is like this.

original: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni rlung dang nags tshal la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni rlung dang nags tshal la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound that is produced from the cause of the great elements that are not embellished is the sound of wind, forest, and so on.

original: gnyi ga'i sgra 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni lag pa dang rnga la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i sgra 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni lag pa dang rnga la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound that is produced from the cause of both the great elements that are embellished and the great elements that are not embellished is the sound of hands, drums, and so on.

original: de yang bshad pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang bshad pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: That sound is also of four types due to the distinctions of explanation.

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa dang / yongs su brtags pa dang / grub pas bstan pa dang / tha snyad @6b btags pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa dang / yongs su brtags pa dang / grub pas bstan pa dang / tha snyad @6b btags pa'o //
translated: the expressions of the noble ones,üîΩand the expressions of the ordinary.

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i brjod pa ste /
translated: The world's expressions are the expressions of the world.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bum pa dang snom bu dang shing rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang snom bu dang shing rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: vase, woolen cloth, chariot, and so on.

original: yongs su brtags pa ni mu stegs can rnams kyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa ni mu stegs can rnams kyis brjod pa ste /
translated: The expressions of the tƒ´rthikas are the expressions of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gtso bo ni byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ni byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: primordial nature, creator, and so on.

original: grub pas bstan pa ni 'phags pas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: grub pas bstan pa ni 'phags pas bstan pa ste /
translated: The expressions of the noble ones are the expressions of the noble ones.üîΩFor example,

original: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: all formations are impermanent, and so on.

original: tha snyad pa ni 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i ste /
analyzed: tha snyad pa ni 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i ste /
translated: The expressions of the ordinary are the expressions of the noble ones and the ordinary.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as being based on the conventions of seeing and not seeing, and so on.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las ni /
translated: In the tenets,

original: rna ba'i yul 'byung ba chen po bzhi las grub pa'i gzugs zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i yul 'byung ba chen po bzhi las grub pa'i gzugs zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The object of the ear is sound, which is a form derived from the four great elements.

original: sgra bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgra bshad zin to //
translated: Sound has already been explained.

original: dri gang zhe na /
analyzed: dri gang zhe na /
translated: What is odor?

original: sna'i yul te dri zhi ma pa dang / dri nga ba dang / de las gzhan pa'o //üîΩdri zhim pa ni gang man ma na phung po'i rgyun rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sna'i yul te dri zhi ma pa dang / dri nga ba dang / de las gzhan pa'o // dri zhim pa ni gang man ma na phung po'i rgyun rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the object of the nose. There are good odors, bad odors, and those which are neither.üîΩA good odor is one which, when smelled, increases the continuity of the aggregates.

original: dri nga ba ni gang bsnams na phung po'i rgyun nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri nga ba ni gang bsnams na phung po'i rgyun nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: A bad odor is one which, when smelled, diminishes the continuity of the aggregates.

original: dri mnyam pa ni gang de gnyi gar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dri mnyam pa ni gang de gnyi gar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: A neutral odor is one which is neither of these two.

original: de yang lhan cig skyes pa dang sbyar ba dang gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang lhan cig skyes pa dang sbyar ba dang gyur ba'o //
translated: It is also natural, compounded, and artificial.

original: dri bshad zin to //
analyzed: dri bshad zin to //
translated: Odor has been explained.

original: ro gang zhe na /
analyzed: ro gang zhe na /
translated: What is taste?

original: lce'i yul te /
analyzed: lce'i yul te /
translated: It is the object of the tongue.

original: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba zhes bya'o //üîΩmyang bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba zhes bya'o // myang bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: There are six kinds of taste: sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.üîΩIt is called taste because it is tasted.

original: ro myang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ro myang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called taste because it is tasted.

original: de la mngar ba ni bu ram dang / sha kha ra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngar ba ni bu ram dang / sha kha ra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sweet taste is sugar cane, molasses, etc.

original: skyur ba ni tsha dang skyur rtsi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyur ba ni tsha dang skyur rtsi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sour taste is pomegranate, tamarind, etc.

original: lan tshva ni lan tshva lnga'o //
analyzed: lan tshva ni lan tshva lnga'o //
translated: Salty taste is the five salts.

original: tsha ba ni tsha ba gsum mo //üîΩkha ba ni pa to la'i lo ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tsha ba ni tsha ba gsum mo // kha ba ni pa to la'i lo ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Pungent taste is the three pungent substances.üîΩBitter taste is patola leaves, etc.

original: bska ba ni shing 'dzam bu'i shun pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bska ba ni shing 'dzam bu'i shun pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Astringent taste is the bark of the jambu tree, etc.

original: de yang yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / sbyar ba dang gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / sbyar ba dang gyur pa'o //
translated: Moreover, taste is pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral; it is natural or compounded.

original: ro bshad zin to //
analyzed: ro bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of taste is completed.

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig gang zhe na /
translated: What is the part of tangibility?

original: lus kyi yul te /
analyzed: lus kyi yul te /
translated: It is the object of the body.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi bzhag ste /üîΩ'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / lci ba dang / yang ba dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o zhes bya ba la 'jam pa ni gnyen zhing mnan par 'os pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi bzhag ste / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / lci ba dang / yang ba dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o zhes bya ba la 'jam pa ni gnyen zhing mnan par 'os pa ste /
translated: It is the four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements.üîΩSmoothness, roughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.üîΩSmoothness is that which is soft and yielding.

original: pags pas bshud nas de rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pags pas bshud nas de rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inferred from the feeling of smoothness.

original: rtsub pa ni rung rud po ste /üîΩreg bya tsam du zad cing bzung bas reg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsub pa ni rung rud po ste / reg bya tsam du zad cing bzung bas reg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Roughness is a coarse texture.üîΩIt is a tangible that is grasped by the body sense faculty.

original: @7a * // lcib dang yang ba ni srang gis bcal bas de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @7a * // lcib dang yang ba ni srang gis bcal bas de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Weight and lightness are understood through weighing.

original: grang ba ni rlung gi 'dus te reg pa'i phyir te /üîΩde ni dro ba 'dod par byed pa'o //üîΩbkres pa ni za 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba ni rlung gi 'dus te reg pa'i phyir te / de ni dro ba 'dod par byed pa'o // bkres pa ni za 'dod pa'o //
translated: Cold is a tangible that is grasped by the body sense faculty.üîΩIt is a tangible that is grasped by the body sense faculty.üîΩHunger is the desire to eat.

original: skom pa ni 'thung 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: skom pa ni 'thung 'dod pa'o //
translated: Thirst is the desire to drink.

original: gal te de lta na bkres pa dang / skom pa ni sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gal te de lta na bkres pa dang / skom pa ni sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su mi 'grub po //
translated: If that is so, then hunger and thirst are not established as derivative form because they are mental factors.

original: smras pa / rgyu la 'bras bu gdags phyir te //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu la 'bras bu gdags phyir te //
translated: We say that the result is figuratively designated as the cause.üîΩFor example, it is said,

original: dper na / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: dper na / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: ‚ÄúThe arising of the buddhas is happiness.

original: chos bstan pa yang bde ba'o //üîΩdge 'dun mthun pa bde ba yin //
analyzed: chos bstan pa yang bde ba'o // dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba yin //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is happiness.üîΩThe harmony of the Sa·πÖgha is happiness.

original: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde // zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The austerity of those in harmony is happiness.

original: 'di la me dang rlung gi shas che ste /
analyzed: 'di la me dang rlung gi shas che ste /
translated: Here, fire and wind predominate.

original: zas dang skom pa bzhu ba'i skabs nas lus nyams dma' ste /üîΩme dang rlung zhes bya ba'i reg bya de la brten nas 'bras bur gyur pa /
analyzed: zas dang skom pa bzhu ba'i skabs nas lus nyams dma' ste / me dang rlung zhes bya ba'i reg bya de la brten nas 'bras bur gyur pa /
translated: When food and drink are digested, the body becomes weak.üîΩBased on the tactile objects called fire and wind,

original: gnyen po 'dod pas bkres pa dang / skom pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyen po 'dod pas bkres pa dang / skom pa 'byung ste /
translated: the effects of hunger and thirst arise, since they are antidotes to hunger and thirst.

original: rgyu reg bya de la bkres pa dang sgom pa gdags so //
analyzed: rgyu reg bya de la bkres pa dang sgom pa gdags so //
translated: Hunger and thirst are imputed on the basis of the cause, the tactile object.

original: de ltar reg bya rnam pa bdun po 'di dang / gong du smos pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'di dag ni bcu gcig gi bdag nyid yin no /
analyzed: de ltar reg bya rnam pa bdun po 'di dang / gong du smos pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'di dag ni bcu gcig gi bdag nyid yin no /
translated: Thus, these seven types of tactile objects and the four great elements mentioned above are the eleven types of form.

original: da ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, nonindicative form will be explained.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is nonindicative form?

original: rnam par rig byed dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzugs te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzugs te /
translated: It is form that is derived from indicative form and meditative concentration.

original: bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is imperceptible and nonobstructive.

original: gzugs dang bya ba'i rang bzhin yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: gzugs dang bya ba'i rang bzhin yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is by nature form and action,

original: rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig par mi byed pas na /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig par mi byed pas na /
translated: it does not indicate to others like indicative form.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-informative action is of two types:üîΩ1. Restraint, which is the abandoning of immorality;

original: rnam par rig byed las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed gnyis te /
translated: 2. Non-restraint, which is the non-abandoning of immorality.

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed do //üîΩde yang dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed do // de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
translated: Restraint is of four types:üîΩ1. Restraint through absorptions, which is the abandoning of immorality;üîΩ2. Restraint of the code of discipline, which is the abandoning of immorality;üîΩ3. The restraint co-existent with meditation, which is the abandoning of immorality;

original: dge pa ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang tshig 'khyal pa dang / dag rtsub mo spangs pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge pa ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang tshig 'khyal pa dang / dag rtsub mo spangs pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: 4. The restraint co-existent with the meditation on the impure, which is the abandoning of immorality.

original: sems nyid las yin te /
analyzed: sems nyid las yin te /
translated: The first is the cause of the second.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dge slong dag sems pa ni las su nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag sems pa ni las su nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, I declare that intention is action.‚Äù

original: des bskyed pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dge ba dag go //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dge ba dag go //
translated: The non-informative action that is generated by that intention is wholesome.

original: mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed ni @7b srog gcod pa nas tshig 'khyal pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi sems pa ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed ni @7b srog gcod pa nas tshig 'khyal pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi sems pa ste /
translated: Unwholesome informative action is the intention to kill, up to the intention to engage in idle speech.

original: des bskyed pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni /
translated: Nonindicative form generated by that is also like that.üîΩ

original: mi dge ba dag go //
analyzed: mi dge ba dag go //
translated: Nonindicative form generated by those is nonvirtuous.

original: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni bsam gtan bzhis bskyed pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni bsam gtan bzhis bskyed pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'o //
