translated: Nonindicative form arising from concentration is nonindicative form generated by the four absorptions.

original: de ltar rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'di ni sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'di ni sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin te /
translated: Thus this nonindicative form is called restraint and nonrestraint and is derivative form.

original: las kyi bag chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is also called the karmic imprint.

original: rnam pa du ma de dag kyang gzugs rnam pa gsum du gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma de dag kyang gzugs rnam pa gsum du gyur te /
translated: These many types of form are subsumed in three types of form:üîΩindicative form that is demonstrable and impeded,

original: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa yang med pa'o //
translated: indicative form that is not demonstrable but is impeded andüîΩnonindicative form that is neither demonstrable nor impeded.

original: de la bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang / rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: de la bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang / rnam par rig byed do //
translated: Indicative form that is demonstrable and impeded is color and shape and indicative form.

original: yul bstan pas 'di ni 'di na'o //
analyzed: yul bstan pas 'di ni 'di na'o //
translated: The demonstration of the object is this is here.üîΩüîΩ

original: pha bi ni pha bi na'o zhes bstan du rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha bi ni pha bi na'o zhes bstan du rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is visible because it is suitable to be indicated as being here or there.üîΩThe other is not visible.

original: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other is the five sense faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body, and the five object referents of form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects.

original: bstan du med la thogs pa med pa ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa med pa ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The other is not visible but is resistant.üîΩWhy is this form that is not resistant and is not visible called the form heap?

original: ci'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bar 'di la gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya zhe na gzugs su yod pa'i phyir gzugs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bar 'di la gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya zhe na gzugs su yod pa'i phyir gzugs te /
translated: Because it is suitable to be form.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dge slong dag gzugs su rung ba gzugs su rung bas de'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs su rung ba gzugs su rung bas de'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, it is suitable to be form, it is suitable to be form, therefore it is called the form heap that appropriates form.

original: cis gzugs su rung zhe na /
analyzed: cis gzugs su rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it suitable to be form?

original: gzugs rnam pa gnyis kyis gzugs te reg pas gzugs su rung ba dang yul brtags pas gzugs su rung ba ste reg pas gzugs su rung ba gang zhe na /üîΩlag pa'i 'dus te reg pas reg pa dang / dbyigs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa gnyis kyis gzugs te reg pas gzugs su rung ba dang yul brtags pas gzugs su rung ba ste reg pas gzugs su rung ba gang zhe na / lag pa'i 'dus te reg pas reg pa dang / dbyigs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang /
translated: What is form that is suitable as form in the sense of being suitable as resistant contact?

original: sdig sprul rnams kyis reg na gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sdig sprul rnams kyis reg na gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is that which is harmed by contact with the hand, contact with a stick, contact with a stone, contact with a knife, contact with fire, contact with wind, contact with sun, contact with water, contact with cold, contact with heat, contact with hunger, contact with thirst, contact with flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles.

original: yul brtags pas gzugs su rung ba ni gzugs 'di dang 'di zhes bya ba dang / gzugs 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ@8a * // mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid dam /
analyzed: yul brtags pas gzugs su rung ba ni gzugs 'di dang 'di zhes bya ba dang / gzugs 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ste / @8a * // mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid dam /
translated: What is form that is suitable as form in the sense of being an object of investigation? It is that which is indicated by the words, ‚ÄúThis is form,‚Äù ‚ÄúForm is like that,‚Äù ‚ÄúForm is thus,‚Äù ‚ÄúForm is of such and such a kind.‚Äù

original: mnyam bar ma bzhag pa'i yid rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam bar ma bzhag pa'i yid rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is apprehended by the mind in a state of concentration or by the mind in a state of distraction associated with conceptualization.

original: yul zhes bya ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyogs la 'di dang 'di zhes bya ba dang / keng rus la sogs pa shes bya'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan la 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhes kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyogs la 'di dang 'di zhes bya ba dang / keng rus la sogs pa shes bya'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan la 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhes kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi bye brag go //
translated: The image is a reflection that resembles the thing to be known, such as a skeleton, and it is said to be like this and like that, with specific colors and shapes.

original: mngon rtags su 'dzin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon rtags su 'dzin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du shes pa'o //
translated: The sign is the recognition of that image, and it is said to be just as it was seen before.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.

original: de skad du don gyi sde tshan las kyang gsungs te /üîΩgal te 'dod pa tshol byed cing //
analyzed: de skad du don gyi sde tshan las kyang gsungs te / gal te 'dod pa tshol byed cing //
translated: The meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.

original: 'dod pa skyes pa'i lus can de //üîΩ'dod pa de dag ma 'byor na //
analyzed: 'dod pa skyes pa'i lus can de // 'dod pa de dag ma 'byor na //
translated: The meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.üîΩThe meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.

original: zug rdu zug bzhin gnod par gyur //
analyzed: zug rdu zug bzhin gnod par gyur //
translated: The meaning is the object that is to be known, and it is said to be just as it is.

original: zhes gsungs te /üîΩsems dang ldan pa la ni gnod par rung na sems med pa la ni ji ltar gnod par rung /üîΩsmras pa / gyur pa 'byung ba dag na gzhan dang gzhan du gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgzugs kyi phung po bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /üîΩsems dang ldan pa la ni gnod par rung na sems med pa la ni ji ltar gnod par rung /üîΩsmras pa / gyur pa 'byung ba dag na gzhan dang gzhan du gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgzugs kyi phung po bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning is the object that is to be

original: tshor ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: The aggregate of feeling will now be explained.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: The author says:

original: tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is feeling?

original: myong ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: myong ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is the threefold experience.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: Pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the aggregate of feeling.

original: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The threefold experience is the threefold experience in brief.

original: myong ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bas na myong ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bas na myong ba'o //
translated: Experience means to experience.

original: yang na myong bar byed pas na myong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na myong bar byed pas na myong ba'o //
translated: Or, it means to cause experience.üîΩPleasant is that which, when it ceases, one wishes to meet with again.

original: bde ba ni gang 'gag na phrad par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la bde ba myong ba 'gag pa ni med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni gang 'gag na phrad par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la bde ba myong ba 'gag pa ni med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The cessation of the experience of pleasure is its disappearance.

original: phrad par 'dod pa ni myong ba 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: phrad par 'dod pa ni myong ba 'dod pa'o //
translated: To wish to meet with it again is to wish to experience it.üîΩUnpleasant is that which, when it arises, one wishes to be separated from.

original: sdug bsngal ni gang byung na bral bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la bral ba ni so sor gyes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni gang byung na bral bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la bral ba ni so sor gyes pa'o //
translated: To be separated from it is to be dispersed from it.

original: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is the wish for something.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni de gang byung na gnyi gar 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni phrad par yang mi 'dod 'bral bar yang mi 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni de gang byung na gnyi gar 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni phrad par yang mi 'dod 'bral bar yang mi 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant is that which is neither wished for nor unwished for when it arises.

original: tshor ba ni gnas dang rang bzhin dang / gnas bsdu ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas rnam par gzhag ste /üîΩde la gnas ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba nas /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gnas dang rang bzhin dang / gnas bsdu ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas rnam par gzhag ste / de la gnas ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba nas /
translated: The feeling is established by way of basis, nature, inclusion of the basis, defilement, and purification.

original: yid kyi @8b 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yid kyi @8b 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The basis is from the feeling that arises from eye contact up to the feeling that arises from mind contact.

original: rang bzhin ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The nature is pleasant, unpleasant, and neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: gnas bsdu ba ni gzugs can dang / gzugs med par gnas bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: gnas bsdu ba ni gzugs can dang / gzugs med par gnas bsdu ba ste /
translated: The inclusion of the basis is the inclusion of the basis as form and as formless.

original: gzugs can du gnas bsdu ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang / mtshungs par ldan pa lus kyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs can du gnas bsdu ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang / mtshungs par ldan pa lus kyi tshor ba'o //
translated: The form realm is included in the five consciousnesses and the bodily feeling that accompanies them.

original: gzugs med par gnas bsdu ba ni sems kyi tshor ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs med par gnas bsdu ba ni sems kyi tshor ba ste /
translated: The formless realm is included in mental feeling,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: which accompanies the mental consciousness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni zang zing dang bcas pa'i tshor ba dang / zhen pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni zang zing dang bcas pa'i tshor ba dang / zhen pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Affliction is the feeling that is accompanied by material food and the attachment that is based on it.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa ni lus la sred pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa ni lus la sred pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The feeling that is accompanied by material food is the craving for the body.

original: zhen pa la gnas pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sred pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhen pa la gnas pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sred pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The attachment that is based on it is the craving for the five sense objects.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni gzugs dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'dod par byed pas 'dod pas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni gzugs dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba'o // 'dod par byed pas 'dod pas te /
translated: The five sense objects are forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and objects of touch.üîΩThey are called sense objects because they are desired.

original: don du gnyer zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: don du gnyer zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: They are called objects of desire because they are sought after.

original: / rnam par byang ba ni zang zing med pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa ste /
analyzed: / rnam par byang ba ni zang zing med pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa ste /
translated: Purification is based on the feeling that is not accompanied by material food and on the renunciation that is based on it.

original: zang zing med pa ni bdag la sred pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩmngon par 'byung ba la brten pa zhes bya ba la mngon par byung ba ni zag pa zad pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: zang zing med pa ni bdag la sred pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa zhes bya ba la mngon par byung ba ni zag pa zad pa'i lam mo //
translated: The absence of material things is the absence of craving for the self.

original: de la brten pa'i tshor ba ni mngon par byung ba la brten pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i tshor ba ni mngon par byung ba la brten pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The feeling that is based on renunciation is the feeling that is based on the path of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: de yang mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of that feeling?

original: myong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: myong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of feeling is experience.

original: myong ba rnam pa ji lta bus dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin par so sor myong ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba rnam pa ji lta bus dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin par so sor myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of the ripening of the results of wholesome and unwholesome actions.

original: ji ltar so sor myong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar so sor myong zhe na /
translated: How is it experienced?

original: las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni bde ba myong ba'o //
analyzed: las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni bde ba myong ba'o //
translated: The ripening of the results of wholesome actions is experienced as pleasure.

original: mi dge ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
translated: The ripening of the results of unwholesome actions is experienced as pain.

original: gnyi ga rnams kyi ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga rnams kyi ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: The ripening of the results of both is experienced as neither pleasure nor pain.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The foundation consciousness is like the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: tshor ba'i phung po bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of feeling has been explained.

original: tshor ba'i 'og tu 'du shes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i 'og tu 'du shes brjod par bya ste /
translated: After feeling, perception should be mentioned.

original: de smras par 'du shes gang zhe na yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de smras par 'du shes gang zhe na yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is perception? It is the apprehension of the sign of the object.

original: dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the apprehension of the sign of the object.

original: de la kha cig gol te /üîΩgal te 'du shes rgol sa chad dmigs @9a * //
analyzed: de la kha cig gol te / gal te 'du shes rgol sa chad dmigs @9a * //
translated: Some say:

original: pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: If perception is the apprehension of the sign of the object,üîΩit would contradict the sutra that states:

original: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / chung du'i 'du shes dang / rgya chen por gyur pa'i 'du shes dang / tshad med pa'i 'du shes dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes zhes bya ba'i mdo dang 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / chung du'i 'du shes dang / rgya chen por gyur pa'i 'du shes dang / tshad med pa'i 'du shes dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes zhes bya ba'i mdo dang 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
translated: There is perception of signlessness, perception of the sign of the object, perception of the small, perception of the great, perception of the immeasurable, and perception of the base of nothingness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes ni tha snyad la mi mkhas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa'o //üîΩtha snyad la mi mkhas pa ni ming ma bslabs pas gzugs kyi 'du shes ni yod kyi /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes ni tha snyad la mi mkhas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa'o // tha snyad la mi mkhas pa ni ming ma bslabs pas gzugs kyi 'du shes ni yod kyi /
translated: The idea of signlessness is the idea of one who is unskilled in verbal expressions, the idea of one who has entered into the signless realm of concentration, and the idea of one who has entered into the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: gzugs so zhes bya bar ni mi shes ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs so zhes bya bar ni mi shes ba ste /
translated: One who is unskilled in verbal expressions is one who has not learned names, and so has the idea of form but does not know the word form.

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //üîΩmtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la snyoms par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o // mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la snyoms par zhugs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is called the idea of signlessness.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang / mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga po thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang / mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga po thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: One who has entered into the signless realm of concentration is free from the signs of all forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tactile sensations, and the five sense organs such as the eyes.

original: mtshan ma med pa mya ngan las 'das pa la 'du shes pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa mya ngan las 'das pa la 'du shes pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The idea of signlessness is the idea of nirvana as signless.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo la snyoms par zhugs pa ni dmigs pa la mtshan mar mang du mi byed pas mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so ;
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo la snyoms par zhugs pa ni dmigs pa la mtshan mar mang du mi byed pas mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so ;
translated: The perception of the summit of existence is the perception of the signless, because one who is absorbed in the summit of existence does not form signs in regard to the object.

original: / mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes bshad zin to //
analyzed: / mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes bshad zin to //
translated: The perception of the signless has been explained.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes ni gang tha snyad la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes ni gang tha snyad la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The perception of the sign is the perception of those who are skilled in the conventional.

original: chung du'i 'du shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: chung du'i 'du shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perception of the small?

original: chung du'i ni 'dod pa'i khams te ngan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chung du'i ni 'dod pa'i khams te ngan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The small is the realm of desire, because it is inferior.

original: de la 'du shes pa ni chung du'i 'du shes te /
analyzed: de la 'du shes pa ni chung du'i 'du shes te /
translated: The perception of that is the perception of the small.

original: gang gis 'dod pa'i khams shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'dod pa'i khams shes pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of those who know the realm of desire.

original: rgya chen por gyur pa'i 'du shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgya chen por gyur pa'i 'du shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perception of the great?

original: gang gi gzugs kyi khams shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi gzugs kyi khams shes pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of those who know the realm of form.

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi khams ni rgya chen por gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi khams ni rgya chen por gyur pa ste /
translated: The realm of form is great,

original: de ni mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the highest.

original: tshad med pa'i 'du shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i 'du shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perception of the immeasurable?

original: gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched shes pa ste /
translated: It is the perception of those who know the sphere of infinite space and the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de nyid mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latter is infinite.

original: ci yang med pa'i 'du shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i 'du shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is the notion of nothingness?

original: gang gis ci yang med pa'i skye mched shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis ci yang med pa'i skye mched shes pa'o //
translated: It is the notion that apprehends the sphere of nothingness.

original: de lta bas na 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gal ba med de /
translated: Thus there is no contradiction,

original: chos mngon pa las dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag 'dzin @9b pa'i 'du shes zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag 'dzin @9b pa'i 'du shes zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the Abhidharma it is said that the notion is the apprehension of the distinction of the object and its aspect.

original: gal te de ltar 'du shes kyang yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid yin na rnam par shes pa dang 'di gnyis bye brag ci yod /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'du shes kyang yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid yin na rnam par shes pa dang 'di gnyis bye brag ci yod /
translated: If the notion is also of the nature of determination, what is the difference between the two, the notion and consciousness?

original: smras pa / bye brag phye ste rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don tsam 'dzin to //
analyzed: smras pa / bye brag phye ste rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don tsam 'dzin to //
translated: We reply: Consciousness is distinguished as the mere apprehension of the object, form, etc.

original: 'du shes ni yul de nyid yongs su bcad nas nges par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes ni yul de nyid yongs su bcad nas nges par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The notion is the apprehension of the object as determined and ascertained.

original: 'di ni bye brag go //
analyzed: 'di ni bye brag go //
translated: This is the difference.

original: 'di'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus te shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus te shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Its characteristic is the characteristic of the coming together of the three.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa ci 'dra ba bas ji ltar mthong ba dang / thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don tha snyad 'dogs pa'o ;
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa ci 'dra ba bas ji ltar mthong ba dang / thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don tha snyad 'dogs pa'o ;
translated: It is the designation of the object that is seen, heard, discerned, or known, in whatever way it is seen, heard, discerned, or known, whether it is seen, heard, discerned, or known as having signs or as signless, as having a cause or as causeless, as having a result or as causeless, as having a result or as without a result, as defiled or as purified, as compounded or as uncompounded.

original: / mthong ba gang mig gis myong ba'o //
analyzed: / mthong ba gang mig gis myong ba'o //
translated: What is seen? It is the experience of the eye.

original: thos pa ni gang rna bas myong ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni gang rna bas myong ba'o //
translated: What is heard? It is the experience of the ear.

original: bye brag phyed pa ni gang bdag gis 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhes dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag phyed pa ni gang bdag gis 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhes dpyod pa'o //
translated: What is discerned? It is the analysis of what is seen, heard, and cognized, such as, ‚ÄúIt is like this, not like that.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa ni bdag nyid kyis myong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni bdag nyid kyis myong ba'o //
translated: What is cognized? It is the experience of the mind.

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dag gis go bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dag gis go bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is designated? It is the expression of what is seen, heard, discerned, and cognized through speech.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of perception has now been explained.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po brjod par bye ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po brjod par bye ste /
translated: After the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of formations should be mentioned.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What are formations?

original: 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the aggregate of formations.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni tshor ba yang sems las byung ba'i chos yin la 'du shes kyang sems las byung ba'i chos yin pas de gnyis bton te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni tshor ba yang sems las byung ba'i chos yin la 'du shes kyang sems las byung ba'i chos yin pas de gnyis bton te /
translated: Since feeling is a mental factor and discernment is a mental factor, they are excluded.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gang dag reg pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang / thogs pa la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gang dag reg pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang / thogs pa la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: All other mental factors such as contact, attention and so on and all non-associated compositional factors such as acquisition and so on are included in the aggregate of formation.

original: gal te de ltar na tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis sems las byung bar 'dra ba las ci'i phyir phung po re res byas la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis sems las byung bar 'dra ba las ci'i phyir phung po re res byas la /
translated: If that is so, then since feeling and discernment are similar in being mental factors, why are they each made into a separate aggregate?

original: reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa phung po re rer ma byas /
analyzed: reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa phung po re rer ma byas /
translated: Why are contact, attention and so on not made into separate aggregates?

original: smras pa / tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis phung po re rer so sor bya dgos te /
analyzed: smras pa / tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis phung po re rer so sor bya dgos te /
translated: It is said that feeling and discernment must be made into separate aggregates.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba dang / 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba dang / 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the root of dispute and the cause of cyclic existence.

original: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba gnyis te /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba gnyis te /
translated: There are two roots of dispute:

original: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / lta ba la lhag par zhen pa'o//
analyzed: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / lta ba la lhag par zhen pa'o//
translated: attachment to sense objects and attachment to views.

original: @10a * // ji skad du 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcing ba dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags pa'i rgyus khyim pa rnams dang khang khyim pa rnams rtsod do //
analyzed: @10a * // ji skad du 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcing ba dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags pa'i rgyus khyim pa rnams dang khang khyim pa rnams rtsod do //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúHouseholders and renunciates dispute with each other because of attachment to sense objects, excessive attachment, bondage, complete bondage, and complete attachment to sense objects.

original: lta ba la 'dod chags pa dang lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcing ba dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags pa'i rgyus rab tu byung ba rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams rtsod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩde la snga ma ni tshor bas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba la 'dod chags pa dang lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcing ba dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags pa'i rgyus rab tu byung ba rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams rtsod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // de la snga ma ni tshor bas bskyed pa'o //
translated: Renunciates dispute with each other because of attachment to views, excessive attachment, complete attachment, bondage, complete bondage, and complete attachment to views.‚ÄùüîΩThe former is produced by feeling.

original: cig shos ni 'du shes kyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni 'du shes kyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: The latter is produced by ideation.

original: tshor ba la ro myong ba'i dbang gis 'dod pa rnams la mngon par chags so //
analyzed: tshor ba la ro myong ba'i dbang gis 'dod pa rnams la mngon par chags so //
translated: Due to the power of relishing feelings, one becomes attached to desires.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log gi gi dbang gis bdag tu lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log gi gi dbang gis bdag tu lta ba ste /
translated: Due to the power of distorted perception, one views a self.

original: chos su 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa ni lta ba de dang de dag las mngon par chags so //
analyzed: chos su 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa ni lta ba de dang de dag las mngon par chags so //
translated: One becomes attached to those views through the perception of dharmas and the perception of a self in selflessness, etc.üîΩDue to the power of attachment to feelings and distorted perception, one cycles.

original: tshor ba la zhen pa dang / 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis 'khor ro zhes bya ba ni srid pa la spyod pa'i tshor ba la zhen pa ni tshor ba'i dbang gis 'khor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen pa dang / 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis 'khor ro zhes bya ba ni srid pa la spyod pa'i tshor ba la zhen pa ni tshor ba'i dbang gis 'khor ro //
translated: One who engages in feelings that experience existence cycles due to the power of feelings.

original: lta ba la spyod pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis 'khor ro //
analyzed: lta ba la spyod pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis 'khor ro //
translated: One who engages in views cycles due to the power of distorted perception.

original: de ltar na sred pa la sbyor ba'i tshor ba dang / lta ba la spyod pa'i 'du shes ni 'khor ba'i rgyus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sred pa la sbyor ba'i tshor ba dang / lta ba la spyod pa'i 'du shes ni 'khor ba'i rgyus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, feelings that are the cause of craving and perception that is the cause of engaging in views are the causes of cycling.

original: yang na tshor ba la zhen pa dang / 'du shes phyin ci log ces bya ba ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi'i 'du shes kyis 'khor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na tshor ba la zhen pa dang / 'du shes phyin ci log ces bya ba ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi'i 'du shes kyis 'khor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The notion of self refers to the four errors.

original: de lta bas na 'di gnyis so sor phung por bya bar 'thad de /üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes las gzhan pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di gnyis so sor phung por bya bar 'thad de / tshor ba dang / 'du shes las gzhan pa /
translated: Thus, it is correct to make a separate aggregate of sensation and of notion.üîΩThe aggregate of formations is what is called the formations other than sensation and notion,

original: reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya na /
analyzed: reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya na /
translated: such as contact and mental attention.

original: gal te de lta na ni mdo dang 'gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sems pa'i tshogs drug la 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni mdo dang 'gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sems pa'i tshogs drug la 'du byed rnams te /
translated: If that is so, then it contradicts the sutra, for the Fortunate One says: ‚ÄúThe formations are the six groups of volition.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba sems pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i sems pa'i bar du'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba sems pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i sems pa'i bar du'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are the volition arisen from the contact with the eye up to the volition arisen from the contact with the mind.

original: der ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gtso bor sems pa la 'du byed du gsungs te /
analyzed: der ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gtso bor sems pa la 'du byed du gsungs te /
translated: ‚Äù In this passage, the Fortunate One designates volition as the principal factor among the formations.

original: de ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: Volition is called the principal factor because it is the instigator of thought.

original: ji skad du dge ba la yang sems gtong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji skad du dge ba la yang sems gtong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is said, ‚ÄúOne should also give one‚Äôs mind to virtue.‚Äù

original: de bas na reg pa la sogs pa yang 'du byed kyi phung po'i nang du 'dus @10b par 'thad do //
analyzed: de bas na reg pa la sogs pa yang 'du byed kyi phung po'i nang du 'dus @10b par 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable to include contact and so on in the aggregate of formation.

original: 'jig rten na yang gtso bo bstan par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang gtso bo bstan par mthong ste /
translated: In the world, the principal thing is taught.

original: dper na rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba la rgyal po 'ba' zhig 'ong ba ma yin gyis de dang ma bral ba'i glang po che dang / rta dang shing rta la sogs pa yang 'ong ste /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba la rgyal po 'ba' zhig 'ong ba ma yin gyis de dang ma bral ba'i glang po che dang / rta dang shing rta la sogs pa yang 'ong ste /
translated: For example, when it is said, ‚ÄúThe king is coming,‚Äù it is not only the king who is coming, but also the king‚Äôs elephant, horse, chariot, and so on, which are not separate from him.

original: nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault.

original: de la sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the mental factors?

original: chos gang dag sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos gang dag sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
translated: They are phenomena that are concomitant with the mind.

original: ci'i phyir mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: Why are they concomitant?

original: mtshungs pa rnam pa ldas mtshungs par ldan pa rnams te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnam pa ldas mtshungs par ldan pa rnams te /
translated: They are concomitant through five types of concomitance:

original: gnas dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gnas dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: concomitance of basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: dbang po la gnas pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ dmigs pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po la gnas pa'i phyir ro ; / dmigs pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are based on the sense faculty;üîΩbecause they grasp the object;

original: dmigs pa de nyid kyi rnam pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs pa de nyid kyi rnam pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they grasp the aspect of that object;

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because they are called the aspects of blue, etc.

original: mtshungs par lhan cig dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par lhan cig dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are associated because they arise in a homogeneous, simultaneous, and unitary manner.

original: rdzas mtshungs par ni thams cad kyang rdzas re re'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdzas mtshungs par ni thams cad kyang rdzas re re'i phyir te /
translated: They are homogeneous in substance, because each is a single substance.

original: rgyu de dag gis mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de dag gis mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are associated by these causes.

original: sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan ba ma yin te /
translated: The mind is not associated with another mind,

original: mi 'phrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'phrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not contact each other.

original: de dag ni reg pa nas dpyod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de dag ni reg pa nas dpyod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: They are contact, etc., up to investigation.

original: de rnams las lnga ni kun tu 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams las lnga ni kun tu 'gro ba'o //
translated: Among them, five are omnipresent.

original: lnga ni yul so sor nges pa'o //
analyzed: lnga ni yul so sor nges pa'o //
translated: Five are determined by their object-field.

original: bcu gcig ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig ni dge ba'o //
translated: Eleven are wholesome.

original: drug ni nyon mongs pa'o ;
analyzed: drug ni nyon mongs pa'o ;
translated: Six are defilements.

original: / lhag ma ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: / lhag ma ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The rest are secondary defilements.

original: bzhi ni gzhan du yang 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: bzhi ni gzhan du yang 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Four are also indeterminate.

original: lnga kun tu 'gro ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: lnga kun tu 'gro ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The five omnipresent mental factors are feeling, perception, intention, contact, and mental attention.

original: de dag ni sems thams cad dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la yang 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: de dag ni sems thams cad dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la yang 'byung ngo ;
translated: They occur in all minds, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral.

original: / de la sems dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: / de la sems dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: A virtuous mind is concomitant with faith and so on.

original: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: A nonvirtuous mind is concomitant with attachment and so on.

original: de gnyi ga ma yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga ma yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: A mind that is neither of those two is neutral.

original: yul so sor nges pa lnga ni 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ste /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa lnga ni 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ste /
translated: The five object determining mental factors are aspiration, resolution, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.üîΩWherever aspiration occurs, there is definitely also intention, contact, feeling, discernment, and attention.

original: mos pa gang du 'byung ba der gdon mi za bar 'dun pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mos pa gang du 'byung ba der gdon mi za bar 'dun pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Wherever aspiration occurs, there is definitely also intention, contact, feeling, discernment, and attention.

original: de dag ni phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir yul so sor nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir yul so sor nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúdeterminate with respect to their object‚Äù because they are mutually non-deprived.

original: bcu gcig dge ba ni dad pa nas rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig dge ba ni dad pa nas rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The eleven virtuous mental factors are faith, conscience, shame, absence of greed, absence of hatred, absence of ignorance, vigor, tranquility, carefulness, equanimity, and absence of harm.

original: @11a * // nyon mongs pa drug ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: @11a * // nyon mongs pa drug ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The six root afflictions are the characteristics of desire, hatred, pride, ignorance, view, and doubt.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag ni khro ba nas shes bzhin ma yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag ni khro ba nas shes bzhin ma yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The secondary afflictions are anger up to lack of vigilance.

original: bzhi ni gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa nas dpyod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bzhi ni gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa nas dpyod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Four are also otherwise.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni don gang /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni don gang /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúotherwise‚Äù?

original: smras pa / bzhi po 'di dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te ci zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / bzhi po 'di dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te ci zhe na /
translated: It is said: These four are not only secondary afflictions. What are they?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la yang 'byung ngo //
translated: They also occur as virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: 'di ni sems las byung ba rnams bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sems las byung ba rnams bsdus pa ste /
translated: This is the summary of mental factors.

original: mdor bsdu na lnga bcu rtsa gcig yod do //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na lnga bcu rtsa gcig yod do //
translated: In brief, there are fifty-one mental activities.

original: de la reg pa la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid dang / las kyis bstan par lta'o //
analyzed: de la reg pa la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid dang / las kyis bstan par lta'o //
translated: The nature and function of contact and the other mental activities have been explained.

original: mtshan nyid ni reg pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni reg pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is contact?

original: gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcad pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcad pa'o //
translated: It is the coming together of three factors, and the differentiation that results from that coming together.

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //üîΩda dag 'dus nas sems las byung ba'i chos gang 'byung ba de reg pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa rnams so // da dag 'dus nas sems las byung ba'i chos gang 'byung ba de reg pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The three factors are the eye, a visible object, and visual consciousness.üîΩThe mental activity that arises from their coming together is contact.

original: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: Its nature is that of the differentiation of the sense faculty, the object, and consciousness.

original: tshor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no /
translated: Its activity is that of supporting feeling.

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung nas bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang / mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa de reg pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩyid la byed pa gang zhe na /üîΩgang sems kyi 'jug pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung nas bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang / mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa de reg pa yin par rig par bya'o // yid la byed pa gang zhe na / gang sems kyi 'jug pa'o ;
translated: When consciousness arises, the sense faculty and the object are differentiated, and a feeling that accords with pleasure, etc., is produced. This is contact.üîΩWhat is mental attention?üîΩIt is the directing of mind to an object.

original: / rtsol bar byed pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: / rtsol bar byed pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is the directing of mind to an object.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba gtod cing ma lus par sems pa ni yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba gtod cing ma lus par sems pa ni yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Attention is the directing of the mind and mental activities onto an object, and the keeping of them there.

original: dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to hold the mind to an object.üîΩWhat is volition? It is mental action which directs the mind to good, evil, or the unmoving.

original: sems pa gang zhe na yon tan dang / nyes pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni yid kyi las so //
analyzed: sems pa gang zhe na yon tan dang / nyes pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni yid kyi las so //
translated: It is the action of the mind.

original: gang yod na dmigs pa la sems rnam par shes pas gzhol ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yod na dmigs pa la sems rnam par shes pas gzhol ba yin te /
translated: When it exists, the mind is directed to an object by consciousness.

original: khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba bzhin no //
analyzed: khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a magnet which attracts iron.

original: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la yang sems gtong ba ni las bstan pa'i ste /
analyzed: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la yang sems gtong ba ni las bstan pa'i ste /
translated: It is the action of the mind which directs the mind to good, evil, or the unmoving.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar mngon par 'du byed pa bzhin du dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sems 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar mngon par 'du byed pa bzhin du dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sems 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the mind is directed to good, evil, or the unmoving, in accordance with the way in which it is directed.

original: kun tu 'gro ba lnga bshad zin to //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba lnga bshad zin to //
translated: The five universals have been explained.

original: 'dun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is desire?

original: bsam pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is the desire for an object of thought.

original: bsam pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod pa'i dngos po de la lta ba dang / nyan pa la sogs pa byed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod pa'i dngos po de la lta ba dang / nyan pa la sogs pa byed 'dod pa'o //
translated: The object of reflection is the object that one wishes to hear about, see, etc.

original: brtson 'grus brtson @11b pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtson @11b pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of supporting the practice of effort.

original: mos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is resolution?

original: nges pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the holding of a definite object in mind.

original: nges pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i tshogs te /
analyzed: nges pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i tshogs te /
translated: A definite object is the collection of the five aggregates.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs ni dbu brdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu brdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like foam on water.

original: tshor ba chu yi chu bur 'dra //
analyzed: tshor ba chu yi chu bur 'dra //
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble.

original: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
translated: Perception is like a mirage.

original: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing 'dra //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing 'dra //
translated: Conditionings are like a plantain tree.

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //üîΩnyi ma'i gnyen gyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes // nyi ma'i gnyen gyis bka' stsal to //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus has the Kinsman of the Sun taught.

original: de ltar na mos pa ni phung po rnams la mos pa'o //üîΩyang na dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar na mos pa ni phung po rnams la mos pa'o // yang na dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du /
translated: Thus, resolution is the holding of the aggregates in mind.

original: de dag la mos pa ni mos pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la mos pa ni mos pa ste /
translated: Or else, resolution is the holding of an object in mind just as it is.

original: nges par 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshi ga go //
analyzed: nges par 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshi ga go //
translated: The suffix -tvƒÅ has the sense of certainty.

original: mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi las can te /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi las can te /
translated: Its activity is to make one unassailable.

original: de ltar na de gces su byed pa ni gzhan gyis 'phrogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar na de gces su byed pa ni gzhan gyis 'phrogs par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, when one cherishes mindfulness, one cannot be assailed by others.

original: dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is mindfulness?

original: 'dris pa'i dngos po nyid ma brjed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dris pa'i dngos po nyid ma brjed pa ste /
translated: It is the non-loss of attentiveness with regard to a familiar object.

original: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
translated: It is the mental expression.

original: 'dris pa'i dngos po ni sngon myong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i dngos po ni sngon myong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: A familiar object should be understood as one that has been previously experienced.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba nyid du dran par dmigs pa gsal bar gyur na sems rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i las can no //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba nyid du dran par dmigs pa gsal bar gyur na sems rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i las can no //
translated: When mindfulness is clear with regard to the object, its activity is to prevent distraction.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration?

original: brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //üîΩbrtags pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po ni phung po lnga'i tshogs te /
analyzed: brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do // brtags pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po ni phung po lnga'i tshogs te /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind on a familiar object.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: A familiar object is one that has been examined, such as the five aggregates, which are impermanent, painful, empty, insubstantial, and so on.

original: de la gang sems rtse gcig pa ni rnam par mi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la gang sems rtse gcig pa ni rnam par mi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The one-pointedness of mind is the same as non-distraction.

original: shes pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: shes pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its activity is to support knowledge.

original: rten byed pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten byed pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It supports knowledge because it is the basis for the knowledge that perceives things as they are.

original: shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: de dag nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /üîΩrigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa skyed pa dang gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste / rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa skyed pa dang gzhan pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of those same dharmas.

original: brtag pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga'i tshogs dngos po de nyid la chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga'i tshogs dngos po de nyid la chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of dharmas by means of their specific characteristics and their general characteristics in the five aggregates that are the basis of appropriation.

original: som nyi zlog pa'i las can te /
analyzed: som nyi zlog pa'i las can te /
translated: Its activity is to eliminate doubt.

original: shes rab kyis chos rab tu rnam par phye na /
analyzed: shes rab kyis chos rab tu rnam par phye na /
translated: When one has discerned dharmas by means of wisdom,

original: nges pa rnyed pas som nyi zlog go //
analyzed: nges pa rnyed pas som nyi zlog go //
translated: one obtains certainty and eliminates doubt.

original: rigs pas bskyed pa ni chos 'di pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa ni chos 'di pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The discernment of dharmas by means of the general characteristics of the conditioned is the discernment of the general characteristics of the conditioned.

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa ni grangs can dang bye brag pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa ni grangs can dang bye brag pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas and Vai≈õe·π£ikas have a non-Buddhist view.

original: gzhan pa ni skye bas thob pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa ni skye bas thob pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad shes pa'o //
translated: The other is the knowledge of birth and the knowledge of worldly convention.

original: yul so sor nges pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa bshad zin to //
translated: The determination of the object has been explained.

original: dge ba bcu gcig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba bcu gcig brjod par bya ste /
translated: The eleven virtues should be mentioned.

original: de dag smras pa /
analyzed: de dag smras pa /
translated: They are said to be:

original: @12a * // dad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: @12a * // dad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is faith?

original: las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa dang / sems dang pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa dang / sems dang pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is a clear mind with regard to actions, results, truths, and the jewels.

original: las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Actions are of three kinds:

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: meritorious, non-meritorious, and immovable.

original: bsod nams ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: bsod nams ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mo //
translated: Meritorious actions are the ten paths of wholesome action.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang mjug bsdu ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang mjug bsdu ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Non-meritorious actions are the ten paths of unwholesome action, with preparation, actual action, and aftermath.

original: gzhan yang gang 'di dag gis ma bsdus pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang 'di dag gis ma bsdus pa /
translated: Moreover, those that are not included in theseüîΩare immovable actions.

original: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / go rar 'jug pa dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / go rar 'jug pa dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: killing, binding, imprisoning, beating, and so on.

original: mi g-yo ba'i las ni gang bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste las 'di ni rnam par smin pa mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las ni gang bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste las 'di ni rnam par smin pa mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The action that is unshakable is the four meditations and the four formless meditative attainments. This action is unshakable because its maturation is unshakable.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi gsungs te /
translated: The result is said to be of four kinds:

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: the result of the stream-winner, the result of the once-returner, the result of the non-returner, and the result of the arhat.

original: 'dir 'bras bu ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Here, the result is freedom from the afflictions.

original: yang na las dge ba'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na las dge ba'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Or else, the result of wholesome action is desirable.

original: mi dge ba'i 'bras bu ni mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i 'bras bu ni mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The result of unwholesome action is undesirable.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The four noble truths are:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam mo //
translated: the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
translated: Here, the truth of suffering is the result.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni rgyu ste /
translated: The truth of origination is the cause,

original: sred pa'i nye bar len pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i nye bar len pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su g-yo ba'o //
translated: because it is the movement of body, speech, and mind preceded by the appropriation of craving.

original: mdor bsdu na yang 'byung ba'i las dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na yang 'byung ba'i las dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: In brief, it is the afflictions that are associated with karma that produces existence.

original: 'khor ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of the side of cyclic existence.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The truth of cessation is the result,

original: 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: because cessation is freedom from the afflictions.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni rgyu ste /
translated: The truth of the path is the cause,

original: bral ba de nyid thob par byed pa'i thabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bral ba de nyid thob par byed pa'i thabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is the means for attaining that freedom.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of the side of purification.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äúnoble truth‚Äù?

original: 'di dag 'phags pa rnams la bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag 'phags pa rnams la bden pa ste /
translated: These are truths for the noble ones,üîΩbecause they are the objects of the knowledge of the noble ones.

original: de lta bas na 'phags pa'i bden ba zhes mdo nyid las gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pa'i bden ba zhes mdo nyid las gsungs so //
translated: This is what the s≈´tras themselves say.

original: ci gzhan rnams la 'di dag brdzun nam 'di dag ni thams cad la yang bden pa ste /
analyzed: ci gzhan rnams la 'di dag brdzun nam 'di dag ni thams cad la yang bden pa ste /
translated: Are these truths only for others, or are they also for the noble ones?

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are true for everyone, because they are not erroneous.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni de dag ji lta ba bzhin @12b gzigs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni de dag ji lta ba bzhin @12b gzigs so //
translated: The noble ones see them as they are.

original: gzhan dag gis ni de lta ma yin no de lta bas na de dag ni 'phags pa rnams la bden pa zhas bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni de lta ma yin no de lta bas na de dag ni 'phags pa rnams la bden pa zhas bya'o //
translated: Others do not see them in this way. Therefore, they are called truths for the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa ma yin ba rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin ba rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not truths for the non-noble ones,

original: phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they see them in a distorted way.

original: 'phags pas bde bar gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'phags pas bde bar gang gsungs pa //
translated: The noble ones call that which is said to be happiness

original: de ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rtogs //üîΩgzhan gyis bde bar gang smras pa //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rtogs // gzhan gyis bde bar gang smras pa //
translated: the understanding of the suffering of others.üîΩThat which is said to be suffering by others

original: de ni 'phags pas sdug bsngal rtogs //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pas sdug bsngal rtogs //
translated: the noble ones call the understanding of happiness.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is a verse.

original: de la phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: In this regard, the five aggregates are suffering because of the three kinds of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis so //
translated: The suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang ; dud 'gro rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang ; dud 'gro rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The suffering of suffering is the suffering of the hells, animals, and ghosts.

original: gzugs can gyi lha rnams dang mi rnams la ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi lha rnams dang mi rnams la ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The suffering of change is the suffering of the gods and humans.

original: gzugs med pa rnams la ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The suffering of the formative forces is the suffering of the formless beings.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni 'du byed thams cad 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal bar gzigs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni 'du byed thams cad 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal bar gzigs te /
translated: The noble ones see all the formative forces as suffering due to the suffering of the formative forces.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: lag mthil spu nyag gcig gzhag pa //
analyzed: lag mthil spu nyag gcig gzhag pa //
translated: A single hair placed in the palm of the hand

original: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la //üîΩmig tu song na de nyid kyis //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la // mig tu song na de nyid kyis //
translated: is not felt by people,

original: mi dga' ba dang gnod bskyed bzhin //
analyzed: mi dga' ba dang gnod bskyed bzhin //
translated: but if it enters the eye, it causes discomfort and harm.

original: byis pa dag ni lag mthil 'dra //
analyzed: byis pa dag ni lag mthil 'dra //
translated: Likewise, the childish, like the palm of the hand,

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal spu mi rtogs //
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal spu mi rtogs //
translated: do not feel the hair of the suffering of the formative forces.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni mig par 'dra //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni mig par 'dra //
translated: But the noble ones, like the eye,

original: de yis shin tu yid kyang 'byung //
analyzed: de yis shin tu yid kyang 'byung //
translated: and it is very painful.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams ni sred pa rtse mo la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo 'jug pa ste de ltar byis pa rnams ni mtshams med pa'i phung po rnams la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo yis mi 'jug go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams ni sred pa rtse mo la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo 'jug pa ste de ltar byis pa rnams ni mtshams med pa'i phung po rnams la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo yis mi 'jug go //
translated: Just as the noble ones have the idea of suffering even with regard to the peak of existence, so the foolish do not have the idea of suffering even with regard to the mass of suffering in the immediate retribution of the heinous actions.

original: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
translated: The Jewels are three in number:

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog go //
translated: the Jewel of the Buddha, the Jewel of the Dharma, and the Jewel of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: de la sangs rgyas dkon mchog ni bag chags dang / sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba rnam pa thams cad du thams cad thugs su chud pa'i bdag nyid 'byor pa thams cad kyi gnas /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dkon mchog ni bag chags dang / sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba rnam pa thams cad du thams cad thugs su chud pa'i bdag nyid 'byor pa thams cad kyi gnas /
translated: The Jewel of the Buddha is the one who is liberated from all the instincts and obscurations, who has realized all that there is to be realized, who is the basis of all excellences,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes khyad par 'phags pa chos kyi skur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes khyad par 'phags pa chos kyi skur gyur pa'o //
translated: who has become the Dharma Body, which is the special, non-conceptual intuition.

original: de yang yon tan ji snyed cig dang ldan par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang yon tan ji snyed cig dang ldan par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: And how many excellences should he be known to have?

original: shin tu yongs su dag pa'i tshad med pa bzhi dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / de bzhin du zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / @13a * //
analyzed: shin tu yongs su dag pa'i tshad med pa bzhi dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / de bzhin du zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / @13a * //
translated: the four immeasurables that are extremely pure, the eight deliverances that are extremely pure, and likewise the eight spheres of mastery, the ten spheres of totality,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang /
translated: the absence of conflict, the knowledge through aspiration, the four correct knowledges, the six superknowledges, the thirty-two marks of a great being, the eighty minor marks,

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / bsrung ba med pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos can dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / bsrung ba med pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos can dang /
translated: the four purities in all aspects, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four special knowledges, the three closely placed recollections, the complete destruction of the traces, and the quality of being unforgetful,

original: thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog gi ye shes dang ldan ba ste ;
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog gi ye shes dang ldan ba ste ;
translated: the great compassion, the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, and the gnosis that is the most sublime of all aspects.

original: yon tan gyi tshogs 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: This is the collection of the qualities of a Buddha Bhagavat.

original: mdor bsdu na zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: In brief, it is the five incorruptible components of experience.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po dpag tu med pa dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po dpag tu med pa dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The component of discipline is immeasurable, and likewise the component of meditative stability, the component of sublime intelligence, the component of complete liberation, and the component of the perception of the pristine awareness of complete liberation are immeasurable.

original: 'di dag kyang gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: These are to be regarded as the defining characteristics of the process of transformation.

original: chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Dharma is threefold:

original: bstan pa'i chos dang / lam gyi chos dang / don dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos dang / lam gyi chos dang / don dam pa'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma that is revealed, the Dharma that is the spiritual path, and the Dharma that is the ultimate reality.

original: de la bstan pa'i chos ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bstan pa'i chos ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of teaching is the class of Sutras, the class of Metres, etc.

original: lam gyi chos ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: lam gyi chos ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
translated: The Dharma of the Path is the Noble Eightfold Path,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
