analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: Right View, Right Thought, Right Speech, Right Action, Right Livelihood, Right Effort, Right Mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and Right Concentration.

original: don dam pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The Absolute Dharma is Nirvana,

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa /
translated: the Cessation obtained by the Path of Vision,üîΩthe Cessation obtained by the Path of Cultivation,

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba dang bral ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba dang bral ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: and the Cessation not obtained by either of the two Paths.

original: dge 'dun ni 'phags pa'i skyes bu gang zag ya brgyad do /
analyzed: dge 'dun ni 'phags pa'i skyes bu gang zag ya brgyad do /
translated: The Sangha is the eight kinds of Noble Persons.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'od ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang /üîΩphyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir @13b zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'od ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir @13b zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The path of insight is made up of fifteen thought-moments.üîΩThe sixteenth thought-moment is the fruit of the path of insight, the state of Stream-Winner.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa ni /
translated: The candidate for the fruit of Once-Returner is the person who is in the path of cultivation.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is made up of the nine stages of the three realms.üîΩThe fruit of the path of cultivation is the state of Once-Returner.üîΩThe candidate for the fruit of Never-Returner is the person who is in the path of insight.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni skad cig ma bco lnga la bya'o //üîΩbcu drug pa la ni 'bras bu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni skad cig ma bco lnga la bya'o // bcu drug pa la ni 'bras bu gnas pa ste /
translated: The path of insight is made up of fifteen thought-moments.üîΩThe sixteenth thought-moment is the fruit of the path of insight, the state of Never-Returner.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩrgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
translated: The candidate for the fruit of Arhatship is the person who is in the path of cultivation.

original: lam ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyun te /üîΩde de nas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyun te /üîΩde de nas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of cultivation is made up of the nine stages of the three realms.üîΩThe fruit of the path of cultivation is the state of Arhat.

original: de der zhugs shing phyin la thob pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de der zhugs shing phyin la thob pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: He is a Stream-Winner because he has entered into the stream, has arrived at the stream, has attained the stream.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: He is of two types:

original: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa dang / rigs nas rigs su skye ba'o //
analyzed: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa dang / rigs nas rigs su skye ba'o //
translated: one who will be reborn at the most seven times in the realm of desire, and one who goes from family to family.

original: kun tu sbyor ba bdun lus te /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba bdun lus te /
translated: He has abandoned seven of the fetters:

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa nyid dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa nyid dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the three of the group of the lower fetters, plus two of the group of the higher fetters, namely, attachment and conceit.

original: rigs nas rigs su skye ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rigs nas rigs su skye ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: One who goes from family to family is of two types:üîΩone who goes from family to family among the gods, and one who goes from family to family among humans.

original: lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni lha'i nang du rigs lan gnyis sam gsum blangs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //üîΩmi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni gang mi'i nang der ram ;
analyzed: lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni lha'i nang du rigs lan gnyis sam gsum blangs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o // mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni gang mi'i nang der ram ;
translated: The first obtains two or three births in the same family of gods, and then he obtains NirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: gling gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: gling gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The second obtains NirvƒÅ·πáa in the same place, or in another place, in the human family.

original: de nyid 'bras bu la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called a candidate for the second fruit.

original: rnam pa lnga'i bar bcom pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga'i bar bcom pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The person who has abandoned from one to five categories of defilements of the realm of desire is a candidate for the fruit of the Once-Returner.

original: rnam pa dag zad pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dag zad pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid yin te /
translated: One who has extinguished the first six types of defilements is a once-returner.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is called a ‚Äúdweller in the fruit of once-returner.‚Äù

original: lha'i nang du song ste mi'i 'jig rten du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang lan cig phyir mi 'ong phan chad skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lha'i nang du song ste mi'i 'jig rten du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang lan cig phyir mi 'ong phan chad skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Having gone to the god realm, he returns once to the human world, because he is not born again after that.

original: de nyid 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
translated: He is a ‚Äúdweller in the fruit.‚Äù

original: nyes cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyes cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has extinguished seven or eight types of defilements is called ‚Äúone who is entering into the fruit of non-returner.‚Äù

original: de nyid bar chad gcig ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bar chad gcig ces bya ste /
translated: He is called ‚Äúone with one obstruction,‚Äù

original: tshe gcig las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe gcig las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has only one life remaining.

original: gsum pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsum pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who is entering into the third fruit.‚Äù

original: de dgu pa zad pas phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa dgu zad pas phyir mi 'ong bar ba lta'o //
analyzed: de dgu pa zad pas phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa dgu zad pas phyir mi 'ong bar ba lta'o //
translated: One who has extinguished the ninth type of defilement is a non-returner.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Because he does not return to the desire realm, he is called a non-returner.

original: srid rtse'i bar cha brgyad zad pa dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: srid rtse'i bar cha brgyad zad pa dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa ste /
translated: One who has entered the state of an arhat is one who has destroyed the eighth stage of the summit of existence.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba de nyid bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur ba nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi brgyad spangs pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba de nyid bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur ba nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi brgyad spangs pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: That nonreturner who is free from attachment to the first stage of absorption up to the eighth stage of the summit of existence is one who has entered the state of an arhat.

original: dgu pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam la yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa nyid la blta'o //üîΩbar @14a * //
analyzed: dgu pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam la yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa nyid la blta'o // bar @14a * //
translated: One should also view the uninterrupted path of the ninth stage as one who has entered the state of an arhat.

original: chad med pa'i lam de ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chad med pa'i lam de ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: That uninterrupted path is called the vajra like concentration,

original: bag la nyal ba thams cad shigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba thams cad shigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it shatters all latent states.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu phyi ma rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu phyi ma rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
translated: After the vajra like concentration, there is the subsequent path of liberation.

original: de nyid zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: That is the knowledge of elimination.

original: zag pa thams cad zad pa thob pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir de zad pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa thams cad zad pa thob pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir de zad pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Because it arises simultaneously with the attainment of the elimination of all contaminants, it is the knowledge of elimination.

original: thog mar mi slob pa yin no //
analyzed: thog mar mi slob pa yin no //
translated: It is the first of the states of no learning.

original: dgra bcom pa dang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa yang yin no //
translated: They are also called ‚Äúworthy ones‚Äù and ‚Äúthose who have obtained the fruit of the worthy one.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu gzhan thob par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa med pas mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan thob par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa med pas mi slob pa'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose beyond training‚Äù because they have no more training to do in order to obtain another fruit.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par 'os pa dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par 'os pa dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúworthy ones‚Äù because they are worthy of honor and offerings from all people, including the gods, and because they are worthy of worship by all who possess desire.

original: de ltar mdor bsdu na skyes bu gang zag brgyad po de dag ni dge 'dun no //üîΩlas dad 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog de dag la mngon par yid ches pa ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdu na skyes bu gang zag brgyad po de dag ni dge 'dun no // las dad 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog de dag la mngon par yid ches pa ni dad pa ste /
translated: In brief, the Sangha consists of these eight kinds of persons.üîΩFaith is a clear and certain knowledge and a desire for the object that is known.

original: dad pa dang 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is a desire for the object that is known.

original: 'dun pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support aspiration.

original: dad pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dad pa bshad zin to //
translated: Faith has been discussed.

original: ngo tsha shes pa gang zhe na /üîΩbdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa gang zhe na / bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: What is a sense of shame?

original: kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o //
translated: It is a shrinking within oneself out of regard for oneself or out of regard for the Dharma.

original: bdag nyid gyi dbang du byas pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid gyi dbang du byas pa ni /
translated: Out of regard for oneself means

original: bdag rigs kyi bu yin na ji ltar sdig pa bya snyam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag rigs kyi bu yin na ji ltar sdig pa bya snyam pa'o //
translated: If I were a son of good family, how could I commit such evil deeds?

original: chos kyi dbang du byed pa ni ngan 'gros 'jigs pa'i rgyus bdag nyid kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du byed pa ni ngan 'gros 'jigs pa'i rgyus bdag nyid kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o //
translated: The dharma is the cause of fear of the miserable states of existence. It is the avoidance of sin through shame before oneself.

original: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir sdig pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir sdig pa'o //
translated: Sin is evil, because it is despised by the holy ones.

original: 'dzem pa ni sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzem pa ni sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: Shame is the avoidance of evil.

original: nyes par spyod pa legs par sdom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa legs par sdom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the avoidance of evil conduct.

original: khrel yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khrel yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is modesty?

original: 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas te /üîΩkha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas te / kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o //
translated: It is shame before the world.

original: med pa dang pha rol gyis byas pas 'jigs pa'i phyir pha rol la sdig pas 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: med pa dang pha rol gyis byas pas 'jigs pa'i phyir pha rol la sdig pas 'dzem pa'o //
translated: It is avoidance of sin through shame before others, because one fears the reproach of others.

original: de nyid kyi las can no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi las can no //
translated: Its function is the same as that of shame.

original: ma chags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma chags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-greed?

original: chags pa'i gnyen po ste //
analyzed: chags pa'i gnyen po ste //
translated: It is the antidote to greed.

original: yid byung zhing mi len pa'o //
analyzed: yid byung zhing mi len pa'o //
translated: It is disgust and non-appropriation.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la kun tu chags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la kun tu chags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the desire for existence and the things that sustain existence.

original: de'i gnyen po ni ma chags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni ma chags pa ste /
translated: Nonattachment is the antidote to attachment.

original: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la kun tu chags pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la kun tu chags pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the absence of desire for existence and the things that sustain existence.

original: yid byung ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid byung ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Disgust is the thorough knowledge of the faults of cyclic existence.

original: nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten du byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten du byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to serve as the basis for not engaging in misdeeds.

original: zhe sdang med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is nonhatred?

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen @14b po ste byams pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen @14b po ste byams pa'o //
translated: It is the antidote to hatred and is loving kindness.

original: sems can rnams la rnam ba kun nas mnar sems med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam ba kun nas mnar sems med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the absence of a hostile attitude toward sentient beings.

original: nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to serve as the basis for not engaging in misdeeds.

original: gti mug med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gti mug med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is nondelusion?

original: gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the antidote to delusion.

original: yang dag pa la yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa la yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the correct understanding of what is correct.

original: gti mug ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: Delusion is ignorance.

original: yang dag pa ni mdor bsdu na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni mdor bsdu na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The true is, in brief, the four noble truths.

original: rgyas par bya na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par bya na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: If one wishes to be more specific, it is the twelve members of dependent origination.

original: de rtogs pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: The understanding of that is knowledge.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rtogs pa ni skye bas thob pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rtogs pa ni skye bas thob pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The understanding of the result of evolution is knowledge obtained through birth.

original: thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa las byung ba ni lung las so //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa las byung ba ni lung las so //
translated: That which arises from listening and reflection is from scripture.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni thob pa las so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni thob pa las so //
translated: That which arises from meditative development is from attainment.

original: so sor brtags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúdiscernment‚Äù

original: shes rab dang brtson 'grus dang ldan par yang blta'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang brtson 'grus dang ldan par yang blta'o //
translated: and is also called ‚Äúwisdom‚Äù and ‚Äúeffort.‚Äù

original: nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to serve as the basis for not engaging in misdeeds.

original: brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
translated: What is effort?

original: le lo'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: le lo'i gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the antidote to laziness.

original: dge ba la sems mngon par spro pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sems mngon par spro pa'o //
translated: It is the mental factor that is the delight in virtue.

original: go cha dang / sbyor ba dang / ma zhum pa nyid dang / mi ldog pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: go cha dang / sbyor ba dang / ma zhum pa nyid dang / mi ldog pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is armoring, application, non-discouragement, non-retrogression, and non-satisfaction.

original: dge ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to perfect and complete the wholesome.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is serenity?

original: gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the antidote to the bad conditionings.

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid do //
translated: It is the serviceability of the body and mind.

original: gnas dan len ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste /
analyzed: gnas dan len ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste /
translated: The bad conditionings are the ten paths of bad action.

original: de dag shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Serenity is the antidote to those.

original: sgrib pa thams cad sel ba'i las can no //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad sel ba'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to eliminate all obscurations.

original: sgrib pa thams cad sel ba ni de'i dbang gis gnas gyur bar blta ba'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad sel ba ni de'i dbang gis gnas gyur bar blta ba'o //
translated: All obscurations are eliminated by the power of serenity.

original: bag yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bag yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is vigilance?

original: bag med pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the antidote to negligence.üîΩIt is the practice of the wholesome and the abandonment of the unwholesome by means of nonattachment, etc.

original: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag la gnas nas mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing dge ba'i chos rnams kyang bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag la gnas nas mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing dge ba'i chos rnams kyang bsgoms pa'o //
translated: , up to vigor.

original: bag med pa ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag med pa ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Negligence is attachment, hatred, delusion and laziness.

original: de'i gnyen po ni bag yod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni bag yod pa ste /
translated: Vigilance is the antidote to that.

original: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang chos bzhi po de dag la gnas te /
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang chos bzhi po de dag la gnas te /
translated: He abides in the four dharmas of non-greed, non-hatred, non-delusion, and vigor.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong ba'o //
translated: He abandons the unwholesome dharmas.

original: de dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: de dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: These are the dharmas with outflows.

original: 'dir ni zag pa rnams dang / zag pa'i gnas yul rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zag pa rnams dang / zag pa'i gnas yul rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the outflows and the objects of the outflows should be understood.

original: de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams kyang @15a * //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams kyang @15a * //
translated: The wholesome dharmas that are their antidotes

original: bsgoms pa ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: are called meditation, which is synonymous with non-greed, non-hatred, non-delusion, and vigor.

original: de dag la bag yod pa gdags so //
analyzed: de dag la bag yod pa gdags so //
translated: He is said to be heedful in regard to them.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i las can no //
translated: He has the function of perfecting all mundane and supramundane excellences.

original: btang snyoms gang zhe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms gang zhe na /
translated: What is equanimity?

original: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag nyid la gnas shing /
analyzed: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag nyid la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in those very [four] dharmas of non-greed, etc., up to vigor,

original: sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems rnal du 'dug pa nyid dang / sems lhun gyis grub pa yang thob pa ste /
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems rnal du 'dug pa nyid dang / sems lhun gyis grub pa yang thob pa ste /
translated: and he attains the evenness of mind, the natural state of mind, and the spontaneous state of mind.

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams bsal nas nyon mongs pa can med par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams bsal nas nyon mongs pa can med par gnas pa yin no //
translated: By this, he eliminates the defiled dharmas and abides in the absence of defilement.

original: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos de dag nyid kyi gnas skabs gzhan la btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos de dag nyid kyi gnas skabs gzhan la btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
translated: The other state of those same dharmas characterized by nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion, and by effort, is called equanimity.

original: 'di ltar btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems la byid ba la sogs pa'i mi mnyam pa med pas 'dir sems mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems la byid ba la sogs pa'i mi mnyam pa med pas 'dir sems mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, in this context, the evenness of mind is because there is no unevenness, such as agitation, in the mind that possesses equanimity.

original: de'i 'og tu mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pas rnal du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pas rnal du 'jug pa'o //
translated: After that, it is the natural state of mind because it proceeds without manifest activity.

original: de'i 'og tu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dogs pa med pas lhun gyis grub par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dogs pa med pas lhun gyis grub par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, it is said to abide spontaneously because there is no fear of defilement.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi skabs mi phyed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi skabs mi phyed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of serving as a basis for not giving an opportunity to any of the defilements and secondary defilements.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba gang zhen /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba gang zhen /
translated: What is non-violence?

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the opposite of violence.

original: snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje ba'o //
translated: It is compassion.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can la rnam par tho 'tshams pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can la rnam par tho 'tshams pa ste /
translated: Violence is the desire to harm living beings.

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa zhe sdang med pa'i cha can snying rje ba'i sems nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa zhe sdang med pa'i cha can snying rje ba'i sems nyid do //
translated: Non-violence is the absence of desire to harm, the desire to do good, the desire for which is the opposite of violence.

original: rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'i las can no /
analyzed: rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'i las can no /
translated: It has the function of not doing harm.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba yang zhe sdang med pa las gud na med pas btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba yang zhe sdang med pa las gud na med pas btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since non-violence is not anything other than non-hatred, it should be understood as a designation.

original: dge ba rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: dge ba rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The wholesome factors have been explained.

original: nyon mongs pa drug brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug brjod par bya ste /
translated: Six defilements should be mentioned.

original: de dag smras pa /
analyzed: de dag smras pa /
translated: They are:

original: 'dod chags gang zhen /
analyzed: 'dod chags gang zhen /
translated: What is craving?

original: nye bar len pa'i phyung po lnga la zhen pa dang / lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phyung po lnga la zhen pa dang / lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: It is attachment to and clinging to the five aggregates of attachment.

original: nye bar len pa las byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te ;
analyzed: nye bar len pa las byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te ;
translated: The aggregates are called upƒÅdƒÅnaskandha, appropriated aggregates, because they arise from the primary appropriator.

original: rtsva dang sog ma'i me bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsva dang sog ma'i me bzhin no //
translated: Like the fire of grass and sticks.

original: de dag las nye bar len pa rnams 'byung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te /
analyzed: de dag las nye bar len pa rnams 'byung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te /
translated: The aggregates are called upƒÅdƒÅnaskandha, appropriated aggregates, because the primary appropriator arises from them.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing ba zhin no //
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing ba zhin no //
translated: Like a tree with flowers and fruits.

original: nye bar len pa la rag las pas rgyal po'i mi bzhin no //üîΩde'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po gang yin pa de dag ni phung po rnams kyang @15b yin la ;
analyzed: nye bar len pa la rag las pas rgyal po'i mi bzhin no // de'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po gang yin pa de dag ni phung po rnams kyang @15b yin la ;
translated: Or else, because they are dependent on the primary appropriator, like the king‚Äôs men.üîΩThus, the aggregates that are primary appropriators are also aggregates;

original: phung po gang yin pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: phung po gang yin pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin par 'grub pa ste /
translated: but the aggregates that are not primary appropriators are not necessarily aggregates.

original: dgra bcom pa'i phung po rnams ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i phung po rnams ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The aggregates of the perfected being are without impurity.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can de dag la chags pa ni khams gsum pa'i rjes su chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can de dag la chags pa ni khams gsum pa'i rjes su chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Attachment to the aggregates of this type is called attachment to the three realms of existence.

original: sdug bsngal kun bskyed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun bskyed pa'i las can no //
translated: They have the function of producing all suffering.

original: srid pa'i dbang gis nye bar len pa'i phung po 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i dbang gis nye bar len pa'i phung po 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aggregates appropriated are produced by the power of existence.

original: khong khro ba gang zhen /
analyzed: khong khro ba gang zhen /
translated: What is anger?

original: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: It is the complete irritation of sentient beings.

original: thogs pa dang 'dra bas khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: thogs pa dang 'dra bas khong khro ba'o //
translated: It is anger because it is like an obstacle.

original: phung po lnga'i tshogs kyi rgyun la sems can zhes btags te /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i tshogs kyi rgyun la sems can zhes btags te /
translated: The continuum of the collection of the five aggregates is designated as a sentient being.

original: sems can de dag la kun nas mnar sems pa'o //üîΩji skad du bdag la gnod pa byas so byed do //
analyzed: sems can de dag la kun nas mnar sems pa'o // ji skad du bdag la gnod pa byas so byed do //
translated: It is the complete irritation of those sentient beings.üîΩAs it is said: ‚ÄúHe has harmed me, is harming me, and will harm me.‚Äù

original: byed par 'gyur ro zhes kun nas mnar sems 'byung ste /
analyzed: byed par 'gyur ro zhes kun nas mnar sems 'byung ste /
translated: Complete irritation arises,

original: rab tu 'khrug go //üîΩgang bdag gi mdza' bo de la gnod par byas so //
analyzed: rab tu 'khrug go // gang bdag gi mdza' bo de la gnod par byas so //
translated: and one is very upset.

original: byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes kun nas mnar sems 'byung ste /
analyzed: byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes kun nas mnar sems 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe has helped my enemy, is helping, and will help.‚Äù Complete irritation arises,

original: rab tu 'khrug go ;üîΩ/ gang bdag gi mi mdza' ba de'i don byas so //üîΩdon byed do //
analyzed: rab tu 'khrug go ; / gang bdag gi mi mdza' ba de'i don byas so // don byed do //
translated: and one is very upset.

original: don byed par 'gyur ro zhes kun nas mnar sems 'byung ste /
analyzed: don byed par 'gyur ro zhes kun nas mnar sems 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe has done a service for my enemy, is doing, and will do.‚Äù Complete irritation arises,

original: rab tu 'khrug go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'khrug go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and one is very upset.

original: bde ba la reg bar mi gnas pa dang nye bar spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: bde ba la reg bar mi gnas pa dang nye bar spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the lack of contact with happiness and the lack of enjoyment.

original: reg par mi gnas pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pa dang sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg par mi gnas pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pa dang sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lack of contact with happiness is due to the fact that one is accompanied by a hostile mind and lives in suffering.

original: nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is pride?

original: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven types of pride:üîΩpride, overweening pride, excessive pride,üîΩwrong pride,üîΩpride of thinking,üîΩpride of thinking that one is better,

original: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: and pride of thinking that one is equal.

original: nga rgyal thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas sems khengs par nga rgyal thams cad kyi mtshan nyid bye brag med do //üîΩmi gus pa 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: nga rgyal thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas sems khengs par nga rgyal thams cad kyi mtshan nyid bye brag med do // mi gus pa 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: The general characteristic of all pride is the inflation of the mind which is based on the false view of individuality.üîΩIts function is to support disrespect.

original: mi gus pa ni bla ma rnams dang yon tan can rnams la 'gying ba'o //
analyzed: mi gus pa ni bla ma rnams dang yon tan can rnams la 'gying ba'o //
translated: Disrespect is the lack of veneration for the virtuous and the elders.

original: bye brag gi mchan nyid kyi dbang du byas te smras pa /
analyzed: bye brag gi mchan nyid kyi dbang du byas te smras pa /
translated: The specific characteristics are stated in the Abhidharma:

original: nga rgyal gang zhe na /üîΩchung ba bas kyang bdag che ba'am /üîΩmtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gang zhe na / chung ba bas kyang bdag che ba'am / mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: What is pride?

original: bdag che snyam pa'am /
analyzed: bdag che snyam pa'am /
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks, 'I am better,' or 'I am equal,' or 'I am not worse,' in regard to an inferior, an equal, or a superior.

original: mtshungs pa la mtshungs so snyam pa gnyi gar sems khengs pa yang nga rgyal lo //üîΩche ba'i @16a * //
analyzed: mtshungs pa la mtshungs so snyam pa gnyi gar sems khengs pa yang nga rgyal lo // che ba'i @16a * //
translated: The inflation of the mind which thinks, 'I am better,' or 'I am equal,' is also pride.

original: nga rgyal gang zhe na /üîΩmtshungs pa bas bdag cha ba'am /
analyzed: nga rgyal gang zhe na / mtshungs pa bas bdag cha ba'am /
translated: What is excessive pride?

original: che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩ'dir yang mtshungs pa bas bdag khyad par du 'phags pa'am /
analyzed: che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o // 'dir yang mtshungs pa bas bdag khyad par du 'phags pa'am /
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks, 'I am equal,' in regard to one who is superior, or 'I am superior,' in regard to one who is equal.

original: mtshungs so snyam pa gnyi gar sems khengs pa yang che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: mtshungs so snyam pa gnyi gar sems khengs pa yang che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Here also, the inflation of the mind which thinks, 'I am superior,' or 'I am equal,' to one who is superior is also excessive pride.

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is the pride of pride?

original: che babs kyang bdag che'o snyam pa'i sems khengs pa gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: che babs kyang bdag che'o snyam pa'i sems khengs pa gang yin ba'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks, 'I am superior,' in regard to one who is superior.

original: dge bsnyen pas ni dge tshul che na /
analyzed: dge bsnyen pas ni dge tshul che na /
translated: The lay practitioner is superior to the novice monk.

original: dge bsnyen de 'di snyam du dge tshul bas kyang bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam du sems khengs bar byed pa 'di ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen de 'di snyam du dge tshul bas kyang bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam du sems khengs bar byed pa 'di ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: When the lay practitioner thinks, ‚ÄúI am superior to the novice monk,‚Äù this is called ‚Äúpride over pride.‚Äù

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is pride in ‚ÄúI‚Äù?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind that comes from the belief in a self or what belongs to a self with regard to the five aggregates of attachment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags ni nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags ni nye bar len pa ste /
translated: Desire and attachment to form, etc., is appropriation.

original: de la 'dun pas ni ma 'ongs pa'i lus 'dod pa'i sgo nas len te /
analyzed: de la 'dun pas ni ma 'ongs pa'i lus 'dod pa'i sgo nas len te /
translated: Desire appropriates the future body by desiring it.

original: des ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub po //
analyzed: des ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub po //
translated: It establishes the future aggregates.

original: 'dod chags kyis ni da ltar gyi lus la lhag par zhen pa'i sgo nas len te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ni da ltar gyi lus la lhag par zhen pa'i sgo nas len te /
translated: Attachment appropriates the present body by clinging to it.

original: des da ltar gyi phung po mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: des da ltar gyi phung po mi 'dor ro //
translated: It does not abandon the present aggregates.

original: de lta bas na 'di gnyis ni nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di gnyis ni nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus these two are called ‚Äúappropriation.‚Äù

original: de dag dang ldan pa ni phung po rnams te /üîΩde ltar bdag med pa'i phung po de dag la bdag yod do snyam du rlom sems pa'am /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa ni phung po rnams te / de ltar bdag med pa'i phung po de dag la bdag yod do snyam du rlom sems pa'am /
translated: The aggregates are endowed with these.

original: bdag gi phung po'o snyam du sems pa de ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdag gi phung po'o snyam du sems pa de ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Thus, the conceit that the self exists in the aggregates which are devoid of self, or the thought that the aggregates are mine is the pride thinking I.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is exaggerated pride?

original: gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks, I have attained what has not been attained, in regard to a special attainment.

original: gong ma'i khyad par thob bar bya ba ni 'bras bu dang / bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i khyad par thob bar bya ba ni 'bras bu dang / bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: A special attainment is a fruit, a concentration, a meditative development, etc.

original: de ma thob par bdag gis brtsal 'bad de thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mi'i chos bla ma ni ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ma thob par bdag gis brtsal 'bad de thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o // ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mi'i chos bla ma ni ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The inflation of the mind which thinks, I have attained it, when one has not attained it through effort is exaggerated pride.üîΩAs the Lord has said:

original: mngon ba'i nga rgyal ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mngon ba'i nga rgyal ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Exaggerated pride is an offense for one who is not a superman.

original: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is the pride of thinking that one is a little better?

original: khyad ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one is a little better than those who are very much better.

original: mtshungs pa'am / lhag snyam pa'i nga rgyal du rung na gang bdag chung snyam pa de ji ltar nga rgyal du 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'am / lhag snyam pa'i nga rgyal du rung na gang bdag chung snyam pa de ji ltar nga rgyal du 'gyur /
translated: If one thinks that one is inferior to those who are superior, how can that be pride?

original: smras pa / 'jig @16b rten na dngos po ngan pa la yang khengs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig @16b rten na dngos po ngan pa la yang khengs pa mthong ste /
translated: It is seen in the world that one can be proud of a bad thing.

original: nga ni rgyal bo'i mi yin gyi nga mi phal ba ni ma yin no snyam pa'o //
analyzed: nga ni rgyal bo'i mi yin gyi nga mi phal ba ni ma yin no snyam pa'o //
translated: One thinks: ‚ÄúI am a king‚Äôs man, I am not an ordinary person.‚Äù

original: log pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is false pride?

original: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one possesses good qualities when one is without good qualities.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: False pride is a pride in what is unreal.

original: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: One who is without good qualities is one who does not possess good qualities.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin ba de la mi dgag pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin ba de la mi dgag pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of the denial of those who are not endowed with good qualities.

original: yon tan ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa ste /üîΩde dag bdag la med bzhin du bdag tshul khrims dang ldan no //
analyzed: yon tan ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa ste / de dag bdag la med bzhin du bdag tshul khrims dang ldan no //
translated: Good qualities are generosity, morality, etc.

original: yon tan dang ldan no snyam du gang sems khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan no snyam du gang sems khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind of one who thinks, ‚ÄúI am endowed with morality, I am endowed with good qualities,‚Äù when one is not endowed with them.

original: ma rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance?

original: las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams mi shes pa ste /
translated: It is the non-understanding of action, the non-understanding of the results of action, the non-understanding of the Truths, and the non-understanding of the Jewels.

original: kheng du mi chud pa dang / mngon par mi rtogs pa dang / mun pa dang / kun tu gti mug pa dang / mun nag ces bya ba 'di dag ni ma rig pa'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: kheng du mi chud pa dang / mngon par mi rtogs pa dang / mun pa dang / kun tu gti mug pa dang / mun nag ces bya ba 'di dag ni ma rig pa'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Non-penetration, non-realization, darkness, complete delusion, and night are synonyms for ignorance.

original: las ni rnam pa gsum ste bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: las ni rnam pa gsum ste bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Action is of three kinds: meritorious, demeritorious, and unmoving.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Results are of four kinds:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: those of evolution, of conscious effort, of dominance, and of natural outcome.üîΩThe results of evolution are the five results:üîΩthe result of conscious effort, the result of dominance, and the natural result.

original: bden pa ni bzhi ste sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa ni bzhi ste sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: The truths are four: suffering, etc.

original: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
translated: The jewels are three:

original: de dag mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The ignorance of these is nescience.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: The innate is the unadulterated.

original: kun tu brtags pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: The imaginatively constructed is that associated with craving, etc.

original: yang na kun tu brtags pa na bye brag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yang na kun tu brtags pa na bye brag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Or else, the imaginatively constructed is that of the Vaibhasikas, etc.

original: log par nges pa dang / the tshom dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i brten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: log par nges pa dang / the tshom dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i brten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support the arising of afflicted views, doubt, and the afflictions.

original: log par nges pa ni phyin ci log tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: log par nges pa ni phyin ci log tu shes pa'o //
translated: Afflicted views are the distorted cognitions.

original: the tshom ni nem nur ro //
analyzed: the tshom ni nem nur ro //
translated: Doubt is indecision.

original: nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni /
translated: The arising of the afflictions is

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa la kun tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa la kun tu spyod pa'o //
translated: the engagement in craving, etc.

original: de'i rten byed pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung bar rig par bya'o /
analyzed: de'i rten byed pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung bar rig par bya'o /
translated: The support of that is the arising of all the afflictions.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa de dag ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa de dag ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ste /
translated: The three roots of nonvirtue are the attachment, hostility, and ignorance of the realm of desire.

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: Greed, hatred, and delusion are the roots of nonvirtue.

original: lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is a false view?

original: lta ba lnga ste /
analyzed: lta ba lnga ste /
translated: There are five false views:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the view of the transitory assemblage, the view of holding to an extreme, false view, the view of esteeming morality and ascetic practices, and the view of esteeming a bad view.

original: @17a * // 'jig tshogs la lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: @17a * // 'jig tshogs la lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the view of the transitory assemblage?üîΩIt is the afflicted understanding that views the five aggregates of attachment as a self or as something belonging to a self.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig par 'gyur bas 'jig pa'o //üîΩbsags pas tshogs te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig par 'gyur bas 'jig pa'o // bsags pas tshogs te /
translated: The transitory assemblage is a collection of perishable things.

original: 'jig tshogs ni mang pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs ni mang pa'o //
translated: The transitory assemblage is a collection of many things.

original: de la lta ba ni bdag phung po las gud na yod pa dang / phung po rnams ni bdag gi yin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la lta ba ni bdag phung po las gud na yod pa dang / phung po rnams ni bdag gi yin par lta ba'o //
translated: The view is the belief that the self exists separately from the aggregates and that the aggregates belong to the self.

original: ci'i phyir de skad bshad /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad bshad /
translated: Why is it so?

original: smras pa / 'jig ces bya ba ni rtag pa'i 'du shes spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig ces bya ba ni rtag pa'i 'du shes spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: the word ‚Äúperishes‚Äù is for the purpose of eliminating the notion of permanence.

original: tshogs zhes bya ba ni gcig pa'i 'du shes spang pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba ni gcig pa'i 'du shes spang pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is for the purpose of eliminating the notion of unity.

original: 'dir ni mi rtag pa 'dus pa yin pas 'di la bdag med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mi rtag pa 'dus pa yin pas 'di la bdag med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, it is taught that since the impermanent is a collection, there is no self in this.

original: lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its activity is to serve as the basis of all views.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the view of holding to an extreme?

original: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rtag pa'am chad par yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rtag pa'am chad par yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the wisdom that is afflicted by the view of holding to an extreme, whether in eternalism or in annihilationism.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang du byas zhes bya ba ni bdag por byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang du byas zhes bya ba ni bdag por byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBased on the view of the perishable collection‚Äù means that it is dominated by that view.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' ste /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExtreme‚Äù means eternalism.

original: bdag thams cad du song ba dang / rtag pa dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag thams cad du song ba dang / rtag pa dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The self is all-pervading, permanent, the principal, etc.

original: lus rnams ni rtsva dang 'jim pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: lus rnams ni rtsva dang 'jim pa lta bu ste /
translated: Bodies are like grass and clay.

original: 'di ni rtag pa'i mtha' can gyi mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtag pa'i mtha' can gyi mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //
translated: This is the extreme view of eternalism.

original: chad pa'i bdag nyid ni nang na byed pa'i skyes bu yod pa de shi phan chad med de /
analyzed: chad pa'i bdag nyid ni nang na byed pa'i skyes bu yod pa de shi phan chad med de /
translated: The view of annihilationism is the belief that the self, which exists as the inner agent, does not exist after death.

original: dper na bum pa chag nas yang mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa chag nas yang mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, when a pot is broken, it does not exist anymore.

original: dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: The middle way is the path that leads to liberation.

original: log par lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is wrong view?

original: rgyu'am 'bras bu'am byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'am 'bras bu'am byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a defiled wisdom that denies cause, effect, or action, or that denies that there are good and evil acts, or that denies that arhats exist.

original: rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The cause is action and affliction.

original: de dag kyang yan lag lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang yan lag lngar 'gyur te /
translated: These are the five members:

original: nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang len pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang len pa'o //
translated: afflictions are ignorance, craving, and grasping;

original: las ni 'du byed dang srid pa'o //
analyzed: las ni 'du byed dang srid pa'o //
translated: Action is formation and becoming.

original: yang na 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags te /
analyzed: yang na 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags te /
translated: Or else, here, the latent impressions are in the store consciousness.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo las kyi rnam par smin pa gang ma 'ongs pa na 'bras bu 'byin nus pa de yang srid pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo las kyi rnam par smin pa gang ma 'ongs pa na 'bras bu 'byin nus pa de yang srid pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As the Lord has said: ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, that action which is able to produce a result in the future is also called becoming.

original: 'di la skur pa 'debs pa ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la skur pa 'debs pa ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The denial of this is the denial of cause.

original: 'bras bu la yan lag bdun te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la yan lag bdun te /
translated: The result is seven members:

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang @17b gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang @17b gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.

original: 'di la skur ba 'debs pa ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la skur ba 'debs pa ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: The denial of this is the denial of result.

original: yang na mdor bsdu na legs par spyad pa yang med nyes par spyad pa yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mdor bsdu na legs par spyad pa yang med nyes par spyad pa yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Or else, in brief, the denial that there is good practice or bad practice is the denial of cause.

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'o //üîΩ'jig rten 'di ni med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'o // 'jig rten 'di ni med do //
translated: The statement, There is no result of actions that are well done or ill done, is a denial of results.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //üîΩpha med do //üîΩma med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do // pha med do // ma med do //
translated: The statement, This world does not exist, and The other world does not exist, is a denial of the world.

original: sems can 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba ni byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba ni byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: The statement, There is no father, There is no mother, and There are no beings who are reborn spontaneously, is a denial of the creator.

original: 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba'i byed pa dang / sa bon 'debs pa'i byed pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba'i byed pa dang / sa bon 'debs pa'i byed pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it denies the creator of the world, the creator of coming and going in the other world, the creator of planting seeds, and the creator of rebirth.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'o //
translated: The statement, There are no arhats in the world, and so on, is the destruction of what exists.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyun gcod pa'i las can dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dam du 'dzin pa'i las can dang / mi dge ba la 'jug pa'i las can dang / dge ba la mi 'jug pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyun gcod pa'i las can dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dam du 'dzin pa'i las can dang / mi dge ba la 'jug pa'i las can dang / dge ba la mi 'jug pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of severing the root of merit, of tightening the root of demerit, of engaging in non-virtue, and of not engaging in virtue.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the overesteeming of morality and asceticism?

original: lta ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / de'i gnas phung po rnams la mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam par yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lta ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / de'i gnas phung po rnams la mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam par yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the notional attachment to the three views, to their basis, the aggregates, and to the overesteeming of morality and asceticism as being preeminent, excellent, special, and supreme.

original: lta ba rnam pa gsum bzhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba rnam pa gsum bzhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //
translated: The three views are the view of individuality, the view of extremes, and false view.

original: de'i gnas phung po zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gnas phung po zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The aggregates are their basis.

original: mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam par shes rab kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam par shes rab kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of he sees with wisdom is that he sees as supreme, as foremost, as special, as excellent.

original: shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of afflicted wisdom is that it is associated with the afflictions.

original: lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhe na pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhe na pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to serve as the basis for the delight in bad views.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the holding of a discipline and ritual as paramount?

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / de'i gnas phung po rnams la 'dag pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon @18a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / de'i gnas phung po rnams la 'dag pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon @18a * //
translated: It is afflicted wisdom which regards a discipline and ritual, and the aggregates which are its basis, as pure, as liberation, and as that which definitely issues forth.

original: mongs ba can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni lta ba ngan ba sngon du song bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mongs ba can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni lta ba ngan ba sngon du song bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of discipline and ritual is that it should be understood as preceded by a bad view.

original: tshul khrims ni bdun spangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni bdun spangs pa'o //
translated: Discipline is the abandonment of the seven kinds of killing.

original: brtul zhugs ni khyi dang ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / dbyu gu rtse gsum pa dang mgo 'breg pa la sogs ba dang ; grangs can gyi rnal 'byor shes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni khyi dang ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / dbyu gu rtse gsum pa dang mgo 'breg pa la sogs ba dang ; grangs can gyi rnal 'byor shes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Asceticism refers to the asceticisms of dogs and cows, the three-pointed staff, shaving the head, etc., and the yoga of the Samkhyas, etc.

original: thar pa'i lam gyi rgyu ma yin /
analyzed: thar pa'i lam gyi rgyu ma yin /
translated: They are not the cause of the path of liberation.

original: dbang phyug chen po dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang / me dang chur 'jug pa la sogs pa ni mtho ris kyi rgyu ma yin na de dag la rgyur lta ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang / me dang chur 'jug pa la sogs pa ni mtho ris kyi rgyu ma yin na de dag la rgyur lta ba'o //
translated: Worshiping Mahe≈õvara, PrajƒÅpati, fire, water, etc., is not the cause of high status, but one views them as the cause.

original: de'i gnas phung po rnams zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gnas phung po rnams zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The aggregates are its basis means that morality, etc., are its basis.

original: 'dag pa zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa des 'dag bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dag pa zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa des 'dag bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Purification means that by this, one is purified.

original: grol ba zhes bya ba ni thabs 'dis nyon mongs pa rnams las grol bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: grol ba zhes bya ba ni thabs 'dis nyon mongs pa rnams las grol bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Liberation means that by this method, one is liberated from the afflictions.

original: nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: Exits means that by this, one exits from cyclic existence.

original: / ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: / ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: Its action is to support the uselessness of fatigue.

original: ngal ba 'bras bu med pa ni nges nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngal ba 'bras bu med pa ni nges nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Useless fatigue is because of not being certain about anything.

original: the tshom gang zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom gang zhe na /
translated: What is doubt?üîΩIt is a state of two-mindedness about the truths, etc.

original: bden pa la sogs pa la yang yid gnyis za ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams la sbyar ro //
analyzed: bden pa la sogs pa la yang yid gnyis za ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams la sbyar ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refer to action and result, the truths, and the Jewels.

original: de dag la yod dam med ces yid gnyis su 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag la yod dam med ces yid gnyis su 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a state of two-mindedness about whether they exist or not.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support the non-engagement in virtue.

original: des dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: des dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: Because of it, one does not engage in virtue.

original: nges pa ma rnyed pas bar skabs nas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnyon mongs pa de dag las lhan cig skyes pa ni du /
analyzed: nges pa ma rnyed pas bar skabs nas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro // nyon mongs pa de dag las lhan cig skyes pa ni du /
translated: Because one does not find certainty, one does not begin in the middle.

original: kun tu brtags pa ni du zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa ni du zhe na /
translated: How many of these afflictions are innate and how many are imagined?

original: smras pa / lta ba 'og ma gsum dang / the tshom ni kun tu brtags pa'o zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste /
analyzed: smras pa / lta ba 'og ma gsum dang / the tshom ni kun tu brtags pa'o zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste /
translated: Wrong views, esteeming of views, and esteeming of morality and asceticism, and doubt are only imagination.

original: de dag ni kun tu brtags pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni kun tu brtags pa nyid do //
translated: The rest are both innate and imagination.

original: lhag ma ni lhan cig skyes pa dang kun tu brtags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang sbyar ro /
analyzed: lhag ma ni lhan cig skyes pa dang kun tu brtags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang sbyar ro /
translated: Attachment, repugnance, pride, ignorance, the afflicted view of the self, and the afflicted view of holding to an extreme are both innate and imagination.

original: 'di dag gi rnam grangs ni bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / @18b nyon mongs pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / rnyog pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / yon po dang / bskus ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rnam grangs ni bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / @18b nyon mongs pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / rnyog pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / yon po dang / bskus ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their synonyms are: latent tendency, fetter, defilement, that which is associated with impurity, turbidity, flood, bond, crookedness, stain, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The defilements have been explained.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams brjod par bya ste /
translated: The subsidiary disturbing emotions will now be discussed.

original: de dag smras pa /
analyzed: de dag smras pa /
translated: They are said to be:

original: khro ba gang zhe na //üîΩ'phral du gnod par byed pa la gnas te /
analyzed: khro ba gang zhe na // 'phral du gnod par byed pa la gnas te /
translated: What is anger?

original: gang sems kyis kun nas mnar sems pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang sems kyis kun nas mnar sems pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a state of mind that is hostile toward an object that is harmful.

original: 'phral du zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'phral du zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba ste /
translated: The word immediately means in the present.

original: de la gnod bar byed pa'i rgyu de la khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems kyis kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnod bar byed pa'i rgyu de la khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems kyis kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: It is a state of mind that is hostile toward the cause of harm.

original: dbyig pa dang / rdeg pa dang / mtshon gyis 'debs pa la sogs pa nyes pa rtsom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dbyig pa dang / rdeg pa dang / mtshon gyis 'debs pa la sogs pa nyes pa rtsom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It functions as the basis for the performance of such faults as striking, beating, and killing.

original: khro ba la sogs pa yang khong khro ba la sogs pa las gud na med pa'i phyir brtags pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa yang khong khro ba la sogs pa las gud na med pa'i phyir brtags pa'o //
translated: Anger and so forth are also imputed because they do not exist separately from hostility and so forth.

original: khon du 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is resentment?

original: mdud par 'dzin pa'o /
analyzed: mdud par 'dzin pa'o /
translated: It is the holding on to a grudge.

original: khros pa'i 'og tu khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa nyid mdud par 'dzin pa mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: khros pa'i 'og tu khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa nyid mdud par 'dzin pa mi gtong ba'o //
translated: After one has become angry, resentment is the not letting go of the hostility.

original: mi bzod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: Its function is to support intolerance.

original: mi bzod pa ni dang du mi len pa'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa ni dang du mi len pa'o //
translated: Intolerance is not accepting.

original: 'chab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chab pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is concealment?

original: bdag gi kha na ma tho ba ma khyud pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi kha na ma tho ba ma khyud pa'o //
translated: It is not acknowledging one's own faults.

original: yang dag bar bskul ba na gti mug gi char gtogs pas kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag bar bskul ba na gti mug gi char gtogs pas kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o //
translated: When one is properly exhorted, one conceals one's faults through delusion.

original: 'gyod pas reg par mi gnas ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'gyod pas reg par mi gnas ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the inability to remain in contact with remorse.

original: 'di ni chos nyid de kha na ma thob 'chab na 'gyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid de kha na ma thob 'chab na 'gyod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the nature of things: when one conceals one's faults, one has remorse.

original: des na reg par mi gnas so //
analyzed: des na reg par mi gnas so //
translated: Because of that, one is unable to remain in contact.

original: 'tshig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'tshig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is rancor?

original: tshig brlang pos zher 'debs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: tshig brlang pos zher 'debs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is the state of being harsh, preceded by anger and resentment.

original: sems kyis kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyis kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
translated: It is mental malice.

original: tshig brlang bo ni gtum tshig go //
analyzed: tshig brlang bo ni gtum tshig go //
translated: Harsh words are cruel words.

original: ngag rtsub mo'i rten byed pa'i las byed pa'i las can dang / bsod nams ma yin pa skyes pa 'byin pa'i las can dang / reg bar mi gnas pa 'byin ba'i las can no //
analyzed: ngag rtsub mo'i rten byed pa'i las byed pa'i las can dang / bsod nams ma yin pa skyes pa 'byin pa'i las can dang / reg bar mi gnas pa 'byin ba'i las can no //
translated: It is the cause of the arising of unpleasant contact.üîΩHarsh speech is the expression of words that are rough and

original: gtum tshig dang / dag rtsub mo de ni phan tshun mtshang la 'debs pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du smra ba ste /
analyzed: gtum tshig dang / dag rtsub mo de ni phan tshun mtshang la 'debs pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du smra ba ste /
translated: hurtful to others.

original: 'di nyid 'tshigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'tshigs pa'o //
translated: It is the burning of the mind.

original: phrag dog gang zhe na /
analyzed: phrag dog gang zhe na /
translated: What is envy?

original: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: It is the mind's inward rage at another's excellence.

original: gzhan dag gi phun sum tshogs pa ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ste /üîΩgzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa de la rnyed pa @19a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi phun sum tshogs pa ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ste / gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa de la rnyed pa @19a * //
translated: Another's excellence is the excellence of another.üîΩEnvy is the mind's inward rage at another's excellence,

original: nyid dang / bkur sti la lhag par chags pas mi bzod par byas pa'i sems kyis khong nas 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: nyid dang / bkur sti la lhag par chags pas mi bzod par byas pa'i sems kyis khong nas 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: caused by intolerance born of attachment to gain and honor.

original: yid mi bde bas reg par mi gnas pa'i las can no //
analyzed: yid mi bde bas reg par mi gnas pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of causing unpleasant contact.

original: ser sna gang zhe na /
analyzed: ser sna gang zhe na /
translated: What is avarice?

original: sbyin pa dang / mi mthun pa'i sems kyis kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
