analyzed: sbyin pa dang / mi mthun pa'i sems kyis kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: 2) avarice, which is the grasping of the requisites of life with a mind that is not in accord with generosity.

original: gang gis rgyud las ma 'gro zhig /üîΩces bya ba ni ser sna ste /
analyzed: gang gis rgyud las ma 'gro zhig / ces bya ba ni ser sna ste /
translated: The S≈´tra says, Do not go by the stream of avarice!

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pa nyid kyis 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'i sems kyi yo byad rnams kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pa nyid kyis 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'i sems kyi yo byad rnams kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Avarice is the grasping of the requisites of life with a mind that is part of craving, due to excessive attachment to gain and honor.

original: de nyid sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of generosity.

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: It has the function of supporting the absence of austerity.

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa ni ser snas mi khom pa'i yo byad rnams sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa ni ser snas mi khom pa'i yo byad rnams sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of austerity should be understood as the accumulation of requisites due to avarice, which is an unfavorable condition.

original: sgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is deceit?

original: gzhan la slu ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la slu ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa'o //
translated: It is the manifestation of an unreal object in order to deceive another.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang gti mug gi char gtogs pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang gti mug gi char gtogs pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa ste /
translated: It is the manifestation of an unreal object with a mind that is part of craving and delusion, due to attachment to gain and honor.

original: log par 'tsho ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of supporting a false way of life.

original: g-yo gang zhe na /
analyzed: g-yo gang zhe na /
translated: What is deceit?

original: bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i las thabs bzung ste /
analyzed: bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i las thabs bzung ste /
translated: It is a mental activity which conceals one's faults.

original: sems gya gyu'o zhes bya ba la rang gi nyes pa rnams ni rang gi skyon te /
analyzed: sems gya gyu'o zhes bya ba la rang gi nyes pa rnams ni rang gi skyon te /
translated: It is a crookedness of mind.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to gain and honor, conceals one's faults and does not want to be known as having faults.

original: rnyed ba dang bkur sti la chags bas de dag bcab par 'dod nas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi char gtogs pas nyes pa byung ba de ngos mi zin par gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud par rig bar bya'o //üîΩyang dag pa'i gdams gang thob pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las byas te /
analyzed: rnyed ba dang bkur sti la chags bas de dag bcab par 'dod nas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi char gtogs pas nyes pa byung ba de ngos mi zin par gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud par rig bar bya'o // yang dag pa'i gdams gang thob pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las byas te /
translated: It is a mental activity which, out of attachment, aversion, or confusion, does not want to be known as having faults and which, therefore, evades questions by talking about other things.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to gain and honor, does not want to be known as having faults and which, therefore, evades questions by talking about other things.

original: bdag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma smras pas gdams dag gi 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma smras pas gdams dag gi 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a mental activity which, out of attachment to gain and honor, does not want to be known as having faults and which, therefore, evades questions by talking about other things.üîΩWhat is pride?

original: rgyags pa gang zhe na /üîΩbdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la chags ba'i rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: rgyags pa gang zhe na / bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la chags ba'i rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: It is a mental activity which inflates the mind.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.üîΩIt is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain and honor, inflates the mind and despises others.

original: sems yongs su 'dzin pa'o //üîΩde ni rnam pa du ma ste /
analyzed: sems yongs su 'dzin pa'o //üîΩde ni rnam pa du ma ste /
translated: It is a mental activity which, out of attachment to one's own gain

original: rigs dang / stobs dang / gzugs dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / blo dang / longs spyod dang / dbang phyug la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs dang / stobs dang / gzugs dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / blo dang / longs spyod dang / dbang phyug la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the cause of the arising of the afflictions, and as the cause of the arising of the secondary afflictions.

original: bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The prosperity of the self is any kind of prosperity that is accompanied by the contaminants.

original: chags pa'i rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i yid bde ba ste /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gya dga' ba'i bye brag 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i yid bde ba ste / nyon mongs pa can gya dga' ba'i bye brag 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'o //
translated: The joy of attachment is a mental satisfaction that is a joy.üîΩ It is a particular kind of joy that is a derivative of attachment.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni dge pa'i rtsa ba thams cad sel @19b ba'o ;
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni dge pa'i rtsa ba thams cad sel @19b ba'o ;
translated: The clinging is the cause of the arising of all the roots of unwholesome action.

original: / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of being the basis of all the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is malice?üîΩIt is the desire to harm sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la tho 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa /
analyzed: sems can rnams la tho 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa /
translated: It is a derivative of hatred.

original: snying brtse ba med pa snying rje ba med pa'o //
analyzed: snying brtse ba med pa snying rje ba med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of compassion and the absence of pity.

original: sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa ni thal lcag dang khur tshur gyis brdeg pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa ni thal lcag dang khur tshur gyis brdeg pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
translated: Malice is the intention to harm sentient beings, such as by beating them with sticks, hitting them with clods of earth, and so on.

original: 'di ni de'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support all the roots of nonvirtue.

original: ngo tsha ba med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is lack of sense of shame?

original: kha na ma tho bas bdag la mi 'dzem pa'o //üîΩngo tsha ba mi shes ba ni ngo tsha med pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas bdag la mi 'dzem pa'o // ngo tsha ba mi shes ba ni ngo tsha med pa ste /
translated: It is not to be ashamed of one's own faults.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: Lack of sense of shame is the opposite of a sense of shame.

original: ngo tsha shes pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi char gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi char gtogs pa'o //
translated: A sense of shame is a part of attachment, hostility and delusion.

original: kha na ma tho bas bdag la mi 'dzems pa'o zhes bya ba la bdag la zhes bya ba ni rang la'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas bdag la mi 'dzems pa'o zhes bya ba la bdag la zhes bya ba ni rang la'o //
translated: Not to be ashamed of one's own faults means not to be ashamed of oneself.

original: kha na ma tho ba ni sdig pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ni sdig pa'o //
translated: Faults are sins.

original: des mi 'dzom pa ni sdig la byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des mi 'dzom pa ni sdig la byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not to be ashamed of them means to be shameless.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs ba thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs ba thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to assist all the major and minor defilements.

original: khrel med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khrel med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is lack of conscience?

original: kha na ma tho bas gzhan la mi 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas gzhan la mi 'dzem pa'o //
translated: It is the lack of dread of the blame of others.

original: khrel med pas ni khrel yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khrel med pas ni khrel yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Shamelessness is the opposite of shame.

original: khrel yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i chos ni khrel med ba'o //
analyzed: khrel yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i chos ni khrel med ba'o //
translated: It is the quality that is adverse to shame.

original: kha na ma tho bas gzhan la mi 'dzem pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan nam gzhan rnams la mi 'dzem par sdig pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas gzhan la mi 'dzem pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan nam gzhan rnams la mi 'dzem par sdig pa byed pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIt is the lack of dread of the blame of others,‚Äù means that it is the performance of evil deeds without dread of others or of the authorities.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its activity is that of supporting all the passions and secondary passions.

original: rmugs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rmugs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is torpor?

original: sems las su mi rung ba ste blong ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems las su mi rung ba ste blong ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the unfitness of the mind, a state of mental depression.

original: gti mug gi char gtogs pas sems las su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi char gtogs pas sems las su mi rung ba'o //
translated: It is unfitness of the mind that is included among the secondary passions.

original: rmugs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its activity is that of supporting all the passions and secondary passions.

original: rgod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is distraction?üîΩIt is the non-tranquility of mind.

original: sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: It is the state of following after the signs of pleasant objects.

original: 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pas sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pas sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
translated: It is a lack of mental tranquility, because it is associated with attachment.

original: sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ni 'dod chags dang mthun ba ste ;
analyzed: sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ni 'dod chags dang mthun ba ste ;
translated: It is a mental factor that follows the signs of the pleasant, because it is associated with attachment.

original: sngon dgod pa dang / rtse rtse brjes su dran pa'i phyir sems rnam par ma zhi bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sngon dgod pa dang / rtse rtse brjes su dran pa'i phyir sems rnam par ma zhi bar rig par bya ste /
translated: It is a lack of mental tranquility, because it is a recollection of former laughter and play.

original: zhi gnas kyi bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to obstruct tranquility.

original: ma dad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma dad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is lack of faith?

original: las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams la yid mi ches pa dang / sems ma dang ba ste /üîΩdad pa'i @20a * //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams la yid mi ches pa dang / sems ma dang ba ste / dad pa'i @20a * //
translated: It is a lack of clarity of mind with regard to actions, their results, the truths, and the jewels.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: It is the opposite of faith.üîΩIt is a lack of clarity of mind with regard to actions, their results, the truths, the jewels, etc.,

original: gong du smos pa'i las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa la yid mi ches pa ste /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa la yid mi ches pa ste /
translated: as previously mentioned.

original: de ni sems ma dang ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sems ma dang ba'o //
translated: It is a lack of clarity of mind.

original: yid mi ches pa ni mi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: yid mi ches pa ni mi 'dod pa ste /
translated: Lack of clarity is a lack of desire.

original: dad ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dad ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: It is the opposite of faith.

original: le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support laziness.

original: dang pa med na sbyor bar 'dun pa med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang pa med na sbyor bar 'dun pa med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no faith, there is no desire to apply oneself.

original: le lo gang zhe na /
analyzed: le lo gang zhe na /
translated: What is laziness?

original: dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba med pa ste /
translated: It is the lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the adversary of vigor.üîΩIt is the lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with faith, etc.

original: dge ba la sems dad pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de la sems mi spro ba ste /üîΩnyal ba dang / snyes pa dang / 'phres pa'i bsod nyams la brten nas /
analyzed: dge ba la sems dad pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de la sems mi spro ba ste / nyal ba dang / snyes pa dang / 'phres pa'i bsod nyams la brten nas /
translated: It is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with torpor and drowsiness.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.

original: gti mug gi char gtogs pa brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gti mug gi char gtogs pa brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: It is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //üîΩbag med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no // bag med pa gang zhe na /
translated: It is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang le lo gang yin pa de dag gis nyon mongs pa las sems mi bsrung ba dang / dge ba mi bsgom pa'o //üîΩbag med pa ni 'dir chos bzhi ste /
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang le lo gang yin pa de dag gis nyon mongs pa las sems mi bsrung ba dang / dge ba mi bsgom pa'o //üîΩbag med pa ni 'dir chos bzhi ste /
translated: It is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.üîΩIt is a lack of mental enthusiasm for the wholesome, which is associated with desire for the enjoyment of sleep, lying down, and rest.

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: attachment, hostility, conceit, and laziness.

original: de dag gis zil gyis non na nyon mongs pa rnams las sems 'dod chags dang bral bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis zil gyis non na nyon mongs pa rnams las sems 'dod chags dang bral bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: When one is overwhelmed by them, one is unable to free the mind from attachment.

original: de dag la gnas pa ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sgom par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la gnas pa ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sgom par mi byed pa'o //
translated: When one is in their power, one does not cultivate the roots of virtue such as generosity.

original: mi dge ba 'phel ba dang / dge ba yongs su 'grib pa'i rten byed ba'i las can no //
analyzed: mi dge ba 'phel ba dang / dge ba yongs su 'grib pa'i rten byed ba'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the increase of nonvirtue and the decrease of virtue.

original: brjed ngas ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: brjed ngas ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is forgetfulness?

original: dran pa nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: dran pa nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: It is defiled memory.

original: dge ba mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba mi gsal ba'o //
translated: It is the lack of clarity of the wholesome.

original: dran pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'o //
translated: Defiled memory is memory associated with the defilements.

original: dge ba mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag brjed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag brjed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The lack of clarity of the wholesome means the forgetting of the right instructions.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support distraction.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is distraction?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi shas kyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la gang sems rnam par 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi shas kyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la gang sems rnam par 'phro ba'o //
translated: It is the scattering of the mind to the five sense pleasures due to the predominance of attachment, hostility, and ignorance.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyis rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rnam @20b par g-yeng ba'o ;
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyis rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rnam @20b par g-yeng ba'o ;
translated: Moreover, it is natural distraction, external distraction, internal distraction, the distraction of signs, the distraction of bad tendencies, and the distraction of attention.

original: / rang bzhin gyis rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ste /
analyzed: / rang bzhin gyis rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ste /
translated: Natural distraction refers to the five collections of consciousness.

original: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis nang du mnyam par gzhog mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis nang du mnyam par gzhog mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are unable to concentrate internally by nature.

original: phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba ni dge ba la zhugs pa na 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sems rnam par 'phro ba ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba ni dge ba la zhugs pa na 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sems rnam par 'phro ba ste /
translated: External distraction is the scattering of the mind to the five sense pleasures when one is engaged in virtue.

original: thos pa la sogs pa dge ba la sbyor ba na /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa dge ba la sbyor ba na /
translated: When one is engaged in virtue such as listening,

original: dmigs pa de las phyi rol du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sems 'gro bar rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa de las phyi rol du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sems 'gro bar rig bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the mind is distracted outwardly when it goes out to the five sense pleasures.

original: nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba ni dge ba la zhugs pa'i tshe bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba ni dge ba la zhugs pa'i tshe bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa ste /
translated: Internal distraction is the sinking, the excitedness, and the enjoyment of taste that occur when one is engaged in the wholesome.

original: ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i tshe bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i tshe bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The sinking, the excitedness, and the enjoyment of taste that occur when one is engaged in concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin du ltung ba'i phyir nyes pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du ltung ba'i phyir nyes pa'o //
translated: It is a fault because it causes one to fall into concentration.

original: mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is distraction of signs?

original: pha rol yid ches par bya ba sngon du btang nas dge ba la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol yid ches par bya ba sngon du btang nas dge ba la sbyor ba ste /
translated: It is the application to the wholesome preceded by the desire for the esteem of others.

original: gzhan gyis bdag la yon tan dang ldan par yid ches par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bdag la yon tan dang ldan par yid ches par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: It is the thought that others will believe that one possesses good qualities.

original: de'i mtshan ma ni de'i rgyu ste ;
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma ni de'i rgyu ste ;
translated: Its sign is its cause.

original: dge ba la zhugs pa dge ba las yongs su nyams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba la zhugs pa dge ba las yongs su nyams par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is the falling away from the wholesome of one who is engaged in the wholesome.

original: gnas ngan len gyis rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyis rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is distraction of evil?

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len la brten nas /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len la brten nas /
translated: It is the tendency to cling to I and mine, and the tendency to think I am and to feel proud.

original: dge ba la zhugs pa'i tshor ba 'byung zhing /üîΩbyung ba rnams la nga zhes bya ba dang / nga yir zhes bya bar 'dzin te /
analyzed: dge ba la zhugs pa'i tshor ba 'byung zhing / byung ba rnams la nga zhes bya ba dang / nga yir zhes bya bar 'dzin te /
translated: It is the tendency to cling to the feeling of pleasure that arises when one is engaged in virtue.üîΩIt is the tendency to cling to the thought I and the thought mine with regard to the things that arise.

original: 'dren mar 'byung zhing mtshan mar byed pa'o //üîΩyid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dren mar 'byung zhing mtshan mar byed pa'o // yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhe na /
translated: It is the tendency to cling to the thought of a self.üîΩWhat is distraction of the mind?

original: ting nge 'dzin gzhan nam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan nam /
translated: It is the tendency to distraction in the mind that is engaged in concentration.

original: theg pa gzhan la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: It is the tendency to distraction in the mind that is engaged in another concentration, or in another vehicle.

original: gnas par byed pa na rnam par 'phro bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa na rnam par 'phro bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the tendency to distraction in the mind that is engaged in abiding in concentration.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to obstruct freedom from passion.

original: shes bzhin ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes bzhin ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is lack of awareness?

original: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: It is understanding associated with the defilements.

original: des lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi spyod pa la mi shes bzhin du 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba la lus dang / dag dang / yid kyi spyod pa la mi shes pa ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la legs par so sor ma brtags par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi spyod pa la mi shes bzhin du 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba la lus dang / dag dang / yid kyi spyod pa la mi shes pa ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la legs par so sor ma brtags par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: The non-understanding of the conduct of body, speech, and mind is the non-discernment of the proper engagement in going, returning, etc.

original: ltung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no /
analyzed: ltung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no /
translated: Its activity is to serve as the basis of downfalls.

original: de ltar bya ba dang / mi bya ba mi shes pas nyes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba dang / mi bya ba mi shes pas nyes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, because one does not know what should and should not be done, faults occur.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The subsidiary defilements have now been explained.

original: @21a * // bzhi gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: @21a * // bzhi gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes smos pa la /
translated: Four are also otherwise.

original: 'gyod pa gang zhe na /üîΩyid la gcags pa'o zhes bya ba ni smad par byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa gang zhe na / yid la gcags pa'o zhes bya ba ni smad par byas pa ste /
translated: What is regret?üîΩIt is remorse.

original: ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a censure of what has been done badly, i.e., of a bad action.

original: ngan pa gang byas pa'i de 'dir sbyar te /
analyzed: ngan pa gang byas pa'i de 'dir sbyar te /
translated: Here, it is applied to what has been done badly,

original: yid la gcags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to what has not been done.

original: 'dir ni yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, regret is called remorse.

original: de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has that for its object.

original: dper na stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i sems rnam par dag pa la rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i sems rnam par dag pa la rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the thought that has emptiness for its object is called liberation.

original: yang na 'bras bu la rgyu gdags pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu la rgyu gdags pa ste /
translated: Or else, the effect is designated by the name of the cause.

original: 'di la 'gyod pa'i 'bras bu ni yid la gcags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod pa'i 'bras bu ni yid la gcags pa'o //
translated: Here, the effect of regret is remorse.

original: de gnyi ga yang gnyi ga'i rten te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang gnyi ga'i rten te /
translated: Both of these, regret and remorse, have a basis in both.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba so so'i /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba so so'i /
translated: The basis of the wholesome and the basis of the unwholesome.

original: gang dge ba ma byas pas 'gyod pa de ni dge ba'i rten no //
analyzed: gang dge ba ma byas pas 'gyod pa de ni dge ba'i rten no //
translated: The basis of the wholesome is the regret that arises from not having done what is wholesome.

original: gang mi dge ba byas pas 'gyod pa de yang dge ba'i rten no //
analyzed: gang mi dge ba byas pas 'gyod pa de yang dge ba'i rten no //
translated: The basis of the wholesome is also the regret that arises from having done what is unwholesome.

original: de bzhin du mi dge ba gnyi ga'i rten de bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dge ba gnyi ga'i rten de bzlog pa'o //
translated: The basis of the unwholesome is the opposite of that.

original: gang mi dge ba ma byas pas 'gyod pa de ni mi dge ba'i rten to //
analyzed: gang mi dge ba ma byas pas 'gyod pa de ni mi dge ba'i rten to //
translated: The basis of the unwholesome is the regret that arises from not having done what is unwholesome.

original: dge ba byas pas 'gyod pa de yang mi dge ba'i rten to /
analyzed: dge ba byas pas 'gyod pa de yang mi dge ba'i rten to /
translated: The basis of the unwholesome is also the regret that arises from having done what is wholesome.

original: sems gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to obstruct the stability of thought.

original: gnyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is sleep?

original: 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o //
translated: It is the withdrawal of thought, which is involuntary and associated with a lack of clarity of the mind.

original: gnyid kyi rgyu la brten nas gti mug gi char gtogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos kyi sems rang dbang med pa skyed do //
analyzed: gnyid kyi rgyu la brten nas gti mug gi char gtogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos kyi sems rang dbang med pa skyed do //
translated: It is a mental factor belonging to the class of delusion, which causes the mind to lose its power of discrimination.

original: rang dbang med pa de ni sems mngon par sdud pa ste /
analyzed: rang dbang med pa de ni sems mngon par sdud pa ste /
translated: This loss of discrimination is a contraction of the mind.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dus dang dum ma yin par yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dus dang dum ma yin par yang rung ste /
translated: It is a contraction of the mind, whether wholesome, unwholesome, or undefined, whether timely or untimely.

original: sems mngon par sdud pa'o //
analyzed: sems mngon par sdud pa'o //
translated: It is a contraction of the mind.

original: bya ba shor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: bya ba shor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the loss of what should be done.

original: rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is distraction?

original: kun tu chol ba'i rten gyi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu chol ba'i rten gyi brjod pa ste /
translated: It is a mental factor that supports scattering.

original: sems pa dang / shes rab kyi bye brag gang sems rtsing ba'o //
analyzed: sems pa dang / shes rab kyi bye brag gang sems rtsing ba'o //
translated: It is a special kind of volition and discernment that causes the mind to be distracted.

original: kun tu tshol ba zhes bya ba ni tshor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu tshol ba zhes bya ba ni tshor bar byed pa'o //
translated: To scatter means to be distracted.

original: yid kyi brjod pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //üîΩde ni sems ba'am /
analyzed: yid kyi brjod pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o // de ni sems ba'am /
translated: Mental expression means the mental consciousness.

original: shes rab la brten nas gang sems rtsing ba ste ;
analyzed: shes rab la brten nas gang sems rtsing ba ste ;
translated: It is a special kind of volition and discernment that causes the mind to be distracted.

original: rags pa bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta la sogs pa la 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rags pa bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta la sogs pa la 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The mental faculty of apprehension is that which apprehends gross objects such as a pot, a cloth, a chariot, etc.

original: spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mental faculty of operation?

original: so sor rtogs pa'i yid kyi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtogs pa'i yid kyi brjod pa ste /
translated: It is the mental faculty of discernment.

original: de bzhin du gang sems zhib pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang sems zhib pa'o //
translated: In the same way, it is the subtle mind.

original: gzhan ni sngar smos pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni sngar smos pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The other mental faculties are to be understood as above.

original: sems zhib pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa de nyid la tshes @21b sam ma tshos zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhib pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa de nyid la tshes @21b sam ma tshos zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The subtle mind is that which apprehends the same pot, etc., as being either cooked or uncooked.

original: gnyi ga yang reg pa dang / reg pa ma yin par gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang reg pa dang / reg pa ma yin par gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: The function of both is to serve as a basis for the mind and mental activities that are either in contact or not in contact with their objects.

original: yang na dge ba'i chos rnams kyi las ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i las can dang / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang gi gnyen po'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no sems las byung ba rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i chos rnams kyi las ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i las can dang / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang gi gnyen po'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no sems las byung ba rnams bshad zin to //
translated: Or, the function of the wholesome mental activities is to eliminate their opposites and to obstruct the arising of all the passions and secondary passions.

original: sems dang mi ldan pa rnams brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa rnams brjod par bya ste /
translated: The mental activities have been discussed.üîΩNow we must discuss the dharmas that are not associated with the mind.

original: de dag smras pa /
analyzed: de dag smras pa /
translated: The answer is:

original: sems dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What are the formations that are not associated with mind?

original: 'di ni 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dri ba ste /
translated: This is the question.

original: 'di'i lan btab pa ni ;üîΩgang zag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs la gdags pa ste zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i lan btab pa ni ; gang zag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs la gdags pa ste zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is:üîΩThe person is imputed in dependence on the form and mind and mental factors.

original: gzugs kyi gnas skabs dang / sems kyi gnas skabs dang / sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs la gdags kyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi gnas skabs dang / sems kyi gnas skabs dang / sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs la gdags kyi /
translated: The person is imputed in dependence on the state of form, the state of mind, and the state of mental factors.

original: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exist substantially.

original: sems ni ma bshad na 'di ji ltar sems kyi gnas skabs la gdags /
analyzed: sems ni ma bshad na 'di ji ltar sems kyi gnas skabs la gdags /
translated: If mind is not explained, how can it be imputed in dependence on the state of mind?

original: smras pa / ma 'ongs pa la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / ma 'ongs pa la ltos pa ste /
translated: It is said: It is in relation to the future.

original: de la rig pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //üîΩde dag kyang ci'i gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gang dag yin pa de dag nyid mi ldan pa rnams yin nam /
analyzed: de la rig pa'i phyir nyes pa med do // de dag kyang ci'i gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gang dag yin pa de dag nyid mi ldan pa rnams yin nam /
translated: There is no fault because it is known.

original: 'on te gzhan la'am brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig gam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la'am brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig gam zhe na /
translated: Are those that are the form, mind, and mental factors the ones that are not associated, or are they different, or are they not to be stated?

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is said: It is not like that.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir / de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says: it is not designated as identical or different.

original: khu tshur bzhin no //
analyzed: khu tshur bzhin no //
translated: Like a fist.

original: dper na khu tshur ni sor mo las gzhan yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na khu tshur ni sor mo las gzhan yang ma yin no //
translated: For example, a fist is not different from the fingers.

original: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-different.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not inexpressible.

original: gal te sor mo rnams las gzhan yin par 'gyur na ni logs shig tu bzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sor mo rnams las gzhan yin par 'gyur na ni logs shig tu bzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were different from the fingers, it would be apprehended separately.

original: ci ste gzhan ma yin na ni sor mo brkyang ba rnams la yang bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan ma yin na ni sor mo brkyang ba rnams la yang bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were non-different, it would be apprehended even when the fingers are extended.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la yang mi bya ste /
translated: It is not inexpressible,

original: 'di ltar khu tshur zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'di ltar khu tshur zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is expressed as a fist.

original: / de lta bas na de nyid dang gzhan dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la mi gdags bar 'thad do //
analyzed: / de lta bas na de nyid dang gzhan dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la mi gdags bar 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that it is not designated as identical or different or inexpressible.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / srog gi dbang bo dang / @22a * //
analyzed: thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / srog gi dbang bo dang / @22a * //
translated: the meditative attainment of nonperception, the meditative attainment of cessation, nonperception, the faculty of life force,

original: ris mthun pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs dang / so so'i skye bo nyid dang / de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa dag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ris mthun pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs dang / so so'i skye bo nyid dang / de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa dag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: similarity of type, birth, aging, duration, impermanence, the collection of names, the collection of phrases, the collection of syllables, the state of being an ordinary being, and those that are similar to them.

original: de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa dag ces smos pa ni 'jug pa dang / so sor nges pa dang / 'byor 'brel pa dang / mgyogs pa dang / go rims dang / dus dang / yul dang / grangs dang / grangs med pa dang /üîΩtshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa dag ces smos pa ni 'jug pa dang / so sor nges pa dang / 'byor 'brel pa dang / mgyogs pa dang / go rims dang / dus dang / yul dang / grangs dang / grangs med pa dang / tshogs pa ste /
translated: Those that are similar to them refers to engagement, determination, connection, speed, sequence, time, place, number, and countless.

original: de dag bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are collections because they are included in those.

original: chos de dag ni sems dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i byed pa can yin pas sems dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag ni sems dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i byed pa can yin pas sems dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúdissociated from thought‚Äù because they are active with regard to thought, but are not of the nature of thought.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not of the nature of form.

original: sems las byung ba bzhin du sems dang lhan cig tu dmigs pa la mi 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems las byung ba bzhin du sems dang lhan cig tu dmigs pa la mi 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They do not engage in the apprehension of an object along with thought, as do the mental factors.

original: de la thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is possession?

original: rnyed pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the state of being endowed with what has been obtained.

original: gang sngon ma thob pa thob pa de la rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang sngon ma thob pa thob pa de la rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which has not been obtained previously and is obtained is called acquisition.

original: bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: bye brag bstan to //
translated: This is the difference.

original: thob pa rnams skad cig phyi ma la sogs pa yang mi 'bral ba ni ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thob pa rnams skad cig phyi ma la sogs pa yang mi 'bral ba ni ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The possession of the obtained in the subsequent moment and so on is called endowment.

original: khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par bstan to //
translated: This is the difference.

original: de yang sa bon dang / dbang dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni grangs bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang sa bon dang / dbang dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni grangs bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: It is to be applied as appropriate to the seed, mastery, and actualization.

original: sa bon zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o //
translated: The seed is possession.

original: dbang dang sngon du gyur pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang dang sngon du gyur pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: Mastery and actualization are endowment.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of the non-perceptive state?

original: dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la gong ma'i ma yin ba 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩ'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la gong ma'i ma yin ba 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams 'gog pa gang yin pa'o // 'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is the cessation of the manifestation of mind and mental activities, preceded by the perception of the higher realm, in one who is free from the craving of the realm of desire, but not free from the craving of the higher realm.üîΩThe attainment of the non-perceptive state is the attainment of the non-perceptive gods.

original: 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi zhes bya ba mngon no //üîΩyang na bdag nyid 'du shes med pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi zhes bya ba mngon no // yang na bdag nyid 'du shes med pa ste /
translated: The gods of the non-perceptive state are the gods of the summit of existence.

original: kun tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the non-perceptive state is the non-manifestation of the self.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The attainment is the cause of the non-manifestation of the self.üîΩFree from the craving of the realm of desire means free from the craving of the twenty-two abodes of the realm of desire.

original: dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams gnas nyi shu la 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'og na sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad de /
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams gnas nyi shu la 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'og na sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad de /
translated: The twenty-two abodes of the realm of desire are:

original: mnar med pa dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang ngu 'bod dang / bsdus 'joms dang / thig nag dang / yang sos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mnar med pa dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang ngu 'bod dang / bsdus 'joms dang / thig nag dang / yang sos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Avƒ´ci, Tapana, Mahatapana, Sa·πÉjƒ´va, KƒÅlas≈´tra, Sa·πÉghƒÅta, Raurava, MahƒÅraurava.

original: go @22b rims bzhin du gong nas gong du gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go @22b rims bzhin du gong nas gong du gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are arranged in order from the bottom up.

original: gzhan yang grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad de /
translated: There are also eight cold hells:

original: chu bur can dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so thams thams pa dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / aa chu zer ba dang / autpala ltar gas pa dang / padma lta rags pa dang ; padma ltar gas pa chen po ste /
analyzed: chu bur can dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so thams thams pa dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / aa chu zer ba dang / autpala ltar gas pa dang / padma lta rags pa dang ; padma ltar gas pa chen po ste /
translated: Arbuda, Nirarbuda, A·π≠a·π≠a, Hahava, Huhuva, Utpala, Padma, and MahƒÅpadma.

original: sems can de dag ni grang ba drag pos nyen nas lus dang sgra'i 'gyur ba'i tshul la ming 'di dag btags so //
analyzed: sems can de dag ni grang ba drag pos nyen nas lus dang sgra'i 'gyur ba'i tshul la ming 'di dag btags so //
translated: These sentient beings are afflicted by intense cold. Their names are given according to the changes in their bodies and voices.

original: de dag kyang sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis 'dzam bu gling gi 'og tu grub bo //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis 'dzam bu gling gi 'og tu grub bo //
translated: They are established under the Jambudvƒ´pa continent by the power of the karma of all sentient beings.

original: nyi tshe'i sems can dmyal ba rnams ni rang rang gi las kyis grub pa dag ste /
analyzed: nyi tshe'i sems can dmyal ba rnams ni rang rang gi las kyis grub pa dag ste /
translated: The occasional hells are created by the individual karma of sentient beings.

original: mang po'am gnyis sam gcig gi las kyis grub ba yin pas gnas ma nges te /
analyzed: mang po'am gnyis sam gcig gi las kyis grub ba yin pas gnas ma nges te /
translated: They are created by the karma of many beings, or of two beings, or of one being.

original: chu dang ri dang mya ngan gyi phyogs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu dang ri dang mya ngan gyi phyogs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their location is not fixed: in water, on the ground, in the sky, etc.

original: dud 'gro ni /
analyzed: dud 'gro ni /
translated: Animals have three abodes:

original: thang dang chu dang / nam mkha'i spyod yul ba de dag gi gnas ni rgya mtsho ste de nas so sor gyes so //
analyzed: thang dang chu dang / nam mkha'i spyod yul ba de dag gi gnas ni rgya mtsho ste de nas so sor gyes so //
translated: the ocean is their principal abode, but some live in the sky or on the ground.

original: yi dags rnams kyi rgyal po ni gshin rje ste /üîΩ'dzam bu'i gling 'di'i 'og nas dpag tshad lnga ba rgyas chod pa'i 'og na rgyal po'i pho brang yod de /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyi rgyal po ni gshin rje ste / 'dzam bu'i gling 'di'i 'og nas dpag tshad lnga ba rgyas chod pa'i 'og na rgyal po'i pho brang yod de /
translated: The king of the hungry ghosts is called Yama.üîΩHis palace is located 500 leagues below the earth.

original: de dag gi rtsa ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: de dag gi rtsa ba'i gnas te /
translated: This is the principal abode of the hungry ghosts.

original: de nas so sor gyes so //
analyzed: de nas so sor gyes so //
translated: Some live in other places.

original: gling bzhin ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang ; shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gling bzhin ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang ; shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The four continents are Jambudvƒ´pa, GodƒÅnƒ´ya, Videha, and Kuru.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i lha drug la rgyal chen bzhi'i ris rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i lha drug la rgyal chen bzhi'i ris rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams te /
translated: TrƒÅyastri·πÉ≈õas, YƒÅma, Tu·π£ita, NirmƒÅ·πáarati, and Paranirmitava≈õavartin.

original: de dag 'dod pa la spyod pa ni gnyis sprod pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / lag chang dang / 'dzum pa dang / lta ba las 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag 'dod pa la spyod pa ni gnyis sprod pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / lag chang dang / 'dzum pa dang / lta ba las 'gyur te /
translated: They experience desire through two organs, through embracing, through holding hands, through smiling, and through looking.

original: 'di ni 'dod khams so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod khams so //
translated: This is the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs chen ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs chen ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: The form realm is BrahmƒÅkƒÅyika, Brahmapurohita, and MahƒÅbrahma, which are the first absorption.

original: 'od chud dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'od chud dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
translated: ƒÄbhƒÅsvara, ≈öubhak·πõtsna, and B·πõhatphala are the second absorption.üîΩParƒ´ttƒÅbha, ApramƒÅ·πáƒÅbha, and ƒÄbhƒÅsvara are the third absorption.

original: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas ni bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas ni bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
translated: Parƒ´tta≈õubha, ApramƒÅ·πáa≈õubha, and ≈öubhak·πõtsna are the fourth absorption.

original: sprin med dang bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che dang / gnas de rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas so //üîΩgnas @23a * //
analyzed: sprin med dang bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che dang / gnas de rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas so // gnas @23a * //
translated: The Abodes of the SuddhƒÅvƒÅsa gods are: the Aviha, the Atapa, the Sud·πõ≈õa, the Sudar≈õana, and the Akani·π£·π≠ha.üîΩThese are the five Abodes of the SuddhƒÅvƒÅsa gods.

original: gtsang ma lnga po mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min zhes bya ba rnams ni bsam gtan bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: gtsang ma lnga po mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min zhes bya ba rnams ni bsam gtan bzhi pa ste /
translated: The Akani·π£·π≠ha gods are in the fourth DhyƒÅna.

original: 'di dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: These are the gods of the R≈´padhƒÅtu.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba 'di ni gzugs med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba 'di ni gzugs med pa'i khams te /
translated: The gods of the ƒÄr≈´pyadhƒÅtu are the gods of the four ƒÄr≈´pyas: the ƒÄkƒÅ≈õƒÅnantyƒÅyatana, the Vij√±ƒÅnƒÅnantyƒÅyatana, the ƒÄki√±canyƒÅyatana, and the Naivasa·πÉj√±ƒÅnƒÅsa·πÉj√±ƒÅyatana.

original: 'di dag ni khams gsum du blta'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni khams gsum du blta'o //
translated: These are the three DhƒÅtus.

original: de la 'di ni dge rgyas kyi lha'i ris kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: de la 'di ni dge rgyas kyi lha'i ris kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: The gods of the BrahmakƒÅyika class are detached from the realm of desire.

original: gong ma'i 'dod chags dad ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i 'dod chags dad ma bral ba'o //
translated: They are not detached from the higher realms.

original: yid la byed pa gang gis snyoms par 'jug pa 'di la snyoms par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang gis snyoms par 'jug pa 'di la snyoms par 'jug ce na /
translated: By what mental attention does one enter this meditative attainment?

original: smras pa / 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du gtang ba'i yid la byed ba'o zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du gtang ba'i yid la byed ba'o zhes smos pa'o //
translated: It is said: by mental attention that is preceded by the notion of emergence.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams 'gog pa'o //
translated: This meditative attainment is the cessation of mind and mental factors that have been taught.

original: de dag ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa drug ste /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa drug ste /
translated: These are the six forms of active consciousness together with their associated factors.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang ; lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang ; lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: They are: eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness.

original: bstan pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: bstan pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: The taught are the store consciousness and afflicted mind.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative attainment of cessation?

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: It is for one who is free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa'i gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / bstan pa rnams las kyang kha cig 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa'i gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / bstan pa rnams las kyang kha cig 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is the meditative attainment that is preceded by the ideation of abiding, which is the ideation of the meditative attainment of cessation, and which is the mental attention that is directed toward the teachings that are not taught and that are taught, and that is directed toward the cessation of some of the taught and some of the untaught mental factors and mental activities.üîΩThe difference between this and the meditative attainment of non-perception is as follows:üîΩThis meditative attainment is preceded by the ideation of abiding.üîΩThe meditative attainment of non-perception is preceded by the ideation of escape.

original: 'di la 'di ni bye brag yin te /üîΩgnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas 'di la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'di ni bye brag yin te / gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas 'di la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The difference between this and the meditative attainment of non-perception is as follows:üîΩThis meditative attainment is preceded by the ideation of abiding, which is the ideation of the meditative attainment of cessation, and which is the mental attention that is directed toward the teachings that are not taught and that are taught, and that is directed toward the cessation of some of the taught and some of the untaught mental factors and mental activities.

original: bstan pa rnams las kyang kha cig 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa 'gog pa'o //üîΩsnga ma ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'o //üîΩ'gog @23b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni chos 'di pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: bstan pa rnams las kyang kha cig 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa 'gog pa'o // snga ma ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'o // 'gog @23b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni chos 'di pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The meditative attainment of non-perception is preceded by the ideation of escape, which is the ideation of the meditative attainment of non-perception, and which is the mental attention that is directed toward the teachings that are not taught and that are taught, and that is directed toward the cessation of all of the taught and all of the untaught mental factors and mental activities.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa snyoms par 'jug pa'o //üîΩde dag la sogs pa ni de dag gi khyad par rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa snyoms par 'jug pa'o //üîΩde dag la sogs pa ni de dag gi khyad par rgyas pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of non-perception is the meditative attainment that is preceded by the ideation of escape, which is the ideation of the meditative attainment of non-perception, and which is the mental attention that is directed toward the teachings that are not taught and that are taught, and that is directed toward the cessation of all of the taught and all of the untaught mental factors and mental activities.üîΩThe meditative attainment of non-perception is the meditative attainment that is preceded by the ideation of escape, which is the ideation of the meditative attainment of non-perception, and which is the mental attention that is directed toward the teachings that are not taught and that are taught, and that is directed toward the cessation of all of the taught and all of the untaught mental factors and mental activities.üîΩThe meditative attainment of non-perception is the meditative attainment that is preceded by the ideation of escape, which is the ideation of the meditative attainment of non-perception, and which is the mental attention that is directed toward the teachings that are not taught and that are taught, and that

original: 'du shes med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-perception?

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: It is the effect of the attainment of non-perception.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi khrod lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi khrod lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of mind and mental activities of a being who is born among the gods without ideation.

original: bstan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dga' 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dga' 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Without ideation means that the six active forms of consciousness are absent.

original: 'du shes med pa 'di ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa 'di ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the effect of the attainment of non-perception.

original: 'bras bu che ba'i phyogs gcig gi khrod na 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams 'khod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i phyogs gcig gi khrod na 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams 'khod de /
translated: The gods without ideation are situated in the highest part of the plane of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can dang mtshungs so //
translated: They are similar to those of the fourth meditation.

original: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of life?

original: ris mthun pa rnams su sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pas gang 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i dus nges pa'o //
analyzed: ris mthun pa rnams su sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pas gang 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i dus nges pa'o //
translated: It is the duration of the aggregates projected by the action of a previous existence.

original: sngon gyi las kyi bag chags kyis 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyun gzhan gyi mthu la srog gi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi bag chags kyis 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyun gzhan gyi mthu la srog gi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of the life faculty is the other stream of the maturation projected by the latent impressions of former actions.

original: de'i dbang gis ji srid las yod kyi bar du ris 'dra ba'i rgyun 'chad pa zhes bya ba'i 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis ji srid las yod kyi bar du ris 'dra ba'i rgyun 'chad pa zhes bya ba'i 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By its power, as long as there is karma, the stream of a similar type does not cease, and so it is called ‚Äúnon-death.‚Äù

original: ris mthun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ris mthun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a similar type?

original: gang sems can rnams kyi lus 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gang sems can rnams kyi lus 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is the similarity of bodies of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag na sems can de dang de dag gi lus dang dbang po dang dbyibs dang g-yo ba dang kha zas la sogs pa mthun par byed pa dang / phan tshun du mngon par dga' ba'i 'brel pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag na sems can de dang de dag gi lus dang dbang po dang dbyibs dang g-yo ba dang kha zas la sogs pa mthun par byed pa dang / phan tshun du mngon par dga' ba'i 'brel pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause of the connection of mutual delight among those sentient beings of this and that type of sentient beings, who have similar bodies, faculties, shapes, movements, food, and so on.

original: de la 'gro ba 'dra ba ni 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba 'dra ba ni 'dra ba ste /
translated: Among those, a similar type is a similarity.

original: lus mtshungs pa nyid kyis 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: lus mtshungs pa nyid kyis 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'o //
translated: Similarity is a similarity due to the similarity of bodies.

original: skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is birth?

original: ris mthun par gang 'du byed rnams ma byung ba las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ris mthun par gang 'du byed rnams ma byung ba las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the arising of the formations that did not exist before in a similar type.

original: ris 'dra ba ni mthun pa'o //
analyzed: ris 'dra ba ni mthun pa'o //
translated: Similar means homogeneous.

original: der 'du byed gzugs la sogs pa ma byung ba las nur nur po la sogs pa'i dbang po la skye ba zhes gdags so //
analyzed: der 'du byed gzugs la sogs pa ma byung ba las nur nur po la sogs pa'i dbang po la skye ba zhes gdags so //
translated: The arising of the faculties of the embryo, etc. is designated as the arising of the formative forces, form, etc.

original: rga ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rga ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is aging?

original: de ltar de dag gi rgyun gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi rgyun gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the transformation of the continuity of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed byung ba de dag gi nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la rga ba gdags so //
analyzed: 'du byed byung ba de dag gi nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la rga ba gdags so //
translated: The aging of the formative forces is designated in relation to the various stages of the embryo, etc.

original: gnas pa gang zhen /
analyzed: gnas pa gang zhen /
translated: What is duration?

original: de ltar de dag rgyun rgyud chags pa'o //üîΩ'du byed @24a * //
analyzed: de ltar de dag rgyun rgyud chags pa'o // 'du byed @24a * //
translated: It is the continuity of the formative forces.

original: 'byung ba de dag gi skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ma shi'i bar du nges par gnas pa la gnas pa gdags so //
analyzed: 'byung ba de dag gi skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ma shi'i bar du nges par gnas pa la gnas pa gdags so //
translated: The duration of the formative forces is designated in relation to the continuity of the stream of moments of the formative forces, from birth until death.

original: mi rtag pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is impermanence?

original: de ltar de dag gi rgyun 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi rgyun 'chad pa'o //
translated: It is the destruction of the continuity of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nges par 'byung bar gang shin tu rgyud chad pa de la mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nges par 'byung bar gang shin tu rgyud chad pa de la mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The impermanence of the formative forces is designated in relation to the destruction of the stream of moments of the formative forces.

original: de'i phyir 'chi ba rnam pa gnyis su 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba rnam pa gnyis su 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Consequently, death is established as being of two kinds:

original: rga ba dang gnas pa'i dus na skad cig ma 'chi ba dang / phung po zhig ste rgyun 'chad pa'i 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: rga ba dang gnas pa'i dus na skad cig ma 'chi ba dang / phung po zhig ste rgyun 'chad pa'i 'chi ba'o //
translated: death as momentary cessation at the time of aging and enduring; and death as the destruction of the aggregates and the interruption of the continuum.

original: bzhi po de dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: These four are the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: ming gi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of names?

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags so //
translated: It is the designation of the intrinsic nature of all things.

original: 'di lta ste mig gi ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mig gi ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, the words eye, etc.

original: tshig gi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of phrases?

original: chos rnams kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags so //
translated: It is the designation of the particularities of all things.

original: 'di lta ste kye ma 'du byed mi rtag ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste kye ma 'du byed mi rtag ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, the words impermanent, unsatisfactory, empty, nonself, etc.

original: ji tsam gyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: It is the complete expression of the object one wishes to express.

original: gang gis phyed pa dang yon tan dang / dus kyi 'brel pa'i khyad par rnams rtogs par byed ces bya'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gis phyed pa dang yon tan dang / dus kyi 'brel pa'i khyad par rnams rtogs par byed ces bya'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is that by which one understands the particularities of the expression, the qualities and the time period.

original: 'di lta ste bum pa byas zhes bya ba'i dag 'dis ni byed pa'i 'brel pa'i khyad par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bum pa byas zhes bya ba'i dag 'dis ni byed pa'i 'brel pa'i khyad par rtogs par byed do //
translated: For example, in the expression the pot is made, this indicates the special relation of agent and action.

original: lha sbyin nag po dkar po sdo ba sangs zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi 'brel pa'i khyad par ro //üîΩlha sbyin 'tshed do 'tshed bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha sbyin nag po dkar po sdo ba sangs zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi 'brel pa'i khyad par ro // lha sbyin 'tshed do 'tshed bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the expression Devadatta is white, black, and old, it indicates the special relation of quality.

original: btsos so zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus kyi 'brel ba'i khyad par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: btsos so zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus kyi 'brel ba'i khyad par rtogs par byed do //
translated: In the expression Devadatta cooks, will cook, and cooked, it indicates the special relation of time.

original: de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid mngon par brjod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid mngon par brjod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, it is called the expression of intrinsic identity.

original: byed pa dang yon tan dang dus kyi 'brel ba'i khyad par brjod pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang yon tan dang dus kyi 'brel ba'i khyad par brjod pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: It is also called the expression of the special relation of agent, action, quality, and time.

original: yi ge'i tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the collection of syllables?

original: yi ge rnams te de gnyi ga gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yi ge rnams te de gnyi ga gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the syllables, because they express both.

original: gnyi ga ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par ro //
translated: Both refers to the intrinsic identity and the specific properties of things.

original: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To express means to manifest.

original: brjod pa yang de dag yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa yang de dag yin te /
translated: They are also expressions,

original: ming dang tshig la brten nas don brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming dang tshig la brten nas don brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: because they express the meaning in dependence on names and phrases.

original: ming ni mig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni mig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Name is, for example, ‚Äúeye,‚Äù etc.

original: tshig ni mig mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ni mig mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Phrase is, for example, ‚Äúthe eye is impermanent,‚Äù etc.

original: de gnyi ga la brten nas don gyi rang bzhin dang / bye brag ces bya ba brjod pa'i phyir brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga la brten nas don gyi rang bzhin dang / bye brag ces bya ba brjod pa'i phyir brjod pa'o //
translated: They are expressions because the nature and the distinctions of the meaning are expressed in dependence on both of them.üîΩSyllables are also because they do not change into other categories.

original: @24b yi ge yang rnam grangs gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni aa zhes bya ba 'di rnam grangs gzhan gyis brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @24b yi ge yang rnam grangs gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni aa zhes bya ba 'di rnam grangs gzhan gyis brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because this syllable ‚Äúa‚Äù cannot be expressed by another category.

original: aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The syllables ‚Äúa,‚Äù etc., should also be understood in the same way.

original: so so skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: so so skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the state of being an ordinary person?üîΩIt is the non-acquisition of the qualities of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la thag ring du log pa de dag 'phags pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la thag ring du log pa de dag 'phags pa rnams te /
translated: The noble ones are those who have turned away from sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: de dag gi chos rnams ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi chos rnams ma thob pa'o //
translated: The state of being an ordinary person is the non-acquisition of their qualities.

original: 'phags pa ni sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos rnams yin na /
