analyzed: 'phags pa ni sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos rnams yin na /
translated: The noble ones are the Buddhas, the Solitary Sages, and the noble disciples.

original: de dag gang gis ma thob /
analyzed: de dag gang gis ma thob /
translated: What have they not attained?

original: smras pa / bye brag tu ma phye bas thams cad kyis ma thob ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / bye brag tu ma phye bas thams cad kyis ma thob ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that they have not attained it without distinction.

original: ma thob pa ni 'dir thob pa med par blta'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni 'dir thob pa med par blta'o //
translated: Here, non-attainment should be seen as the absence of attainment.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of formations has already been explained.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'i phung po brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'i phung po brjod par bya ste /
translated: After the aggregate of formations, the aggregate of consciousness should be mentioned.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ste ;üîΩrnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ste ; rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is consciousness?üîΩIt means the aggregate of consciousness.

original: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The awareness of objects.

original: dmigs pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Objects are of six kinds:

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams so //
translated: form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.

original: de dag khong du chud pa ni rnam par rig pa ste rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag khong du chud pa ni rnam par rig pa ste rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The awareness of them is consciousness.

original: de dag kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
translated: These are the six forms of active consciousness.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is visual consciousness?

original: mig ni rten /
analyzed: mig ni rten /
translated: The eye is its basis.

original: gzugs ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: Visible form is its object.

original: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of each.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /üîΩrna ba ni rten /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na / rna ba ni rten /
translated: What is auditory consciousness?üîΩThe ear is its basis.

original: sgra ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: Sound is its object.

original: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of each.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /üîΩsna ni rten /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na / sna ni rten /
translated: What is olfactory consciousness?üîΩThe nose is its basis.

original: dri ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dri ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: Smell is its object.

original: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of each.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /üîΩlce ni rten /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na / lce ni rten /
translated: What is gustatory consciousness?üîΩThe tongue is its basis.

original: ro ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ro ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: Taste is its object.

original: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of each.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /üîΩlus ni rten /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na / lus ni rten /
translated: What is tactile consciousness?üîΩThe body is its basis.

original: reg bya ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: reg bya ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: The tangible is its object.

original: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of each.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /üîΩyid ni rten /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na / yid ni rten /
translated: What is mental consciousness?üîΩThe manas is its basis.

original: chos ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: The mental object is its object.

original: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of each.

original: rnam grangs bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad brjod do //
analyzed: rnam grangs bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad brjod do //
translated: In order to teach the synonyms, he says:

original: sems dang yid kyang de yin te //
analyzed: sems dang yid kyang de yin te //
translated: Mind and thought are also that.

original: zhes bya'o // rnam grangs kyi don no //üîΩsna tshogs pa dang yid @25a * //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rnam grangs kyi don no // sna tshogs pa dang yid @25a * //
translated: The meaning of the synonyms.

original: rten byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rten byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is manifold and because it is the support of the mind.üîΩThe meaning of the synonyms.üîΩBecause it is manifold and because it is the support of the mind.

original: de la sna tshogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems te /
analyzed: de la sna tshogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems te /
translated: Among them, because it is manifold refers to mind.

original: sna tshogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa du ma'i bye brag gis tha dad pa rnams la ji snyed pa de snyed de /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa du ma'i bye brag gis tha dad pa rnams la ji snyed pa de snyed de /
translated: It is manifold because it is differentiated by the many aspects of form, etc., such as visual consciousness, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde'i phyir de'i dbang po las byung nas yul rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // de'i phyir de'i dbang po las byung nas yul rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is as many as there are aspects of form, etc.

original: dbang po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is called consciousness of the object that arises from its organ, not from the organ itself.

original: yid rten byed ces bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug yin la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yid rten byed ces bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug yin la gnas pa ste /
translated: Because it is the support of the mind refers to the six active forms of consciousness.

original: ji skad du /üîΩdrug po 'gag ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: ji skad du / drug po 'gag ma thag pa yi //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe consciousness that has just ceased

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: of the six sense organs is mind.

original: zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gang dang gang 'gags ma thag pa de la yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang 'gags ma thag pa de la yid ces bya'o //
translated: The mind is that which immediately ceases.

original: dper na bu de nyid gzhan gyi pha zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid gzhan gyi sa bon zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu drug po de dag nyid 'gags pa na gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa gzhan byung ba'i rten du gyur pa de'i tshe rten byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: dper na bu de nyid gzhan gyi pha zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid gzhan gyi sa bon zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu drug po de dag nyid 'gags pa na gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa gzhan byung ba'i rten du gyur pa de'i tshe rten byed ces bya'o //
translated: For example, the very same son is called the father of another, and the very same fruit is called the seed of another. In the same way, when the six effects of the evolving consciousnesses cease, and at that time become the support of another consciousness that arises, then they are called the support.

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la sems zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la sems zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, the six evolving consciousnesses are taught to be the mind.

original: dngos su na /
analyzed: dngos su na /
translated: But in reality,

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste //
translated: the mind is the store consciousness.

original: zhes bya bar blta'o //üîΩdngos sun sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya bar blta'o // dngos sun sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: This is the way it should be seen.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ma yin par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ma yin par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the mind is really the store consciousness and not the six evolving consciousnesses?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar 'di ni 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar 'di ni 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said that this is the store of the seeds of all conditioned things.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: All formations are defiled dharmas.

original: de dag ni rkyen bzhis 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rkyen bzhis 'byung ste /
translated: They arise from four conditions.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags rnams so //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags rnams so //
translated: Among them, the causal condition is the residual impressions that reside in the store consciousness.

original: bdag po'i kyen  ni dbang po drug po rnams so //
analyzed: bdag po'i kyen  ni dbang po drug po rnams so //
translated: The dominant condition is the six sense organs.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni yod do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni yod do //
translated: The condition as immediate antecedent exists.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The objective condition is form, etc.

original: de dag 'byung ba'i go rims ni mig la sogs pa rnams la yang brten gzugs la sogs pa la yang brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba'i go rims ni mig la sogs pa rnams la yang brten gzugs la sogs pa la yang brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The order of their arising is that the visual consciousness, etc., arise in dependence on the eye, etc., and form, etc.

original: byung ma thag tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa yul rnams la rtog go //
analyzed: byung ma thag tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa yul rnams la rtog go //
translated: Immediately after arising, the mental consciousness conceives of the objects.

original: rnam par rtog pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa 'byung @25b do ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa 'byung @25b do ;
translated: From conception, the defilements such as attachment arise.

original: / de la bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid 'du byed ces bya ba'i las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: / de la bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid 'du byed ces bya ba'i las 'byung ngo //
translated: In this regard, the action called ‚Äúformations‚Äù arises, which has the characteristics of merit, demerit, and immobility.

original: 'du byed ni 'dir sems par blta'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni 'dir sems par blta'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúformations‚Äù should be understood as intention.

original: skyes pa'i las de 'gags pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skyes pa'i las de 'gags pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags skyed par byed do //
translated: When the action that has arisen ceases, it produces a latent impression in the store consciousness.

original: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa la bag chags skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa la bag chags skyed par byed do //
translated: In the same way, all the dharmas of affliction produce latent impressions in the store consciousness.

original: bag chags kyi sa bon thams cad gong nas gong du sogs pa sa sems so //
analyzed: bag chags kyi sa bon thams cad gong nas gong du sogs pa sa sems so //
translated: All the seeds of the latent impressions are nourished and grow.

original: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'du byed thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du de dag kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'du byed thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du de dag kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Just as the store consciousness is the cause of all the afflicted formations, so too are they the cause of the store consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: That store consciousness is twofold:

original: rgyu zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the cause and it is called the result.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni bag chags so /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni bag chags so /
translated: ‚ÄúCause‚Äù refers to the latent impressions.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEffect‚Äù refers to the maturation.

original: sngon gyi las kyi bag chags kyis skyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi bag chags kyis skyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is produced by the latent impressions of previous karma.

original: 'di ltar gcig gi rgyu las gcig 'byung bar blta'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig gi rgyu las gcig 'byung bar blta'o //
translated: Thus, one should see that one thing arises from another.

original: dper na mar me 'bar ba dang / ras tshig par byed pa 'byung ba phan tshun dus mnyam pa dang / mdung khyim dus gcig ba gcig gis gcig brten te mi 'gyel ba ltar 'byung ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na mar me 'bar ba dang / ras tshig par byed pa 'byung ba phan tshun dus mnyam pa dang / mdung khyim dus gcig ba gcig gis gcig brten te mi 'gyel ba ltar 'byung ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: For example, just as the arising of a burning lamp and the burning of a piece of cloth are simultaneous, and just as the arising of a stack of arrows is simultaneous, and one arrow supports another so that the stack does not fall down, one should understand that the cause of arising is the store consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dmigs pa ni gang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dmigs pa ni gang /
translated: Why is it called the store consciousness? What is its object?

original: rnam pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is its aspect?

original: smras pa / de yang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde yang ci dge ba'am /
analyzed: smras pa / de yang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o zhes bya ba'o // de yang ci dge ba'am /
translated: It is said that its object and aspect are not differentiated.

original: mi dge ba zhig smras pa /
analyzed: mi dge ba zhig smras pa /
translated: Is it virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is said that it is not any of those.

original: rigs gcig ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs gcig ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and of one type.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩskad cig pa'am /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // skad cig pa'am /
translated: This means that it is of an indeterminate nature.

original: skad cig pa ma yin pa zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / rgyun chags par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin pa zhe na / smras pa / rgyun chags par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Is it momentary or not?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that it is a continuum.

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is momentary.

original: rang bzhin gcig pa de yod par ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa de yod par ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is the existence of this one nature known?

original: lung dang rigs pa las te /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa las te /
translated: It is known from scripture and reasoning.

original: lung gi bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /üîΩthog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings //üîΩchos rnams @26a * //
analyzed: lung gi bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa / thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings // chos rnams @26a * //
translated: As for scripture, the Bhagavat has said in the Abhidharma S≈´tra:

original: kun gyi gnas yin te //
analyzed: kun gyi gnas yin te //
translated: The realm without beginning is the foundation of all phenomena.

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob bar 'gyur //
translated: Because it exists, all beings and even nirvƒÅ·πáa are attained.

original: zhes bya'o // rigs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rigs pa ni /
translated: As for reasoning,

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa rnams las langs nas yul rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa rnams las langs nas yul rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, having arisen from the meditative attainment of cessation, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, and nondiscernment, the consciousness that engages objects, called the appropriating consciousness, arises in dependence on the objective condition.üîΩ

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, having arisen from the meditative attainment of cessation, the meditative attainment of nonperception, and the state of nonperception, the entry consciousness called the ‚Äúperceiver of objects‚Äù arises in dependence on the objective condition.üîΩThus means

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: for that reason.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
translated: When one enters the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug 'gag go //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug 'gag go //
translated: the six active consciousnesses cease.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa las langs nas yang yul rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa las langs nas yang yul rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: Similarly, when one enters the meditative attainment of nonperception and arises from the state of nonperception, the entry consciousness called the ‚Äúperceiver of objects‚Äù arises.

original: de'i rgyu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags so //
translated: Its cause is the latent impressions that are located in the storehouse consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: In dependence on the objective condition,

original: dmigs pa ni yul drug ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni yul drug ste /
translated: the objective condition is the six objects.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called form, sound, smell, taste, tangible objects, and entities.

original: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas mi len na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rgyu gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas mi len na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rgyu gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one does not accept the storehouse consciousness, from what cause would the six active forms of consciousness arise?

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one must accept the storehouse consciousness.üîΩIn another way, the active forms of consciousness arise from the storehouse consciousness and then return to it.

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid ces bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid ces bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba na /
translated: When the eye consciousness, etc., arise in the aspect of blue, etc., from what do they arise?

original: gang las byung ba de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang las byung ba de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: That from which they arise is the storehouse consciousness.

original: chad nas yang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis log pa dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun chad pa rnams gang las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chad nas yang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis log pa dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun chad pa rnams gang las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe arising of what has been interrupted‚Äù refers to the alaya-vijnana, from which the interrupted prav·πõtti-vij√±ƒÅnas arise when one awakens from sleep, comes out of a faint, etc.

original: 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the entry into and exit from samsara‚Äù means that

original: 'khor ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: samsara is the five appropriative aggregates.

original: de dag gi 'jug pa dang ldog pa ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'jug pa dang ldog pa ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: Their entry and exit is their coming and going.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi lus kyi rgyu'i bye brag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi lus kyi rgyu'i bye brag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The alaya-vijnana is the specific cause of such a body.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de @26b nyid ni sa bon thams cad kyi gzhi nyid dang / lus kyi kun gzhi dang rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gang yin pa de dag de la gnas te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de @26b nyid ni sa bon thams cad kyi gzhi nyid dang / lus kyi kun gzhi dang rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gang yin pa de dag de la gnas te /
translated: The alaya-vijnana is the basis of all seeds, the alaya of the body, and the cause. Thus the seeds of all afflicted dharmas reside in it.

original: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the storehouse consciousness.

original: yang na de de dag la rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa'o//
analyzed: yang na de de dag la rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa'o//
translated: Or, it is the storehouse because it is the cause of those.üîΩBecause it is the support of the body.

original: lus la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam par shes pa de lus la gnas pa de /
analyzed: lus la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam par shes pa de lus la gnas pa de /
translated: The consciousness that is the support of the body is the storehouse consciousness.

original: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the storehouse consciousness.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
translated: It is also the appropriating consciousness.

original: lus len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid len pa'i rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: lus len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid len pa'i rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: Because it appropriates the body. The storehouse consciousness is the appropriating consciousness.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sandhinirmocana Sutra says:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is deep and subtle;

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo bzhin du 'bab //üîΩbdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo bzhin du 'bab // bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: All the seeds flow in it like a river.üîΩIf I teach it to the immature,

original: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //üîΩces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They will imagine it to be a self.

original: de'i phyir len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore it is called the appropriating consciousness.

original: dbang po gzugs can thams cad len pa dang / lus thams cad len pa'i gnas yin pa dang / lus len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can thams cad len pa dang / lus thams cad len pa'i gnas yin pa dang / lus len pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it appropriates all the material faculties, because it is the basis for appropriating the entire body, and because it appropriates the body.

original: 'di ltar des dbang po gzugs can dag zin na ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi 'chi bar gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des dbang po gzugs can dag zin na ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi 'chi bar gnas so //
translated: For, when it appropriates the material faculties, one lives as long as one does not die.

original: nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa na /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa na /
translated: When it is about to be reborn,

original: yang de mngon par 'grub pa dang / len pas lus zin pa yin te /
analyzed: yang de mngon par 'grub pa dang / len pas lus zin pa yin te /
translated: it is also the appropriator of the body, because it is the basis for the actualization and appropriation of the body.

original: de'i phyir / lus len pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lus len pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it appropriates the body.‚Äù

original: dngos su na yid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos su na yid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In reality, the mental faculty has the store-consciousness as its object.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu dmigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu dmigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it has the store-consciousness as the self.

original: de ni rtag tu rlom sems ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de ni rtag tu rlom sems ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: It is always of the nature of self-conceit,

original: rtag tu bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag tu 'chag pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag tu bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag tu 'chag pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
translated: because it is always associated with self-delusion, self-view, self-pride, and self-love.

original: de'i phyir de ni kun tu 'gro ba zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni kun tu 'gro ba zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore, it is called omnipresent.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la yang 'byung ngo //
translated: It occurs in the wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral.

original: rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: It is consciousness.

original: rigs gcig ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs gcig ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is of one type means it is of the nature of affliction.

original: rgyun chags par 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun chags par 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is continuous means it is momentary.

original: de ni kun tu 'gro ba @27a * //
analyzed: de ni kun tu 'gro ba @27a * //
translated: It is omnipresent,

original: yin yang ; dgra bcom pa dang 'phags pa'i lam dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: yin yang ; dgra bcom pa dang 'phags pa'i lam dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus ma gtogs so //
translated: except in the case of an arhat, the path of the noble ones, and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi dus dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na bag chags skyed nas 'gag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi dus dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na bag chags skyed nas 'gag go //
translated: At the time of the path of the noble ones and the meditative attainment of cessation, it ceases after producing a latent imprint.

original: langs nas yang sa bon de las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: langs nas yang sa bon de las 'byung ngo //
translated: When one arises from that meditative attainment, it arises again from that seed.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dus na yongs su 'gag go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dus na yongs su 'gag go //
translated: At the time of an arhat, it is completely eliminated.

original: de ltar na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang rnam par shes pa brgyad po de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang rnam par shes pa brgyad po de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the six evolving consciousnesses, the store consciousness, and the afflicted mind are the eight forms of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness has been explained.

original: de ci'i phyir phung po zhes bya zhe na /üîΩzhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir phung po zhes bya zhe na / zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Why is it called an aggregate?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / spungs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / spungs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is a heap.

original: spungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: spungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known that it is a heap?

original: 'dir smras pa dus dang / rgyud dang / rnam pa dang / 'gro ba dang / yul tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mdor bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa dus dang / rgyud dang / rnam pa dang / 'gro ba dang / yul tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mdor bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here it is said: because form, etc., which differ in time, life-stream, aspect, realm, and object, are subsumed in it.

original: spungs pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spungs pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: It is to be understood as a heap in the sense of a collection.

original: dus tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Form, etc., which differ in time, etc., should be understood in the same way.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that the aggregates of feeling, perception, formations, and consciousness should be understood in the same way.

original: de la 'das pa'i gzugs ni 'das pa'i dus te /
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i gzugs ni 'das pa'i dus te /
translated: Past form is that which occurred in the past time period.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because its cause and effect have already been experienced.

original: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs ni da ltar byung ba'i dus te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs ni da ltar byung ba'i dus te /
translated: Present form is that which occurs in the present time period.

original: rgyu ni spyad zin la 'bras bu ni spyad ma zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩma 'ongs pa'i gzugs ni /
analyzed: rgyu ni spyad zin la 'bras bu ni spyad ma zin pa'i phyir ro // ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs ni /
translated: This is because its cause has already been experienced, but its effect has not yet been experienced.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus te /
translated: Future form is that which will occur in the future time period.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad ma zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyud ces bya ba ni so so'i rgyud de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad ma zin pa'i phyir ro // rgyud ces bya ba ni so so'i rgyud de /
translated: This is because neither its cause nor its effect have yet been experienced.üîΩThe term ‚Äúseries‚Äù refers to the individual series of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the aggregates are included within this term.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúaspect‚Äù refers to the aspects of form, etc., such as blue, yellow, etc.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lnga ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lnga ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúworld‚Äù refers to the five world spheres.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dang / mi dang / lha'i 'gro ba rnams so //üîΩlha ma yin gyi 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dang / mi dang / lha'i 'gro ba rnams so // lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba ni /
translated: The destinies of hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals, humans, and gods.

original: lha dang yi dvags kyi 'gro bar 'dus pa'i phyir gud dum smos so //
analyzed: lha dang yi dvags kyi 'gro bar 'dus pa'i phyir gud dum smos so //
translated: The destiny of antigods is not mentioned separately because it is included in the destinies of gods and hungry ghosts.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag ni gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de @27b dag ni 'gro ba tha dad pas tha dad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag ni gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de @27b dag ni 'gro ba tha dad pas tha dad par rig par bya'o //
translated: These destinies are distinguished by the different forms, etc., that exist in them.

original: yul tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni nub kyi ba lang spyod la sogs pas tha dad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni nub kyi ba lang spyod la sogs pas tha dad par rig par bya'o //
translated: The forms, etc., of different realms are distinguished by the different forms, etc., of Godaniya, etc.

original: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa du ma mdor bsdus pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa du ma mdor bsdus pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, form, etc., are called the aggregates of form, etc., because they are a collection of many forms, etc.

original: ci'i phyir phung po'i don de skad brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po'i don de skad brjod ce na /
translated: Why is the meaning of aggregate explained in this way?

original: 'jig rten na mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is seen in the world.

original: dper na gang du ma zlum pa de la phung po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dper na gang du ma zlum pa de la phung po zhes bya ste /
translated: For example, that which is not round is called an aggregate.

original: 'bru'i phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bru'i phung po bzhin no //
translated: It is like a pile of grain.

original: phung po rnams ni btags pa'i yod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams ni btags pa'i yod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The aggregates are shown to be nominally existent.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis ni mig gi skye mched nas /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis ni mig gi skye mched nas /
translated: The twelve sense bases are from the eye sense base up to the

original: chos kyi skye mched kyi bar du'o //üîΩmig la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du bshad do zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du gzugs kyi phung por gang mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga bstan pa de dag nyid mig la sogs pa'i skye mched du blta bar bya'o //üîΩde nyid du gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yul lnga bstan pa de dag ni gzugs kyi skye mched nas /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyi bar du'o // mig la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du bshad do zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du gzugs kyi phung por gang mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga bstan pa de dag nyid mig la sogs pa'i skye mched du blta bar bya'o // de nyid du gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yul lnga bstan pa de dag ni gzugs kyi skye mched nas /
translated: dharma sense base.üîΩThe eye and so on are explained as before.üîΩThis means that the five faculties such as the eye that were taught as the form aggregate should be viewed as the eye sense base and so on.

original: reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar gyi skye mched lngar blta bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar gyi skye mched lngar blta bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The five objects such as form that were taught there should be viewed as the five sense bases from the form sense base up to the tangible object sense base.

original: dar reg bya'i skye mched ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi gang yin pa dang / 'jam pa la sogs pa reg bya'i phyogs gcig bshad pa gang yin pa de ltar reg bya rnam pa bcu gcig po de dag ni reg bya'i skye mched du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dar reg bya'i skye mched ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi gang yin pa dang / 'jam pa la sogs pa reg bya'i phyogs gcig bshad pa gang yin pa de ltar reg bya rnam pa bcu gcig po de dag ni reg bya'i skye mched du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the eleven types of tangibles should be known as the tangible sense base.

original: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa ste /
translated: The mind sense base is the consciousness aggregate.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang gong du bshad pa de nyid yid kyi skye mched du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang gong du bshad pa de nyid yid kyi skye mched du rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind sense base should be known as the consciousness aggregate that was explained above.

original: chos kyi skye mched ni gang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched ni gang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du /
translated: The phenomena sense base is feeling, perception, volitional factors, non-informative form, and unconditioned phenomena.

original: chos kyi skye mched ni rdzas brgyad po ste /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched ni rdzas brgyad po ste /
translated: The phenomena sense base is the eight substances.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang /
translated: the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of formations, non-informative matter, space, the cessation due to deliberation, the cessation not due to deliberation,

original: de bzhin nyid ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the real nature.

original: de ltar na phung po gsum dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar na phung po gsum dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, the three aggregates and non-informative matter have been explained.

original: 'dus ma byas ma bshad pas 'dir smras @28a * //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma bshad pas 'dir smras @28a * //
translated: Since the unconditioned has not been explained, it is said here:

original: pa ; 'dus ma byas gang zhe na /
analyzed: pa ; 'dus ma byas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the unconditioned?

original: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Space, the cessation due to deliberation, the cessation not due to deliberation, and the real nature.

original: gang rkyen rnams las ma byung ba de ni 'dus ma byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang rkyen rnams las ma byung ba de ni 'dus ma byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: That which does not arise from conditions should be known as the unconditioned.

original: bzlog pa ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'dus byas so //
translated: The opposite is the conditioned.

original: de la nam mkha' gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' gang zhe na /
translated: What is space?

original: gzugs kyi go 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi go 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of matter.

original: 'di'i nang du dngos po shin tu snang bas nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: 'di'i nang du dngos po shin tu snang bas nam mkha' ste /
translated: Space is the nonobstruction of matter.

original: de ni gzugs kyi go 'byed pa tsam du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi go 'byed pa tsam du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that space is merely the nonobstruction of matter.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-analytical cessation?

original: gang 'gog pa bral ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'gog pa bral ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is cessation that is not liberation.

original: de ni gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par phung po rnams gtan du mi skye'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par phung po rnams gtan du mi skye'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the non-arising of the aggregates due to the absence of the conditions and not due to the antidote to the defilements.

original: so sor brtags pa med pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa med pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-analytical means not analytical.

original: gang des 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: gang des 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
translated: Cessation by that is non-analytical cessation.

original: blo sngon du ma btang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo sngon du ma btang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means not preceded by the intellect.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: yul gcig la blo gtad pa na de'i tshe de las gzhan pa yul gzugs la sogs pa 'gags na rten de dang dmigs pa la rag las te skye ba'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa rnams rgyu dang dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen
analyzed: yul gcig la blo gtad pa na de'i tshe de las gzhan pa yul gzugs la sogs pa 'gags na rten de dang dmigs pa la rag las te skye ba'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa rnams rgyu dang dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen
translated: when the mind is focused on one object, at that time the form and so on that is different from that object ceases. The future eye consciousness and so on that arises in dependence on that basis and object arises in dependence on the dominant condition of the eye faculty and so on and the object condition of form and so on.

original: tshogs su zin kyang bzhi pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs su zin kyang bzhi pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if they are a collection, the fourth condition, the similar and immediately antecedent condition, is absent.

original: mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ste /
translated: The non-arising of factors is the cessation not due to deliberation.

original: de ni bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni bral ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not a separation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the antidote to the defilements.

original: de yang phung po rnams gtan du mi skye bar blta ste /
analyzed: de yang phung po rnams gtan du mi skye bar blta ste /
translated: It is the non-arising of the aggregates for all eternity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i yul ni de ltar yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i yul ni de ltar yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the objects of the five sense consciousnesses are of this nature.

original: de dag 'das pa'i yul la dmigs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag 'das pa'i yul la dmigs par mi nus so //
translated: They cannot have a past object.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is cessation due to deliberation?

original: gang 'gog pa de ni bral ba ste /
analyzed: gang 'gog pa de ni bral ba ste /
translated: Cessation is a separation.

original: de ni gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos phung po rnams gtan du mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos phung po rnams gtan du mi skye ba'o //
translated: It is the non-arising of the aggregates due to the antidote to the defilements.

original: so sor brtags pa zhes bya ba ni 'bad pas grub pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa zhes bya ba ni 'bad pas grub pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Deliberation is the wisdom that is accomplished through effort.

original: des bden pa bzhi la so sor rtog go //
analyzed: des bden pa bzhi la so sor rtog go //
translated: It is the discernment of the four noble truths.

original: yang na so sor rang gi bden pa so sor yang dag par rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: yang na so sor rang gi bden pa so sor yang dag par rtogs pa ni /
translated: Or else, the truth of each is realized individually,

original: so sor brtags pa ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ste /
translated: and that is the ‚Äúdiscernment‚Äù of each.

original: mngon sum du byed bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are made manifest.

original: des thob pa'i 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: des thob pa'i 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation that is attained by that is the cessation due to discernment.

original: yang na so sor @28b rtogs pa nyid so sor brtags pa ste /
analyzed: yang na so sor @28b rtogs pa nyid so sor brtags pa ste /
translated: Or else, discernment itself is the discernment,

original: shes rab kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi bye brag go //
translated: which is a particular kind of wisdom.

original: des thob par bya ba ste /
analyzed: des thob par bya ba ste /
translated: It is that which is to be attained by that.

original: thob pa'i sgra ni tshig par mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa'i sgra ni tshig par mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúattained‚Äù is used because it is not manifest.

original: dper na glang dang ldan pa'i shing rta la glang gi shing rta zhes bya ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na glang dang ldan pa'i shing rta la glang gi shing rta zhes bya ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, a cart yoked to oxen is called an ‚Äúox-cart,‚Äù

original: ldan pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word ‚Äúyoked‚Äù is not manifest.

original: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba ste /
translated: That is the separation from the dharmas with ƒÅ≈õravas.

original: de'i phyir de ni gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúthat is the non-arising of that by the antidote to the defilements.‚Äù

original: thar pa zhes bya ba de thob na nyon mongs pa rnams gtan du mi skye ste /
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba de thob na nyon mongs pa rnams gtan du mi skye ste /
translated: When that is attained, which is called ‚Äúliberation,‚Äù the defilements do not arise forever.

original: nges par 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a definite cessation.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called cessation through deliberation.

original: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is suchness?

original: gang chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: It is the true nature of things, the selflessness of things.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is suchness because it is not otherwise.

original: chos rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The things are form, etc.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba ni gang de dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba ni gang de dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The true nature of things is their intrinsic nature.

original: chos bdag med pa ji ltar ngo bo nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa ji ltar ngo bo nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How can the selflessness of things be their intrinsic nature?

original: 'di ltar snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams rnam par spyad na ngo bo nyid du mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams rnam par spyad na ngo bo nyid du mi gnas so //
translated: Because when the things called ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù etc., are investigated, their intrinsic nature is not found.

original: ji ltar snam bu snam bu'i ngo bor ma grub pa de bzhin du rgyu skud pa yang rgyu skud pa'i ngo bor ma grub ste /
analyzed: ji ltar snam bu snam bu'i ngo bor ma grub pa de bzhin du rgyu skud pa yang rgyu skud pa'i ngo bor ma grub ste /
translated: Just as cloth is not established as the intrinsic nature of cloth, so also thread is not established as the intrinsic nature of thread.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩcha shas kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / cha shas kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it has parts.

original: cha shas rnams kyang cha shas rnams kyi ngo bor ma grub ste /
analyzed: cha shas rnams kyang cha shas rnams kyi ngo bor ma grub ste /
translated: The parts also are not established as the intrinsic nature of the parts.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nyag ma'i cha'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyag ma'i cha'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the nature of a part of a part.

original: nyag ma'i cha la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyag ma'i cha la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The parts of a part, etc., should be understood in the same way.

original: de ltar chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par blta'o //
translated: Thus, all dharmas should be seen as lacking own-being.

original: ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called ƒÅyatanas?üîΩBecause they are the doors of arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug skye ba'i sgor gyur pa de'i phyir skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug skye ba'i sgor gyur pa de'i phyir skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Because the six kinds of consciousness, together with their associates, arise as doors through the twelve ƒÅyatanas, therefore they are called ƒÅyatanas.

original: nges pa'i tshig tu na sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched do ;
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig tu na sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched do ;
translated: In the etymological explanation, ƒÅyatana means that which causes the arising of mind and mental activities.

original: / mched pa ni rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: / mched pa ni rgyas pa ste /
translated: ƒÄyatana means expansion.

original: rgyas bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyas bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that which causes expansion.

original: skye mched rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: skye mched rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The ƒÅyatanas have been explained.

original: khams bco brgyad ni zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad ni zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: The eighteen constituents should be stated.

original: de dag smras pa /
analyzed: de dag smras pa /
translated: They are stated:

original: mig gi khams dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The eye constituent, and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang gzugs la @29a * //üîΩsogs pa'i skye mched rnams ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du gang dag mig la sogs pa'i skye mched lnga dang / gang yang yul gzugs la sogs pa de dag skye mched du bstan pa de dag nyid mig la sogs pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang gzugs la @29a * // sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du gang dag mig la sogs pa'i skye mched lnga dang / gang yang yul gzugs la sogs pa de dag skye mched du bstan pa de dag nyid mig la sogs pa'i khams dang /
translated: The constituents of the eye, etc., and the sense spheres of form, etc.üîΩare just as they are explained.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i khams su blta bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i khams su blta bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is to say: the five sense spheres of the eye, etc., and the objects of form, etc., which are taught as the sense spheres, should be understood as the eye constituent, etc., and the form constituent, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rna ba dang sna dang / lce dang lus zhes bya ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rna ba dang sna dang / lce dang lus zhes bya ba bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: yul rnams la yang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba'i skye mched rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: yul rnams la yang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba'i skye mched rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The objects of sound, smells, tastes, and tangible objects are included in the sense spheres.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po 'di dag ni mig la sogs pa dag la brten te gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po 'di dag ni mig la sogs pa dag la brten te gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang /
translated: The six elements of consciousness are the awareness of the objective realm, based on the eye, etc.

original: yid ces bya ba'i khams rnams ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gi rten yin la /
analyzed: yid ces bya ba'i khams rnams ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gi rten yin la /
translated: The elements called eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are the bases of the six consciousnesses of eye, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi khams drug gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khams drug gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The six external elements, form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and object, are the objective realms.

original: de ni 'di skad du drug pa gnyis las rnam par shes pa'i khams drug 'byung ngo zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du drug pa gnyis las rnam par shes pa'i khams drug 'byung ngo zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that the six consciousnesses arise from the two sets of six.

original: yid kyi khams zhes smos pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug las kyi yid kyi khams zhes bya ba gud na yod dam smras pa /
analyzed: yid kyi khams zhes smos pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug las kyi yid kyi khams zhes bya ba gud na yod dam smras pa /
translated: The element of mind is mentioned, but is the operative consciousnesses of eye, etc., the element of mental consciousness?

original: gzhan gang yang med de /
analyzed: gzhan gang yang med de /
translated: No, there is no other.

original: de dag nyid 'gag ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid 'gag ma thag pa ste /
translated: The immediately preceding cessation of those very six sense objects

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gi rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gi rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: is the cause of the six sense spheres of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan skyed pa la yid kyi khams zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan skyed pa la yid kyi khams zhes bya'o ;
translated: That which generates another consciousness is called the mind element.

original: / gzhan du na ni gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir khams bcu bdun nam khams bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gzhan du na ni gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir khams bcu bdun nam khams bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, since one would be included in the other, there would be seventeen or twelve elements.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga'i rten ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba yin na rnam par shes pa drug pa gang la brten nas 'byung ba'i gnas gang yang med pas /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga'i rten ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba yin na rnam par shes pa drug pa gang la brten nas 'byung ba'i gnas gang yang med pas /
translated: The support of the five beginning with eye consciousness is called the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body. But since there is no basis on which the sixth consciousness arises,

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa drug pa'i rten bstan pa dang / khams bco brgyad du bskang ba'i phyir yid kyi khams 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa drug pa'i rten bstan pa dang / khams bco brgyad du bskang ba'i phyir yid kyi khams 'dod do //
translated: the mind element is asserted in order to indicate the support of the sixth consciousness and to complete the enumeration of eighteen elements.

original: de ltar na gzugs kyi phung po gang yin pa de ni skye mched dang / khams bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched @29b dang khams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni phung po rnam par gzhag pa la gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs kyi phung po gang yin pa de ni skye mched dang / khams bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched @29b dang khams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni phung po rnam par gzhag pa la gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: Thus, the form aggregate is ten bases and ten elements, and one part of the phenomena base and element.

original: de nyid skye mched rnam par gzhags pa na skye mched bcu ste /
analyzed: de nyid skye mched rnam par gzhags pa na skye mched bcu ste /
translated: When it is classified as the bases, it is the ten bases.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched rnams so //
translated: The eye base, the ear, nose, tongue, and body bases, and the form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible bases.

original: chos kyi skye mched dang / khams kyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni der rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched dang / khams kyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni der rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The phenomena base and element are one part of that, namely, imperceptible form.

original: de dag nyid khams bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid khams bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: Those same [ten bases] should be understood as the eleven elements.

original: mig gi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: The eye element up to the tangible element.

original: de ltar gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dbye'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dbye'o //
translated: Thus, the form aggregate is differentiated.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa de ni yid kyi skye mched dang / sems kyi khams bdun no zhes bya ba ni phung po rnam par gzhag pa la rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //üîΩde nyid skye mched rnam par gzhag pa na yid kyi skye mched do //üîΩsems kyi khams bdun ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa de ni yid kyi skye mched dang / sems kyi khams bdun no zhes bya ba ni phung po rnam par gzhag pa la rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o // de nyid skye mched rnam par gzhag pa na yid kyi skye mched do // sems kyi khams bdun ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the sense-sphere of the mental faculty when it is defined as a sense-sphere.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //üîΩde ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so // de ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang /
translated: The seven elements of consciousness are the element of visual consciousness, the element of auditory consciousness, the element of olfactory consciousness, the element of gustatory consciousness, the element of tactile consciousness, the element of mental faculty and the element of mental consciousness.

original: khams dang skye mched du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the aggregate of consciousness is also defined as a sense-sphere and as an element.üîΩThe aggregate of consciousness is defined as a sense-sphere and as an element.

original: gzhan phung po gsum po gang yin pa tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed ces bya ba dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang ; 'dus ma byas rnam pa bzhi po nam mkha' dang /
analyzed: gzhan phung po gsum po gang yin pa tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed ces bya ba dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang ; 'dus ma byas rnam pa bzhi po nam mkha' dang /
translated: The non-informative form is a part of the form aggregate. The four types of unconditioned phenomena are space,üîΩnon-analytical cessation, analytical cessation, and suchness.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags ba'i 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de ltar rdzas brgyad po 'di ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags ba'i 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de ltar rdzas brgyad po 'di ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these eight substances should be known as the phenomena base and the phenomena element.

original: de ltar phung po lnga po dag skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga po dag skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the five aggregates are taught as the twelve bases and the eighteen elements.

original: ci'i phyir khams zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khams zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called elements?

original: byed pa med la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa med la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'o //
translated: They are called elements because they are the bases of action and the bearers of their own characteristics.

original: byed pa med pa ni mig gi khams gang gi tshe mig gi khams gzhan skyed pa de'i tshe de 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi khams @30a * //
analyzed: byed pa med pa ni mig gi khams gang gi tshe mig gi khams gzhan skyed pa de'i tshe de 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi khams @30a * //
translated: The eye element that generates another eye element does not think, I generate this eye element.üîΩ

original: bskyed par bya'o snyam du mi sems pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya'o snyam du mi sems pa'o //
translated: The inactive is the eye element, for when it generates another eye element, it does not think, ‚ÄúI generate the eye element.‚Äù

original: khams bcu bdun la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //üîΩci'i phyir phung po la sogs pa bshad ce na zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: khams bcu bdun la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o // ci'i phyir phung po la sogs pa bshad ce na zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The seventeen elements should be understood in the same way.üîΩWhy are the aggregates, etc., taught?

original: 'di ltar phung po las gud na skye mched rnams dang / khams rnams med do /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po las gud na skye mched rnams dang / khams rnams med do /
translated: Some think that since the sense bases and elements do not exist apart from the aggregates,

original: de'i phyir phung po bshad pa nyid kyis yongs su rdzogs pa /üîΩskye mched dang khams bshad par mi bya'o snyam du sems pa la smras pa /üîΩbdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen por bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po bshad pa nyid kyis yongs su rdzogs pa / skye mched dang khams bshad par mi bya'o snyam du sems pa la smras pa / bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen por bya ba nyid de /
translated: the teaching of the aggregates alone is sufficient.üîΩThe aggregates, etc., are taught as antidotes to the three kinds of self-habits.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum ni gcig pur 'dzin pa dang / za bar 'dzin pa dang byed par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum ni gcig pur 'dzin pa dang / za bar 'dzin pa dang byed par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of self-habits are the habit of conceiving a self as unitary, the habit of conceiving a self as the experiencer, and the habit of conceiving a self as the agent.

original: gcig pur 'dzin zhes bya ba ni phung po la ril por bdag tu 'dzin pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pur 'dzin zhes bya ba ni phung po la ril por bdag tu 'dzin pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase grasping at unity means grasping the aggregates as a self that is a whole.

original: za bar 'dzin pa ni gang yul la spyod pa de la bdag yin par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: za bar 'dzin pa ni gang yul la spyod pa de la bdag yin par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase grasping at the experiencer means grasping the one who experiences objects as a self.

original: byed par 'dzin zhes bya ba ni gang byed ba dang ldan pas byed pa de bdag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: byed par 'dzin zhes bya ba ni gang byed ba dang ldan pas byed pa de bdag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase grasping at the agent means grasping the one who possesses action and performs action as a self.

original: de ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum bzlog pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams bshad par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum bzlog pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams bshad par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the Blessed Buddhas taught the aggregates, the bases, and the elements in order to counteract these three types of grasping at a self.

original: khams bco brgyad la gzugs can du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad la gzugs can du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: How many of the eighteen elements are material?

original: gang dag gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du'o /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du'o /
translated: Those that are of the nature of the form aggregate are the eye element and the form element, up to the body element and the tangible-object element.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa du zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are not material?

original: lhag ma rnams so bya ba ni brgyad de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi bar du'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams so bya ba ni brgyad de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi bar du'o //
translated: The rest are the eight remaining elements, from the eye consciousness element to the dharma element.

original: khams bcva brgyad po de dag la bstan du yod pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //üîΩgzugs kyi khams gcig ste /
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad po de dag la bstan du yod pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o // gzugs kyi khams gcig ste /
translated: How many of the eighteen elements are visible?üîΩOne element is visible.

original: yul bstan du yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni yul bstan du yod pa ste /üîΩ'di ni 'di na'o //
analyzed: yul bstan du yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni yul bstan du yod pa ste / 'di ni 'di na'o //
translated: The visible form element is visible.üîΩIt is possible to point to it and say, ‚ÄúIt is here,‚Äù

original: pha bi ni pha bi na'o zhes bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha bi ni pha bi na'o zhes bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or ‚ÄúIt is there.‚Äù

original: khams bcu bdun ni bstan du med pa zhes bya bar grub pa yin no ;
analyzed: khams bcu bdun ni bstan du med pa zhes bya bar grub pa yin no ;
translated: The other seventeen elements are established as invisible.

original: / khams bco brgyad pa de dag la thogs pa dang bcas pa du zhe na /
analyzed: / khams bco brgyad pa de dag la thogs pa dang bcas pa du zhe na /
translated: How many of the eighteen elements are resistant?

original: gzugs can bcu ste /
analyzed: gzugs can bcu ste /
translated: Ten elements are resistant.

original: gang la gang thogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang la gang thogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are resistant to each other.

original: gzugs ni mig la yang thogs te /
analyzed: gzugs ni mig la yang thogs te /
translated: Visible form is resistant to the eye,

original: dbang po gzhan gyi yul gyi dngos por mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyi yul gyi dngos por mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not enter into the domain of another sense faculty.

original: de bzhin du @30b gzhan brgyad la yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du @30b gzhan brgyad la yang rig par bya ste /
translated: The same should be understood for the other eight sense-spheres,

original: rna ba nas reg bya'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rna ba nas reg bya'i bar du'o //
translated: from the ear to the body.

original: gzhan ni thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: The other sense-spheres are not resistant:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas chos kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas chos kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: from the visual consciousness to the sense-element of factors.

original: khams bco brgyad po de dag zag pa dang bcas pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po de dag zag pa dang bcas pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o /
translated: How many of the eighteen elements are impure?

original: bco lnga ni zag ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bco lnga ni zag ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Fifteen elements are impure.

original: tha ma gsum gyi cha ni tha mar bstan pas tha ma ste /
analyzed: tha ma gsum gyi cha ni tha mar bstan pas tha ma ste /
translated: The last three elements are called the last because they are mentioned last.

original: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: They are the mental faculty, the object of mental consciousness, and the mental consciousness.

original: de dag gi phyogs gcig ni zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs gcig ni zag pa med pa ste /
translated: One part of these three elements is pure.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
translated: The unconditioned factors are called pure.

original: khams bco lnga ni mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
analyzed: khams bco lnga ni mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
translated: Fifteen elements: the eye element, the form element, the visual consciousness element,

original: de bzhin du lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: and so on up to the body element, the tangible-object element, and the tactile consciousness element.

original: zag pa dang lhan cig byung bas zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang lhan cig byung bas zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are associated with the contaminants because they occur together with the contaminants.

original: zag pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The contaminants are the afflictions.

original: de dag ji ltar zag pa rnams dang bcas pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar zag pa rnams dang bcas pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How are they associated with the contaminants?

original: de dag nyon mongs pa skye ba'i mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig la brten /
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs pa skye ba'i mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig la brten /
translated: Because they are the direct objects of the arising of the afflictions.

original: gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
