analyzed: gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas myong ba'i gzugs rnams yid kyi rnam par shes pas rtog go //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas myong ba'i gzugs rnams yid kyi rnam par shes pas rtog go //
translated: The forms that are experienced by eye consciousness are conceptualized by mental consciousness.

original: rnam par rtog pa las nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: The afflictions arise from conceptualization.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the remaining [sense spheres].

original: zag pa med pa du zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are uncontaminated?

original: tha ma gsum gyi cha'o zhes bya ba ni yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / de gsum gyi cha ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: tha ma gsum gyi cha'o zhes bya ba ni yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / de gsum gyi cha ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: A portion of the last three. The mental element, the mental consciousness element, and the part of the phenomena element that is not associated with consciousness are the three uncontaminated elements.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called unconditioned.

original: yang na gang gi tshe de dag 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus par gyur pa de'i tshe zag pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩkhams bco brgyad po de dag la 'dod pa dang / rab tu ldan pa du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gang gi tshe de dag 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus par gyur pa de'i tshe zag pa med par 'gyur ro // khams bco brgyad po de dag la 'dod pa dang / rab tu ldan pa du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: Or, when they are included in the noble path, they are uncontaminated.üîΩHow many of the eighteen elements are related to the desire realm?

original: 'dod pa dang / rab tu ldan pa du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩldan pa ni zin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / rab tu ldan pa du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ldan pa ni zin pa ste /
translated: How many are related to the desire realm? This means how many are related to the desire realm.üîΩRelated means possessed.

original: rab tu ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means related.

original: thams cad do zhes bya ba ni bco brgyad do //
analyzed: thams cad do zhes bya ba ni bco brgyad do //
translated: All of them means eighteen.

original: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa du zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are related to the form realm?

original: bcu bzhi ste /üîΩdri dang / ro dang / sna dang / lce'i rna @31a * //
analyzed: bcu bzhi ste / dri dang / ro dang / sna dang / lce'i rna @31a * //
translated: Fourteen.üîΩExcept for the elements of smell, taste, nose consciousness, and tongue consciousness.

original: par shes pa ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du gzugs kyi khams na dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams med de /
analyzed: par shes pa ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du gzugs kyi khams na dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams med de /
translated: This means that in the form realm there are no elements of smell and taste.

original: de dag kham gyis za ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kham gyis za ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from attachment to the desire to eat solid food.

original: dri dang ro med pa'i phyir de la 'dzin pa'i sna dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams yang med do //
analyzed: dri dang ro med pa'i phyir de la 'dzin pa'i sna dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams yang med do //
translated: There is no olfactory or gustatory consciousness element there, because there is no smell or taste.

original: lhag ma bcu bzhi ni yod do //
analyzed: lhag ma bcu bzhi ni yod do //
translated: The remaining fourteen exist there.

original: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa du zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are associated with the formless realm?

original: tha ma gsum mo zhes bya ba ni yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: tha ma gsum mo zhes bya ba ni yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: The last three are associated with the formless realm, namely, the mind element, the entity element, and the mind-consciousness element.

original: mi ldan pa du zhe na gsum gyi cha'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi ldan pa du zhe na gsum gyi cha'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag zag pa med pa'o //
translated: How many are not associated? Three parts. The three parts that are not associated are those that are uncontaminated.

original: 'dir phung por bsdus pa du zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir phung por bsdus pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are included in the aggregates?

original: 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: All are included in the aggregates, except for the part that is unconditioned.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdus pa du zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdus pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are included in the appropriating aggregates?

original: gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: Those that are contaminated are included in the appropriating aggregates.

original: dge ba du mi dge ba du lung du ma bstan pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba du mi dge ba du lung du ma bstan pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: How many are virtuous, how many are nonvirtuous, and how many are indeterminate?

original: bcu ni rnam pa gsum char te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcu ni rnam pa gsum char te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ten are of three kinds.

original: bcu ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang yang yin no //
analyzed: bcu ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang yang yin no //
translated: The ten are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: bcu gang zhe na /üîΩsems kyi khams bdun ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na / sems kyi khams bdun ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
translated: Which ten?

original: yid kyi khams kyi bar dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: yid kyi khams kyi bar dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / chos kyi khams so //
translated: The seven mental constituents, from the eye-consciousness constituent to the mind constituent, the form constituent, the sound constituent, and the entity constituent.üîΩThe remaining eight are indeterminate.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya zhes bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya zhes bya ba rnams te /
translated: The eight are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, smell, taste, and tangible-object constituents.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge bar lung du bstan du med pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge bar lung du bstan du med pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called indeterminate because they are not declared to be virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: nang gi du zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi du zhe na /
translated: Which are internal?

original: bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: bcu gnyis te /
translated: Twelve are internal.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and the seven mental constituents from the eye-consciousness constituent to the mind constituent.

original: bdag yod pa ma yin na nang dang phyi zhes ji skad du bya /
analyzed: bdag yod pa ma yin na nang dang phyi zhes ji skad du bya /
translated: If there is no self, how can there be internal and external?

original: so so'i lus kyi sems kyi rgyud de la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa ni bdag ste /
analyzed: so so'i lus kyi sems kyi rgyud de la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa ni bdag ste /
translated: The self is that which generates the pride ‚ÄúI am‚Äù in relation to the continuum of mind and body.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas nang zhes bya'o //üîΩdmigs pa dang bcas pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de dag la dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di la rnam par shes pa lnga'i khams ni yul dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas nang zhes bya'o // dmigs pa dang bcas pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de dag la dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir te / 'di la rnam par shes pa lnga'i khams ni yul dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa ste /
translated: From the perspective of the self, the internal is said to be the self‚Äôs own body.üîΩHow many have objects?üîΩThe five elements of consciousness are said to have objects because they apprehend objects.

original: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyul la brda mi byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro // yul la brda mi byed pa yang yin te /
translated: The five elements of consciousness are said to have objects because they apprehend objects.

original: ming dang yi ger byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang yi ger byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are said to not make signs in regard to objects because they are not able to make names and letters.

original: de las bzlog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su rig @31b par bya'o ;
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su rig @31b par bya'o ;
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the element of mental consciousness.

original: / de dag kyang sems kyi khams bdun zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: / de dag kyang sems kyi khams bdun zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: The seven elements of consciousness are the element of eye consciousness up to the element of mental consciousness.

original: chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig kyang yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig kyang yin te /
translated: One part of the element of mental objects is also like that.

original: gang sems las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po rnams so //
analyzed: gang sems las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po rnams so //
translated: The mental factors are the aggregates of feeling, perception, and formations.

original: dmigs pa med pa du zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are not objects?

original: lhag ma bcu ni gzugs can dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs te /
analyzed: lhag ma bcu ni gzugs can dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs te /
translated: The remaining ten are the form element and part of the phenomena element.

original: sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are not mental factors.

original: khams bco brgyad po de dag la /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po de dag la /
translated: How many of the eighteen elementsüîΩare conceptual?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: The question is: How many are conceptual?

original: yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ; chos kyi khams kyi phyogs so zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ; chos kyi khams kyi phyogs so zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The answer is: The mind element, the mind consciousness element, and part of the phenomena element.

original: zin pa du zhe na /
analyzed: zin pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are appropriated?

original: nang gi lnga ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi lnga ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The five internal ones are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: bzhi ni phyogs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi ni phyogs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Four are part of the elements.

original: phyogs ni gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams kyi'o /
analyzed: phyogs ni gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams kyi'o /
translated: Part of the elements means part of the form, smell, taste, and tangible-object elements.

original: zhes bya ba ni lus la gzugs la sogs pa yod pa de dag zin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus la gzugs la sogs pa yod pa de dag zin pa'o //
translated: The internal ones are those that are appropriated, because they are appropriated by the mind.

original: gang dag phyi rol du gyur pa de dag ni zin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag phyi rol du gyur pa de dag ni zin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The external ones are those that are not appropriated.

original: bsten pa mtshungs pa du zhe na /
analyzed: bsten pa mtshungs pa du zhe na /
translated: What is similar in support?

original: nang gi gzugs can lnga ste /
analyzed: nang gi gzugs can lnga ste /
translated: The five internal ones that have form.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba rnams so //üîΩrang gi rnam par shes pa dag gis rang gi yul dang mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi bstan pa ni mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba rnams so // rang gi rnam par shes pa dag gis rang gi yul dang mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi bstan pa ni mtshungs pa ste /
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.üîΩBecause they are similar in support to their own consciousnesses and their own objects.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculty, object, and consciousness are similar in support, because they are grasped as the object of that consciousness.

original: cha mtshungs pa dang / rig pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cha mtshungs pa dang / rig pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are similar in part, and similar in cognition.

original: de ni 'di skad du gang rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig de la mtshungs pa zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gang rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig de la mtshungs pa zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This means that the eye that possesses consciousness is taught to be similar.

original: de dag dang mtshungs pa du zhe na /
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs pa du zhe na /
translated: What is similar to them?

original: de dag nyid rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa ste /
translated: They are empty of their own consciousnesses,üîΩbecause they are similar to their own type.

original: rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa med pa'i mig la de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa med pa'i mig la de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The eye that is without consciousness is said to be similar to that.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus la yang de bzhin du rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus la yang de bzhin du rig bar bya'o //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, and body should be understood in the same way.

original: phung po lnga'i 'grel pa slob dpon yon tan 'od kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i 'grel pa slob dpon yon tan 'od kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the five aggregates composed by the master Gunaprabha is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
